topic: Centrally Sponsored Educational Institutes in Maharashtra
from: ['Tadas, Shri Ramdas Chandrabhanji', 'Sule, Smt. Supriya Sadanand']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) a comprehensive list of Centrally sponsored educational institutes established in Maharashtra since the year 2014 containing the details such as the courses offered, number of students studied every year, the number of teaching faculty and non-teaching staff, etc. in each institute; (b) the number of graduate students passed out from each institute along with the total budget sanctioned and released for the overall development of these institutes so far; (c) whether the Union Government has not released the total sanctioned funds for the purpose; (d) if so, the details thereof along with the reasons therefor; and (e) the appropriate steps taken or proposed to be taken by the Government to release the rest of the funds for the overall development of these institutes in Maharashtra?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the details of current policy for regulating air quality and reducing air pollution across the country; (b) whether the Government has enacted stringent laws to control air pollution levels and penalise/punish violators of the said rules; and (c) whether the Government proposes to provide any uniform pollution limit across the country as per the standards of the World Health Organisation and if so, the details thereof along with the other steps taken by the Government to control and minimize air pollution in the country?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plans to release the final notification demarcating Ecologically Sensitive Areas based on the Dr. Kasturirangan Panel Report; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the final status of Ecologically Sensitive Areas with respect to Kerala has been finalised; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970 and 1980 provide for the representation of Chartered Accountants, Depositers, Agriculture, Cooperation, Law, Small Scale Industries and employees by way of their appointment as Directors on the Board of Directors of the Public Sector Banks (PSBs); (b) if so, the details thereof including the number of such Directors appointed during each of the last five years, PSB-wise; and (c) if such appointments have not been made, the reasons therefor? 2

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the jump in the retail inflation as well as the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) to an all time high; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has assessed the reasons for higher inflation; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (e) the corrective steps, if any, being taken by the Government to curtail the spiralling inflation rates in the country?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to further publicise the NMMS Scheme across the country including Bhopal Parliamentary Constituency; (b) if so, the details of the plan being prepared in this regard and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) the number of seats available under NMMS Scheme in Madhya Pradesh including Bhopal Parliamentary Constituency along with the number of such seats proposed to be increased, please also give, State-wise, details?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the tribal communities in the country are lagging behind the other communities in various social indices; (b) whether infant and maternal mortality rates and the cases of women affected by anemia are very high among tribal communities mainly due to high drop-out rate and lack of education among children and very poor health facilities in tribal areas; (c) the details of steps taken by the Government to improve the social indices of tribal communities including the amount spent in this regard; . (d) whether the Government has not taken any steps for rehabilitation of the tribal people displaced by development schemes; and (e) if so, the main reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government assumes the Statue of Unity as a model initiative of the Government of Gujarat to boost tourism; (b) whether the Government proposes to direct the other State Governments to take similar initiatives; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government proposes to identify similar locations State-wise to develop such initiatives under the Central Financial Assistance to boost tourism; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Singh Deo, Smt. Sangeeta Kumari', 'Majumdar, Dr. Sukanta']
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has sanctioned 10 tribal freedom fighter museums across the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has also approved declaration of 15th November as Janjatiya Gaurav Divas dedicated to the memory of brave tribal freedom fighters; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the other steps being taken by the Government to acknowledge the glorious history and cultural heritage of tribal communities in the country including Odisha and West Bengal?

topic: Kendriya Vidyalaya in Hardoi, Uttar Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to establish a Kendriya Vidyalaya in Sandila in Misrikh Parliamentary Constituency, Hardoi district, Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor? 3

from: ['Raut, Shri Vinayak Bhaurao', 'Patil, Shri Hemant Shriram']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the details of developmental projects of Maharashtra Government awaiting environmental clearance from the Union Government; (b) the average time taken in deciding on the clearance for developmental activities like roads and bridges; (c) the number and other details of National Highway projects stuck/stopped so far due to non-clearance from the Ministry; and (d) the details of actions taken by the Union Government to fast-track decisions on clearance requests on such development projects?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that Bitcoin transaction is silently blooming in India in the recent years; (b) if so, the details thereof and the response of the Government in this regard; (c) whether the Government has any proposal to recognise Bitcoin as a currency in the country; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Funds Allocated for Welfare of Tea Workers
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that in Budget 2021 the Government declared to provide Rs. 1000/- crore for the welfare of tea workers of Assam and West Bengal; (b) if so, the details of the funds allocated to the respective States; and (c) if no funds have been allocated so far, the reasons therefor? .

Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the objectives of the Seva Bhoj Yojana; (b) applications received, processed and accepted under the scheme so far, State-wise; (c) applications received and accepted from the State of Jharkhand, district-wise including Hazaribagh and Ramgarh districts; and (d) whether the Government is planning any initiatives to create awareness on the scheme and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds allocated by the Union Government to States including Bihar for various schemes during the last five years; (b) the amount of funds spent by States so far; (c) whether the Government has an existing auditing mechanism to look into the amount of funds not utilised so far along with the reasons for non-utilisation of the entire funds; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the steps taken by the Government to ensure timely utilisation of the entire funds by States?

topic: Status of Classical Language to Marathi
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the proposal received from the Government of Maharashtra for providing status of Classical Language to Marathi language was sent to the Committee of Linguistic Experts for its consideration; (b) if so, the date on which this proposal was received from the Government of Maharashtra and the date on which it was presented to the Committee of Linguistic Experts for its consideration; (c) whether the said Committee has submitted its report to the Government and if so, the date on which this report was received by the Government alongwith the details of the recommendations made by the Committee; and (d) the details of action taken by the Government on the recommendations of the Expert Committee? 4

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether any time limit has been fixed/prescribed for making payment of insurance amount to the victims/ affected families by public/private sector insurance companies in the case of injuries/death in road accidents; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of the claims reported by the Life Insurance Companies, General Insurance Companies and Motor Accident Claims Tribunals and the details of the maximum and minimum compensation paid to the families of road accident victims during each of the last five years and the current year, company-wise and State- wise; (d) whether the Government has taken any steps for speedy settlement of insurance claims and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the compensation amount has been increased under the New Motor Vehicles Act, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of disproportionately high levels of lockdown-related job losses among women, whose employment was more severely impacted than men by the Covid-19 pandemic; NEW DELHI; November 24, 2021 Agrahayana 3, 1943 (Saka) . (b) if so, the details regarding the number of women who have lost their jobs due to the Covid-19 pandemic, State-wise; (c) whether the Government plans to formulate measures to boost womens employment in view of the said situation; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken adequate steps for facilitating education/human resource development for the people so that they can avail the benefits of various welfare schemes of the Government; and (b) if so, the details thereof including allocation of funds and number of beneficiaries during 2018-2019, 2019-2020 and 2020-2021, State/UT-wise?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has undertaken any steps recently to give a boost to the capital expenditure and infrastructure progress in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the capital expenditure achievements in this regard in the first 2 quarters i.e. Q1 and Q2 of the current financial year? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

topic: Employment Guarantee and Livelihood for Urban Poor
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the level of year-wise unemployment in the country during the last five years; (b) whether the Government proposes to start any scheme to ensure wages, employment guarantee and livelihood for urban poor in the wake of COVID pandemic; and (c) the total number of Atal Pension Yojana accounts opened in West Bengal, particularly in the districts of Darjeeling and Kalimpong along with the details thereof?

from: ['Singh, Shri Nayab', 'Singh, Shri Uday Pratap', 'Katheria, Prof. (Dr.) Ram Shankar']
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received proposals from the State Government of Madhya Pradesh, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh under the Tribal Sub Plan, special central assistance item and under post-matric and pre- matric schemes; (b) if so, the present status of the said proposals along with the details thereof; and (c) the reasons for pendency of the said proposals?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Preservation of Saura Tribe and their Language
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: . (a) whether the Government is aware of the Saura (Sabar) tribe from the Gajapati and Koraput districts of Odisha and their script Sora Sompeng; (b) if so, the steps being taken by the Government to save the Saura language from the threat of extinction which will be detrimental for their distinct ethnic identity; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the children of the above-mentioned community are forced to drop out of school as they are unable to understand Odia and other languages in which being taught, if so the details thereof and the steps being taken by the Government in this regard; (e) whether the Government is planning to officially recognise the Saura (Sabar) language by including it in the 8th Schedule of the Indian Constitution and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Circuits Based on Stateâ€™s Cultural Heritage
from: ['Jolle, Shri Annasaheb Shankar', 'Surya, Shri L.S. Tejasvi', 'Raghavendra, Shri B. Y.', 'Simha, Shri Prathap', 'Karadi, Shri Sanganna Amarappa', 'Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.']
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the ministry is planning to start any circuits based on the cultural heritage of the States; and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

from: ['Tatkare, Shri Sunil Dattatray', 'Sule, Smt. Supriya Sadanand', 'Kolhe, Dr. Amol Ramsing', 'Bhamre, Dr. Subhash Ramrao', 'Sharma, Shri Kuldeep Rai', 'DNV Senthilkumar S, Dr.']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , 2 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government proposes to impose a ban on single use polythene bags and disposable items made of substandard plastic and polystyrene in the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is conducting any public awareness campaign in this regard and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has formulated any norms/guidelines for the ban on single use plastics and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether it is a fact that 40 per cent of total plastic waste remains uncollected in India and if so the details thereof and reasons therefor; (e) whether various States have adopted separate norms for imposing ban on polythene bags in their States and if so, the reasons therefor; (f) if so, whether the Government is considering any uniform norms for all States in this regard and if so, the details thereof;and (g) the measures taken by the Government for management and safe disposal of plastic waste including plastic packaging in the country specially in Andaman and Nicobar Islands?
party: ['Nationalist Congress Party', 'Nationalist Congress Party', 'Nationalist Congress Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Indian National Congress', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam']

contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of States where the Vanbandhu Kalyan Yojana is being implemented? (b) the details of funds released by Government under this programme since its commencement and the utilization of such funds, State-wise including Tamil Nadu? (c) whether the economic standard of tribals is being improved positively by the said scheme? (d) whether the said scheme has been successful in achieving its objective? and (e) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Opening of Universities in Backward District
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the funds allocated and utilised for the development of state-level educational institutions under Rashtriya Uchchatar Sikhsha Abhiyan (RUSA) during the last three years and the current year so far, State- wise /Union Territory-wise including Haryana; . (b) whether the Government has any plan to open Universities in backward districts of the country under the RUSA; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the time by when these Universities are likely to be opened in these backward districts of the country including Haryana?

topic: Skill Development Schemes in Uttar Pradesh and NER
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the details of Skill Development schemes currently being implemented in Uttar Pradesh specially in Jhansi and Lalitpur and North Eastern Region especially in Tripura during last two years; (b) whether the Government proposes to formulate schemes specially for the skill development in remote/ tribal areas and if so, the details thereof; and (c) the amount of funds allocated by the Union Government to Uttar Pradesh and North Eastern Region (NER) for the said schemes?

from: ['Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun', 'Sridhar, Shri Kotagiri', 'Patil, Shri Sanjay(Kaka) Ramchandra', 'Nallakonda Gari, Shri Reddeppa', 'Bellana, Shri Chandra Sekhar']
contents: Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Competition Commission of India (CCI) has recently conducted a market study of the Pharmaceutical Sector to evaluate whether the prices of essential drugs had shot up during the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the CCI has recommended any corrective measures to the Government; and (d) if so, the details thereof along with the action taken by the Government thereon?

topic: Use of Fake Scheduled Tribe Certificate
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: 3 (a) whether any case regarding use of fake of scheduled Tribe certificates in Government jobs and educational institutions have been reported during the last three years ; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) action taken by the Government in this regard?

from: ['Solanky, Shri Mahendra Singh', 'Ray, Smt. Sandhya', 'Gupta, Shri Sangamlal Kadedin', 'Chaudhary, Shri P.P.', 'Singh, Shri Rajbahadur', 'Yadav, Dr. Krishnapal Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the number of migrant labourers in Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan who had returned during COVID-19 lockdowns; (b) the number of districts of Madhya Pradesh covered under Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana; (c) the number of migrant labourers in Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan who were imparted skill development training under Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana, district-wise; (d) the sector-wise details of job opportunities that are provided to migrant labourers after training under PMKVY; and (e) the details of the number of migrant labourers placed in each sector, district wise and State-wise?

contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the Government is considering implementing the Code on Social Security, 2020 and bringing a large number of workers under the ambit of social security schemes; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether it is also true that the Government has held discussions with Employees State Insurance Corporation and other stakeholders; (d) whether it is also a fact that the rules framed under the Act have not been notified; and (e) whether it is also a fact that the Government has not been able to commit to the deadline for implementation of the Code on Social Security, 2020?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether there are any law/guidelines/rules/ regulations for protection of gig/unorganised/platform workers and for their social security; if so, the details of the respective provisions; (b) whether the Government is considering to include platform/gig workers under the code on industrial disputes, if so, the details of the draft provisions and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) whether the Government has considered to come up with schemes on social security rights for gig/ unorganised/platform workers under The Social Security Code, 2020 and if so, the details of the schemes including the expected date of its introduction and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Protection of Tribal Education and Culture
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether any special schemes are being run for the protection of tribal education and culture; (b) whether any special centers will be set up of the preservation for tribal culture; and (c) the State-wise details of the places where the centres related to tribal cultures are being set up?

from: ['Pasunoori, Shri Dayakar', 'Maloth, Smt. Kavitha', 'Reddy, Dr. Gaddam Ranjith', 'Borlakunta, Shri Venkatesh Netha']
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is in the process of revamping the National Policy for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship; and (b) if so, details thereof and whether the proposed revamp will improve the productivity to match global standards?
party: ['Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

topic: Impact of US Advisory on Tourism Sector
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM 4 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has noticed that the US Government has issued a level 3 travel advisory to its citizens especially women to not to travel to India; (b) if so, the details and the reasons thereto; (c) whether the Government has taken up the issue with the US Government; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) whether such advisory has an adverse impact on Indian tourism sector; and (f) if so, the details and the steps taken by the Government in this regard?

from: ['Singh, Shri Sunil Kumar', 'Naik Nimbalkar, Shri Ranjeetsingh']
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the programmes organised under the Amrit Mahotsav of Independence, that have been organized by the Ministry and by the Central Public Sector Undertakings under the Ministry of Culture and other ministeries of Government of India; and (b) the details of the proposed programmes in the coming days under the Amrit Mahotsav?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has recently established Centralized Scrutiny and Prosecution (CSP) mechanism to monitor the CSR utilisation compliance by various companies; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Goswami, Shri Dulal Chandra', 'Sagar, Shri Arun Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken/ proposes to take steps to set up Skill Development Centres in backward and rural areas in the State of Bihar including Katihar and Shahjahanpur Parliamentary Constituencies in Uttar Pradesh; . (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the progress made in this regard so far?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made any provisions for differently abled children in Kendriya Vidyalayas/ Navodaya Vidyalayas and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether any scheme or new education system is being devised by the Government so as to enable them to get better education policy for differently abled children and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry has held any consultations or reports to study fall in demand for various products since the onset of COVID-19 pandemic and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Ministry has received any representations from Industry bodies or groups of businesses/vendors regarding fall in demand for their products or lowered sales after the onset of the COVID- 19 pandemic and requests for help and if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Ministry has plans to reduce GST rates on essential commodities and household goods and supplies to increase affordability and thereby demand for various products and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Unemployment rate in Rural and Urban Areas
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that over 1.5 million people from both the formal and informal sectors lost their jobs during the last two-three months as the unemployment rate rose in rural and urban India; (b) whether the Government is also aware that the Countrys unemployment has risen to an alarming stage; if so, the details and the reasons therefore; (c) whether the Government has made any plan to improve its scenario across the country; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefore? 5

topic: Rejuvenation and Beautification of Bijli  Pasi  Quila
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the amount of funds released by the Union Government at present for the conservation and maintenance of the historical monuments particularly Bijli Pasi Quila including those in Barabanki and Lucknow; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the proposals approved by the Government for the rejuvenation and beautification of the Bijli Pasi Quila and the famous Mahadeva Temple, Barabanki of the Pandav era; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) number of projects related to skill development being run in Ranchi Lok Sabha Constituency; (b) the amount spent during in the last two years and number of institutes that are running under these projects; and (c) numbers of youth trained under the skill development projects alongwith the details of the companies where they got placement?

topic: Setting up of Science Centre in Andhra Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the time by which the Ministry proposes to set up a Science Centre at Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh; (b) the target date of completion and the initial estimated expenditure; (c) whether there is any time and cost overrun; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the project is on course to be completed before the deadline of August, 2022; and (f) if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Gender Disparity in terms of Literacy Rate
from: ['Ray, Smt. Sandhya', 'Solanky, Shri Mahendra Singh', 'Chaudhary, Shri P.P.', 'Singh, Shri Rajbahadur', 'Yadav, Dr. Krishnapal Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether as per the NSSO report Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan have the biggest gender divide in terms of literacy rate; (b) if so, the reasons thereof; (c) whether the Government has taken any initiatives to curb the gender literacy divide in above States; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) whether Gross Enrolment Ratio of females in schools and colleges has seen a decline in the past 3 years owing to the pandemic and if so, thereof; and (f) the district-wise data for enrolment of girls in schools in above mentioned States?

contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any initiatives for capacity building in Green Finance during the last five years; (b) if so details thereof; and (c) the details of the partnerships with private companies and the Government for sustainable mobility in the last ten years?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the Government is considering making changes to the existing Forest Conservation Act; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether it is also true that the agencies involved in national security projects and border infrastructure projects obtain prior forest clearance from the Government; 6 (d) whether it is also a fact that the Government is considering adding clauses concerning punishments and for penal compensation; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has launched any Digi Saksham Programme recently in joint venture with Microsoft India; (b) if so, the details thereof and the key fact or salient features of the said programme; (c) whether the Government proposes to provide free of cost training to rural youth in the field of digital skills including basic skills and advance computing through National Career Service Portal and if so, the details thereof and the steps taken in this regard; (d) whether the Government is also considering free of cost training to disadvantaged group of the society who have been adversely affected by the ongoing Covid- 19 pandemic and if so, the details thereof; (e) the details of funds sanctioned and released under the said programme during the current year; and (f) the number of youths, particularly from rural areas who get benefitted by the training under the said programme?

topic: Inclusion of Shirdi Dham in Central Tourism List

contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the number of pre-2016 pensioners of higher educational institutions of Avinashilingam Higher Studies University at Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu; (b) whether the pension arrears of these penserions have not been paid till date; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the steps taken or proposed to be taken by the Government for the settlement of pension arrear of these pensioners?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the efforts being made by the Government for better competition laws for promoting better mechanism in corporate sector in view of the sharp growth in Indian economy; (b) the alternatives suggested in this regard by the competition law review committee constituted under the chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Corporate Affairs in October, 2018 in this regard; and (c) the details of the points reviewed or being reviewed by the committee?

topic: Assessment of Impact of Air Pollution on Tourism
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made any assessment of the impact of air pollution on tourism; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether it has come to the notice of the Government that the tourists are experiencing health issues due to pollution; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the measures taken by the Government in this regard?

topic: Encroachment on Wildlife Sancturaries and Protected Areas
from: ['Joshi, Shri Chandra Prakash', 'Chauhan, Shri Nihal Chand']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the total area of land reserved for forest in each State/UT of the country including Rajasthan; (b) whether the Union Government has done any assessment with regard to illegal encroachment being done on the said land for years and if so, the details thereof; (c) the steps taken by the Government to remove the illegal encroachment and whether the States have also been instructed to take any sort of action in this regard; (d) whether there has been any increase in the cases related to encroachment in wildlife sanctuaries and protected areas across the country; (e) whether the Government is concerned about the encroachment on wildlife sanctuaries and protected areas and if so, the year/location-wise details of cases related to encroachment including the action taken thereon and laws enacted in this regard; and (f) the manner in which the implementation of such laws is being ensured?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the number of accounts opened under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) post the lockdown due to Covid-19 along with the details of 8 funds mobilized through these accounts during that period; (b) whether the Government is planning to come up with any scheme to provide monetary benefits in terms of interest on their money for the beneficiaries PMJDY; and (c) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any steps to maintain the fragile ecology of the Himalayas; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any monitoring mechanism by inducting scientists has been set up to take note of the changes taking place in glaciers; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has recently participated in the COP26 Summit in Glasgow, UK, if so, the outcome of the COP26 Summit; (b) whether India has made any commitment for reducing greenhouse gas emission and if so, the details thereof and the proposed action plan for reducing greenhouse gas emission and whether it would compromise on growth in the countrys developing economy; (c) whether any future targets have been fixed for fighting Climate Change and Global Warming and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has recently launched E-Amrit, a web portal on electric vehicles during the COP26 Summit in Glasgow, UK and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether E-Amrit has been developed under a collaborative knowledge exchange programme with the UK Government and as part of the UK-India Joint Roadmap 2030, if so, the details thereof; and (f) the other steps/initiatives being taken by the Government to accelerate the decarbonisation of transport and adoption of electric mobility in the country?

contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has presently any plans, policies and rules to levy proper share of taxation on multinational companies which derive large revenues from India via their digital presence, without having a physical one; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the measures proposed to be taken by the Government to deal with multinationals which generate substantial revenues in India but do not share a proper share of taxes with the Government?

topic: Plan for Revival of Indian Hotel Industry
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: 11 (a) whether the Government has evolved any plan for revival of Indian hotel industry sector that remains collapsed due to the Covid-19 pandemic; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of number of star hotels closed due to running loss in the pandemic period?

topic: Reopening of Central Universitities after Covid-19 Pandemic
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has noticed that many of the Central Universities have not opened yet after Covid-19 crisis and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has issued any order in this regard to the University authorities and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has been informed by University authorities about the continuing closure of institutions and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has proposed to re- open the central institutions for regular functioning; and (e) if so, the details thereof and the time by when exactly the Jawaharlal Nehru University, Jamia Millia Islamia and Delhi University are going to open?

topic: Lay-offs of Employees of MNCs and Private Entities
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether there were random lay-offs of employees of the MNCs and private entities in the country since COVID-19 period; (b) if so, the monthly report and data on the suspension and termination of staff during the COVID- 19 period, i.e. from April 2020 and if so, the details thereof; (c) the action taken by the Government with the agencies to continue their staff and thereby their facilities thereof; and (d) the reaction of the agencies thereto?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has implemented National Afforestation Programme in the country and if so, the details along with the aims and objectives thereof; (b) whether the Government has achieved the annual targeted area of afforestation under the said programme during the last three years; (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government proposes to increase the allocation of funds to the National Afforestation Programme; and (e) if so, the details thereof and the other steps being taken by the Government to increase tree plantation in the country?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has started operating a tribal University in Telangana; (b) if not, the reasons for the delay in setting up a tribal university in Telangana; (c) the status of the establishment of a tribal varsity in Telangana and the proposed timeline for the completion of the project; and (d) the details of reservation for tribal persons in the said University amongst students and faculty?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the details of school enrolment during the last three years, State-wise in rural and urban areas; and (b) the steps taken by the Government to carry on proper education system in rural areas during the pandemic?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is getting any financial investment for reforestation and soil carbon sequestration through the Bio-Carbon Fund which promotes biodiversity conservation and poverty alleviation; 12 (b) if so, the details thereof for the last three years; and (c) the extent to which these funds have been utilized during the last three years?
Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plan to make the education and training paperless in schools; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the total number of Jan Shikshan Sansthans (JSS) established in the country alongwith total amount disbursed to them, State wise including Rajasthan; (b) the total number of students enrolled with the JSS, category wise and State-wise, down to district level for Rajasthan, the steps being taken to establish new and increase the areas covered by JSS; (c) whether the Government conducts regular audits to check the functioning of the JSS, if so, the total number of such audits conducted State-wise and down to district level for Rajasthan; (d) the total placement percentage of the JSS, State- wise data down to district level for Rajasthan, total number of private sector collaborations, and steps taken to invite private sector participation in establishing and recruiting students from JSS; and (e) the details of the JSS who have been given IT capacity post the covid-19 pandemic?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the status of establishment of Kendriya Vidyalaya at Jeypore in Odisha; (b) the steps taken by the Government to mitigate delays in establishment of KV so as to avoid the same in future; (c) whether the Government proposes to open KVs in aspirational areas including undivided Koraput District in Odisha and if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor? .

Will the Minister of DEVELOPMENT OF NORTH EASTERN REGION be pleased to state: (a) the details of progress made under North East Rural Livelihood Project (NERLP) assisted by World Bank; (b) the number of districts covered under the above- said scheme, State-wise; and (c) the details of schemes currently under implementation in Barpeta, Nalbari and Bongaigaion districts of Assam?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the number of teaching faculty posts reserved for SC/ST/OBC/EWS and Unreserved lying vacant in each cadre; (b) the details of the reservation rosters for each cadre of teaching posts made by each Central Educational Institutions (CEI) according to the provisions of the Central Educational Institutions (Reservation in Teachers Cadre) Act, 2019; (c) whether any CEI has informed the Government about their inability to prepare the reservation rosters according to the CEI Act, 2019; (d) if so, the details thereof and the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the Government to urgently resolve this issue; and (d) the cadre-wise and categorywise figures of posts identified vacant in each CEI for the purposes of mission mode recruitment?

topic: Development of Meerut under Swadesh Darshan Scheme
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has proposed development of Meerut under the Swadesh Darshan Scheme; (b) if so, the details of the work proposed under the scheme along with work completed and those awaiting completion; and (c) the detailed list of developmental work carried out in Meerut under the scheme? 13

topic: Preservation and Protection of Cultural Places of Ernakulam
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government intends to preserve and protect the following cultural places Anchalappis oldest post office, Kerala, Synod of Damper (or Udayamperoor Synod) and Melpazhur Mana birthplace of Adi Shankara, Melpazhur Mana,Veliyanadu, District Ernakulam, Kerala (b) if so the, details regarding the same; (c) whether the Government has any records regarding the protection of these sites and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government is aware of any protection program undertaken at these sites under patronage of any private trusts or State Aarcheology department and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Introduction of Health System in School Curriculum
