contents: Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of aggregate spending by the Public Sector Units and non-Public Sector Units on Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR); (b) whether the Government has received any contribution from PSUs and Non PSUs for the management of Covid crisis since March 2020 (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the amount received from Public Limited and Private Limited Companies for Covid care and management and the details of the expenditure incurred thereon during the said period?

topic: Vaccination of Tribal People of Odisha
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the number and percentage of tribal people vaccinated in Odisha and percentage left thereof; (b) whether there was vaccine hesitancy or myths about it in the tribal people; if so, the steps taken to remedy the situation; (c) whether vaccine hesitancy has reduced among tribal people in Odisha; if so, details thereof; (d) whether there are schemes devised to periodically arrange vaccination camps for tribal people in Odisha; if so, details thereof; and (e) whether any target is set by the Government for 100% vaccination of tribal people of Odisha; and if so, details thereof?

topic: Eklavya Model Residential Schools in Andhra Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that 14 blocks in Andhra Pradesh have been identified where there are more than 50 per cent of Scheduled Tribe (ST) population and 20,000 or more tribals for setting up of Eklavya Model Residential Schools(EMRSs); (b) if so, details of blocks and districts identified; and (c) steps being taken to set up EMRSs in the identified blocks and by when they are going to become functional?

topic: Reopening of Doors to Foreign Tourists
from: ['Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra', 'Ahmed, Smt. Sajda', 'Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao']
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has decided to reopen its doors to foreign tourists from countries where the Covid-19 situation is under control; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the names of the countries from where the tourists will be allowed; (c) the response received from these countries and the revenue earned so far; (d) whether the Government has formulated specific protocols for the international tourists keeping in mind the possibility of third wave and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government has organized inter- ministerial talks for a calibrated resumption of tourist visas and if so, the details thereof; and (f) the steps taken by the Government to ensure to follow all required health protocols and restore confidence in tourism industry?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'All India Trinamool Congress', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Shiv Sena', 'Biju Janata Dal', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that based on a VIP reference, the waiver of Goods and Services Tax (GST) for drug Zolgensma was approved for a child from Tamil Nadu; (b) if so, the details thereof alongwith the VIP reference on which it was approved; and (c) the date on which and by whom the first VIP reference was received in this regard?

from: ['Chandel, Kunwar Pushpendra Singh', 'Bhatt, Smt. Ranjanben Dhananjay']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether emission of carbon is on the rise in the country; (b) whether the Government has formulated any policy to reduce carbon emission in the country and if so, the details thereof along with its targets and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government has taken initiatives to in individuals/institutions engaged encourage environmental protection in the country; and (d) if so, the State-wise details thereof including Bundelkhand? .

from: ['Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar', 'Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether any meetings have been held by the Financial Stability and Development Council (FSDC) to nudge financial regulators to relax and harmonise investment norms for instruments such as Infrastructure Investment Trusts to be used to monetise public assets such as highways, gas pipelines and railway tracks; and (b) if so, the details and outcome thereof during the last five years?
party: ['Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that 37 per cent of population in Pallahara in Angul district and Kalahandi districts of Odisha belongs to Adivasi community; (b) if so, the details thereof whether the Government has any plan for social and economic development of these people; (c) whether there is any proposal of special package for the economic development of these people; and (d) if not, the reason thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received any proposal intimating the withdrawal of sponsorship of project sector Kendriya Vidyalayas (KVs) in the country as on date; (b) if so, the details of such KVs and the respective sponsoring institutions and the recurring expenditure borne by the institution for running the KVs during the FY 2020-21; (c) whether the Government proposes to consider converting such KVs to civil sector if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reason therefor?

from: ['Bellana, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Nallakonda Gari, Shri Reddeppa', 'Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun', 'Reddy, Shri Pocha Brahmananda', 'Madhav, Shri Kuruva Gorantla']
contents: Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Competition Commission of India has taken steps to identify anti-competitive practices in the digital markets, which are characterised by high concentration of market power; and (b) if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the absence of Kendriya Vidyalaya in Manjeswaram Taluk, Kasaragod district in Kerala, which is educationally backward and lacks adequate educational institutions; and (b) if so the steps taken/to be taken by the Government to start a Kendriya Vidyalaya in Manjeswaram Taluk if the required land is made available for the Kendriya Vidyalaya?

from: ['Kathir Anand, Shri Durai Murugan', 'T. Sumathy (A) Thamizhachi Thangapandian, Dr.']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the GST collections for the last two years have increased; (b) if so, the details of CGST, SGST and IGST collections made during the last three years, State-wise; (c) the details of the pending dues to be paid to the State Government of Tamil Nadu and its breakup; and (d) the effective steps taken by the Union Government for the timely payment of GST dues and funds to the State Government of Tamil Nadu in the future?

topic: Utilization of funds on Migrant Labour
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government had sanctioned funds to various States for utilization on Migrant Labour; if so, the details thereof in respect of State of Telangana for the last five years; . (b) the details of funds released to and spent by the Government of Telangana; and (c) whether any deviation has been made from the funds meant for Migrant Labour to other schemes for Government of Telangana; if so, the action being considered to be taken by the Union Government?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the district-wise details of Schemes being run in Uttar Pradesh under Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan (GKRA); (b) the district-wise details of total number of persons benefitted from this scheme in Uttar Pradesh; (c) whether the Government has any plan to provide employemnt to the persons benefitting from this scheme; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the total number of Kendriya Vidyalayas in the Telangana State; (b) whether the students enrolled in Kendriya Vidyalayas have been availing online classes and if so; the percentage of schools taking online classes; (c) if so, the percentage of students attending such classes and whether notes are being made available to those who are unable to attend such classes; and (d) if not, the plans in place to recover the academic time lost to students enrolled in Kendriya Vidyalayas in Telangana?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of the reports of NEET aspirants committing suicide in various parts of the country including Tamil Nadu; (b) if so, the details of such cases reported during the last three years, year-wise, State-wise; (c) whether the Government is promoting counseling sessions for students; (d) if so, the details thereof; and 18 (e) the other steps taken or proposed to be taken by the Government to prevent the recurrence of suicide of students in the country?

topic: Steps Taken to Promote Tourism After Pandemic
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the details of steps taken to promote responsible tourism in the country; (b) whether the tourism sector has been badly affected due to the pandemic; (c) if so, the details of action to rejuvenate the tourism sector in the country; (d) whether there is a steep fall in the number of tourists; and (e) if so, the details thereof and relaxations announced so far to attract the tourists?

from: ['Rathva, Smt. Gitaben Vajesingbhai', 'Naik Nimbalkar, Shri Ranjeetsingh', 'Adhikari, Shri Deepak (Dev)']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that the problem of air pollution in metropolitan cities of the country has become worse, if so, the details of increasing pollution level in various metropolitan cities in the country especially in Delhi; (b) whether the Government is aware of the causes of air pollution, if so, the details thereof; (c) the problems being faced due to air pollution especially in Delhi; (d) the efforts made by the Government during the last three years to identify the causes and to reduce air pollution along with the details thereof; (e) the number of deaths due to air pollution during the last two years; and (f) whether it is a fact that India suffers loss of millions of dollars every year due to deteriorating public health due to air pollution and if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'All India Trinamool Congress']

contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE . be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has released the special financial package of Rs.700 crore as requested by Andhra Pradesh; (b) if so, the share of this requested amount released to the State; (c) whether the entire amount has not been released and if so, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government follows up the release of funds by an inquiry as to the utilization of the same vis-a-vis the requested purpose; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government provides assistance to a number of small farmers belonging to SCs/STs extended credit by the Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) in the country during each of the last three years and the current year, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is aware that the farmers are facing a lot of difficulties in getting loans from RRBs; and (c) if so, the corrective measures taken/being taken by the Government to ensure flow of credit to the farmers?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government agrees with the view that along with physical or infrastructural investments, schools must allocate dedicated resources and adopt to train the trainer approach to make the learning lasting; (b) if so, the measures taken by the Government in this regard; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Identification of cities to control air pollution
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that Patancheruvu in Telangana has been identified to control air pollution; 19 (b) the details of action plan prepared and status of implementation of the same; (c) the details of improvement in air quality after implementation of the action plan; and (d) whether any other city has been identified/ proposed to be identified to control air pollution in Telangana and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has undertaken a cultural mapping in Haryana State under the National Mission on Cultural Mapping; (b) the details of programs undertaken under the Cultural Mapping Mission; (c) the number of artists and institutions registered, State/UT-wise including Haryana under the mission till date and the benefits/assistance extended to the registered artists/institutions; and (d) the details of the cultures or villages that were mapped in Haryana State, especially in the districts of Sirsa and Fatehabad; and (e) whether the Government is proposing to expand the mission and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the total collection of excise duty from fuel in last five years; and (b) the total amount of excise duty collected from Petrol and Diesel shared with States in these last five years?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the details of National Skill Training Institutes (NSTI) and NSTI(W) in the State of Andhra Pradesh (AP) and the number of people trained therein since 2017, Year-wise; (b) whether there are no such institutes in the State of Andhra Pradesh if so, the reasons therefor and whether . the Government intends to open such institutes in the State; (c) the state-wise number of individuals trained under PMKVY 2.0 and PMKVY 3.0 since the launch of these schemes; (d) the details of the number of individuals trained in AP under PMKVY since 2017, district-wise; (e) the details of the funds allocated, utilised for PMKVY since 2019-20; and (f) whether the Government has undertaken any special initiatives for the skill development of the tribal population in the State of Andhra Pradesh?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to introduce Central Bank Digital Currency in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and the plan prepared for the same; (c) the purpose of introducing digital currency and whether any assessment has been done on the implications of the same; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Schemes to Popularise Tourist Sites in Rajasthan
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the schemes of the Government to popularize tourist attraction sites in Rajasthan; (b) whether any campaign has been started abroad to attract foreign tourists to the religious, old havelies and tourist attractions places of Rajasthan; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the total foreign exchange earned from tourists visiting Rajasthan during the last two years?

topic: Plan to Expand Rural Tourism Circuits in Gujarat
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether there is any programme/scheme to explore scope for developing rural tourism in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof. (c) the State-wise/Union Territory-wise number of districts and villages which have been identified and 20 developed as rural tourist spots during the last three years; (d) whether the Government is planning to expand rural tourism circuits in Gujarat; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Baghel, Shri Vijay', 'Soni, Shri Sunil Kumar', 'Sao, Shri Arun']
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the Skill Loan Scheme was launched in July 2015 and if so, the status thereof till date; (b) the total number of persons in the country, who have benefitted from this scheme; (c) the State-wise details thereof including Chattisgarh; and (d) the district-wise details of Chhattisgarh State including Lok Sabha Constituencies of Durg and Bilaspur?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that as per a recent analysis, there has been a sharp rise in indebtedness among rural as well as urban households in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof during the last three years, year-wise and State/UT-wise along with reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government is taking any measures to reduce the rising debt in rural as well as urban households in the country; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Beniwal, Shri Hanuman', 'Kaswan, Shri Rahul', 'Rajoria, Dr. Manoj', 'Joshi, Shri Chandra Prakash', 'Nath, Shri Balak']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: . (a) whether any proposal/ demand etc. is under consideration before the Government for the approval of new Kendriya Vidyalayas and Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalayas in various parts of the country, particularly Rajasthan including Sujangarh in Churu District, Khinvsar, Parbatsar, Merta and Didwana in Nagaur District of Rajasthan; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise along with the progress made in this regard; (c) whether any report of any committee has come to the Government for approval of said schools and if so, the details thereof along with copies of the report; (d) whether the Government proposes to open KVs in Hindaun city of District Karauli, Dholpur Parliamentary Consituency, which is pending with the KVS Sangathan Headquarters and if so, the details thereof; (e) the plan of the Government to approve the new KVs at said places and the details thereof; and (f) the number of teachers and students studying in KVs operating across the country, State-wise?
party: ['Rashtriya Loktantrik Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government or any other agency has initiated survey to understand the impact of Covid-19 pandemic on the teaching, learning and assessment processes and the socio-economic conditions of the schools across the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the percentage of students having access to the internet and the details of modes of virtual learning schools used during the Pandemic period; (d) the percentage of attendance of students during the online classes, Sate-wise; and (e) whether the Government has received any suggestions to provide support in terms of training and resources for teachers and students in the schools alongwith the details thereof?

from: ['Kachhadiya, Shri Naranbhai Bhikhabhai', 'Patel, Shri Parbatbhai Savabhai']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Central Cabinet has approved to continue/ amend/ rectify the Centre sponsored National PM Nutrition Scheme in schools for the next five years; (b) the number of schools and students expected to benefit from the above scheme in the country; (c) the number of schools from Gujarat included in this scheme; 21 (d) the number of students likely to get benefit from this scheme; and (e) the details, thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of sectors which have been provided financial relief of Rs.20.97 lakh crores by the Government and whether it has desired positive impact; (b) whether any increase has been reported in employment opportunities due to this financial relief and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether economic activities have increased in the country due to this financial relief and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the extent to which the benefits have reached to the poor people due to this financial relief?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the data on the number of school-going children deprived of digital infrastructure owing to the COVID-19 pandemic before re-opening of schools, State-wise; (b) the data on school dropouts due to the COVID- 19 pandemic, State-wise; and (c) whether the Government has initiated any study on the long-term impacts of the loss of in-person teaching on the learning outcomes and if so, the details there of ?

from: ['Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao', 'Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the first National Achievement Survey 2021 of new National Education Policy, 2020 has been conducted and completed in the recent past; (b) if so, the result of said survey; (c) the education system particularly before and after lockdown to evaluate the impact of school closures on students learning; (d) the response of the Government thereof; (e) whether the results of NAS 2021 will be prepared in the form of District Report Cards, State/UT reports and National report; and (f) if so, the details in this regard?
party: ['Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Biju Janata Dal', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Out of School Children during CORONA
from: ['Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether due to Covid-19 Pandemic out-of-school children are likely to double in the country; (b) if so, whether the Government has conducted any study, survey in this regard; (c) the number of children dropped out during 2020 and 2021 as compared to corresponding period of previous years; (d) whether out-of-school children was a major concern even after the first wave; (e) whether lack of internet access or not having a proper learning space is a major reason for such high dropout; (f) if so, the response of the Government thereon; (g) whether the Government has drawn up any action plan to check school dropouts and address learning gaps; and if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Biju Janata Dal', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Projects for Development of Tourism in Punjab
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the details of the projects for development of tourism approved, sanctioned and executed in Punjab during the last five years including the current year, year-wise; (b) the details of the tourism projects completed so far and the time by which the remaining projects are likely to be completed; (c) the reasons for the delay in completion of the pending projects; (d) the details of funds allocated, released and utilized for the development of tourism sector in the State during the said period, year-wise; and (e) whether the State Government of Punjab has submitted any proposal to the Government and if so, the details thereof along with the present status of ongoing projects in the State of Punjab? 22

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the incidents of tax evasion are increasing in Delhi and other parts of the country; (b) if so, whether the Government has taken any steps in this regard so far; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether there is any proposal of the Government to set up a Skill Development and Entrepreneurship University in the State of Karnataka; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the feasible study carried out to set up a Skill Development University in Karnataka State; whether the Government plans to set up the University at Kolar in Karnataka considering its proximity to the International Airport Bengaluru, the available manpower and other suitable factors in Kolar Karnataka State?

topic: Identification of Tourist Spots in North Eastern States
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to revive foreign and domestic tourism in the country; (b) whether the Government has identified any tourist spots for promoting tourism in North-Eastern States especially Tripura and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has formulated any special scheme to promote tourism in North-Eastern part of the country; and (d) the other steps taken by the government to boost tourism sector in the country?

Will the Minister of FINANCE . be pleased to state: (a) the details of Mutual Funds investors in the Indian financial market, in per cent and income-group wise; (b) whether the Government believes investment in Mutual Funds could benefit the lower strata of the economic spectrum and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has undertaken any awareness or education programmes to improve the financial literacy about Mutual Funds among the various economic sections of society and removing the qualifications, occupation and income barriers to entry into the market; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of DEVELOPMENT OF NORTH EASTERN REGION be pleased to state: (a) the details of the aspirational districts selected so far within the state of Assam; (b) the details of the funds sanctioned, allocated and utilized under this scheme in Assam during the last three years and the current year so far; (c) the details of the target set and achievements made so far along with its response in this regard; (d) whether the Government has planned to select some more districts under the said scheme in Assam; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has ratified the convention 131 of the International Labour Organization; if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (b) the latest official estimates of child labour in India, State-wise; (c) whether the Government has established a national database of child labour, especially given the economic distress post covid-19 pandemic; if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the measures taken by the Government to ensure zero child labour as required by the Child Labour Amendment (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 2016? 23

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of workers who have lost their jobs in private sector during the last two years due to corona and lockdown; (b) the number of workers who have been successful in getting jobs after the phased removal of the lockdown; and (c) the details thereof, sector-wise?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether any schemes of skill training for youths under the Ministry of Skill Development are being implemented in Dhubri and Goalpara districts of Assam which are among the most backward districts in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof scheme-wise and district- wise; and (c) the details of the fund released and disbursed for the purpose?

topic: Creation of Employment at Tourist Destinations
from: ['Mahajan, Smt. Poonam Pramod', 'Siddeshwara, Shri Gowdar Mallikarjunappa']
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the Union Government has taken note of large-scale scope for the creation of employment at tourist destinations and has undertaken a serious homework to exploit the resource? (b) if so, the details thereof, including the names of tourist destinations where the local people have actually benefitted out of the initiative taken by the Union Government? (c) whether it is also a fact that the Union Government has some plans to identify new tourist destinations in each State of the country for promotion and development as potential tourist destinations with basic tourism facilities based upon specially drawn-up master plans in the next three years; and (d) if so, the details thereof, State-wise, particularly in respect of Maharashtra? .

topic: Conservation of Folk Cultures of Bihar
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the details of ancient folk cultures being conserved in Bihar along with the details of the schemes being implemented for this purpose; (b) the details of the places to which these folk cultures are related to; (c) the amount of funds sanctioned/allocated for this purpose during the last three years; and (d) the details of measures taken being taken for conservation of the said folk cultures?

topic: Programs Selected under PRASAD Scheme in Andhra Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the details of the programs selected under PRASAD Scheme in the State of Andhra Pradesh; (b) the number of projects completed during the last three years along with the details of the funds released so far; (c) whether any projects in the district of Kadapa have been taken up for development; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the number of projects that are in the pipeline to be taken up under PRASAD Scheme?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the toxic e-waste in a huge quantity is lying to be disposed of in various power companies throughout the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has asked the said companies to dispose of such e-waste without harming the environment; and (d) if so, the details thereof and the reaction of the power companies in this regard?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the present status of the National Child Labour Project (NCLP) scheme in Maharashtra State; (b) the details of children who have been rescued under the NCLP scheme; (c) whether Government has conducted any follow- up on the rescued children; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the two existing policies, the Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojna (RGSKY) and the Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojna (ABVKY) offered by ESIC are providing factory workers an unemployment allowance besides Social Security and Cash Benefits; if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the schemes are applicable only to insured workers engaged in factories comprising not less than 10 people; if not, the reasons therefor; (c) if so, whether the Ministry will consider necessary reforms in these restrictive policies to expand their coverage and include the huge disadvantaged workforce from the smaller factories as well as from the unorganized sectors in the backdrop of the COVID-19 pandemic; if so,and the details thereof; (d) whether any new proposal for a centralised unemployment insurance scheme for all has been made; and (e) if so, the details thereof; and if not , the reasons therefor?

from: ['Manne, Shri Srinivas Reddy', 'Nete, Shri Ashok Mahadeorao']
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds allocated/released/spent for the welfare of Scheduled Tribes during each of the last three years, State/UT-wise; (b) whether it is a fact that irregularities/diversion/ misappropriation are reported in many schemes meant for STs; and (c) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise and action taken so far along with the steps being taken to . avoid such situation to check any type of irregularities in this regard?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the number of Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Kendras (PMKKs) in Maharashtra at present and the district- wise details thereof; (b) whether the Government is considering to set up hostels for youths coming to rural areas for training; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether there is any plan to give priority to the skilled youths in employment in public and private sector and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the State-wise details of Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs) established in the country at present; (b) whether there is a need to establish more ITIs in the country; (c) if so, the details of decision taken by the Government in this regard; (d) the number of ITIs proposed to be opened in the country; (e) whether a provision has been made to reserve seats for the persons belonging to poor families; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the percentage loss in GDP per year due to occupational diseases, for the years from 2010-11 to 2020-21; and (b) the measures taken by the Government, if any, to control instances of occupational diseases and workplace injuries? 25

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to increase the upper limit of crop loans provided in the country ,if so, the details thereof; (b) the details of number of applications received and crop loans disbursed by each bank, for financial year 2020-2021 and 2021-2022, State-wise; (c) whether the Government is achieving the targets set to disburse the crop loans every year; (d) if so, the details of targets set by each bank and targets achieved by each bank, from the year 2015 to 2021 and if not, the reasons therefor, State-wise; (e) the details of outstanding loans and Non- Performing Assets of crop loans as on date, Bank and State-wise; and (f) whether the Government has waived off any crop loans during the period 2015- 2021 and if so, the details thereof, State-wise?

Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plans to promote tourism in Rajasthan including Alwar district in view of the huge potential for development of tourism there; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of steps being taken by the Union Government to promote tourism in Rajasthan?

from: ['Khadse, Smt. Raksha Nikhil', 'Patil, Shri Sanjay(Kaka) Ramchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the crisis of global warming is getting worse day-by-day and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government envisages the ice melting effect due to global warming; (c) whether the sea level is rising due to the avalanche and if so, the details of studies and surveys in this regard; (d) whether the Government has framed any Committee in this regard and if so, the details thereof; . (e) whether there are any fears that many cities of the world will be submerged in floods by 2100 with the effect of all these?

topic: Eklavya Model Residential School (EMRS) in Kerala
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to establish new Eklavya Model Residential Schools (EMRS) in Kerala; (b) if so, the details thereof including EMRSs sanctioned in Wayanad parliamentary constituency; (c) whether suitable land has been made available by the State Government for establishment of EMRSs in all eligible blocks in Kerala; (d) if not, the details of blocks where suitable land is not available; (e) whether the Government has received proposals for the establishment of Eklavya Model Residential Schools and Centre of Excellence in Sports in Kerala; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the total number of cases involving illegal trafficking of endangered animals during the last three years; (b) the number of endangered animals killed during the last three years; (c) the number of people with cases registered against them for the killing or trafficking of endangered animals during the last three years; and (d) the steps the Ministry is taking to prevent the illegal trafficking of endangered animals?

from: ['Beesetti , Dr. Venkata Satyavathi', 'Chinta Anuradha, Smt.', 'Reddy, Shri Magunta Sreenivasulu']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the United States of America (USA) continues to provide technical support to Indias National Infrastructure and Investment Fund; 26 (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the USA is also collaborating through continued technical support for the issuance of municipal bonds, including Green Bonds, for critical urban infrastructure improvements; and (d) if so, the details thereof including the details of municipalities that have issued such green bonds in the country?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

topic: Status of Sites under Adopt A Heritage Scheme in Tamil Nadu
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the details of the status of sites covered under the Adopt a Heritage scheme of the Union Government in the State of Tamil Nadu; (b) the details of the budget allocated and utilised by the State of Tamil Nadu under this scheme since 2019; and (c) whether the Government has taken any steps or assigned timelines for the development and promotion of heritage sites in the State of Tamil Nadus and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Trained Teachers for Children with Special Needs
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether there is an acute shortage of trained teachers to take care of the children with special needs (CWSN) in the country; (b) if so, the number of such children in the country and number of teachers available for them; (c) whether Right to Free and Compulsory Education Act applies to all schools including schools admitting such children; and (d) if so, the details thereof and steps taken or being taken by Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the details of the current capacity of carbon sinks in India in terms of Carbon Dioxide (CO2) equivalent; (b) the details of the current rate of afforestation in India, State/UT-wise; . (c) whether the said rate is commensurate with the target of creating an additional carbon sink of 2.5 to 3 billion tonnes of CO2 equivalent through additional forest and tree cover by 2030 and reduction of carbon emissions by 1 Billion Tonnes as per the Indias Nationally Determined Contributions; (d) if so, the details thereof with the intended plan to achieve the stated target and mechanisms to check compliance and if not, the reasons thereof; and (e) whether the Government has made any plans to include massive tree-planting efforts and the restoration of wetlands to absorb carbon and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the reasons for the day-by-day worsening of environmental condition despite the measures taken regarding its protection including the details thereof; (b) whether the Government proposes to constitute forest development committees of youth, women and men for development of forest area development; if so, the details thereof; if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the reasons for the plants and trees not growing on the land in adequate number despite lakhs-crores of trees and plants being planted each year; (d) whether the Government is aware of its serious consequences; if so, the details of effective steps taken in this regard; and (e) whether the Government proposes to fix accountability of officers and employees in the forest area as the Banswara-Dungarpur parliamentary constituency is tribal dominated area and if so, the time by which it is likely to be done and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the State Bank of India (SBI) appoints handlers of customer service centre through its nominated agency instead of doing it directly and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the SBI initially transfers commission of the handlers of its customer service centre into the account of the nominated agency instead of giving it directly to them and if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor; 27 (c) whether the nominated agency gives only 45-50 per cent commission to the handlers of customer service centre and exploits them and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether any nexus is taking place between SBI and the nominated agency and financial irregularities are taking place in the payment of commission; and (e) if so, the details thereof alongwith the corrective steps taken/proposed to be taken by the Government in this regarde?

from: ['Karadi, Shri Sanganna Amarappa', 'Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.', 'Surya, Shri L.S. Tejasvi', 'Simha, Shri Prathap', 'Raghavendra, Shri B. Y.']
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry has assessed the skills-gap of the youth in the country; (b) if so, whether the plan to reduce the same has been envisaged yet; (c) if not, whether the Ministry intends to do the same in near future to harness the Demographic Dividend; (d) the steps taken/ proposed to be taken to improve the skill mismatch in the country; and (e) the outcomes achieved under all the programmes /schemes?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

from: ['Rajenimbalkar, Shri Omprakash Bhupalsingh alias Pavan', 'Tumane, Shri Krupal Balaji']
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the schemes of the Government to reduce unemployment which is increasing continuously in the country; (b) whether the employment opportunities have reduced and the percentage of unemployment has increased in the country during the last six months; if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to provide any financial assistance to the people who have lost their jobs during the second wave of Covid-19; if so, the details thereof; (d) the State/UT-wise number of casual/contractual workers retrenched during the second wave of Covid-19 pandamic; (e) the details of welfare measures to compensate the said workers for losing their jobs along with the . number of workers who have been provided adequate compensation; and (f) whether the Government has implemented any scheme to provide financial assistance to the said workers/labourers and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the latest string of official numbers, including almost-record GST collections, healthy direct tax inflows, strong manufacturing and exports, provide some confidence that the economy has lurched back from the danger zone for the second time in less than a year owing to the COVID-19 pandemic but the healing is still too uneven; and (b) if so, the details thereof and the present status of GST collections, the GST released to States/pending to each State and the reasons for their pendency till date?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any scheme to award National Fellowship and Scholarship for the students from the Scheduled Tribe category for higher education; if so, the details thereof; (b) the details of the students from the Scheduled Tribe category who have been awarded the National Fellowship and Scholarship for higher education ever since the inception of the Fellowship and Scholarship; (c) the details of the girl students from the Scheduled Tribe Category who have been given the National Fellowship and Scholarship award for higher education ever since this award came into effect; and (d) the details of the year wise list of such girl students?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Public Sector Banks (PSBs) which are operating from the rented buildings and not paying rent in the country including Uttar Pradesh; and 28 (b) if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor, bank-wise?

topic: Mandatory Aadhaar Number to Banking Service Provider
from: ['Dhanorkar, Shri Balubhau Narayanrao (Alias Suresh)', 'K. Navas, Shri Kani']
contents: Will the Minister of Finance be pleased to state: (a) whether as per the Prevention of Money- laundering (Maintenance of Records) Third Amendment Rules, 2019, if one wishes to receive any benefit or subsidy under any scheme notified under section 7 of the Aadhaar (Targeted Delivery of Financial and Other Subsidies, Benefit and Services) Act, 2016 (18 of 2016), it is mandatory to submit Aadhaar number to the banking service provider; (b) the steps taken by the Government to fill the gaps in the delivery of Government subsidies to the bank accounts of the beneficiaries; (c) whether in the e-SHRAM portal, the bank accounts of 74.78 per cent or 3.9 crore unorganised sector workers are not linked with Aadhaar; and (d) if so, the reasons therefor?

topic: Unlicensed Sale of Fake Archaeological Artefacts in Ernakulam
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of illegal and unlicensed sale of fake archaeological artifacts in Ernakulam, Kerala State, by an individual named Monson Mavunkal claiming to be in possession of rare archaeological artifacts? (b) if so, whether the Government has taken steps to enquire about the matter as claims of artifacts reportedly predating centuries were in the possession of Monson Mavunkal; and (c) whether the Government is aware of individuals trading and dealing with articles of archaeological value without permission, registration or license from Archaeological Survey of India and indulging in transnational smuggling of such artifacts and if so, the steps taken to regulate, prevent and monitor such acts by individuals; (d) whether the Government is in possession of details pertaining to the total value of such articles that have been recovered; and (f) if so, the details of such cases and action taken thereupon? .

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether recently any survey has been undertaken regarding labourers of unorganised sector in the country and their employment status; (b) if so, the State-wise/district-wise details of such labourers in the country as on date; (c) the number of days for which they are getting employment; and (d) the manner in which it is being ensured that they are getting employment and minimum fixed wages?

from: ['Barne, Shri Shrirang Appa', 'Pathak, Shri Subrat', 'Mahato, Shri Bidyut Baran', 'Gupta, Shri Sudheer', 'Mandlik, Prof. Sanjay Sadashivrao', 'Jadhav, Shri Prataprao', 'Tiwari, Shri Manoj Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has formed a 12 member committee headed by National Education Policy-2020 drafting committee Chairperson Shri K Kasturirangan to develop four National Curriculum Frameworks(NCFs) for school, early childhood, teacher and adult education; (b) if so, the details thereof and the outline/contour of the said policy; (c) the details of terms of reference of the committee; (d) whether the said committee has submitted its recommendations and if so, the details thereof and if not the time by which it is likely to be submitted; (e) whether the Committee has invited any subject experts, scholars, educationists etc to decide upon the course of actions with the objective to meet the timelines of the strategy and if so, the details thereof; and (f) whether the Government has held any consultations with the States and Union Territories in this regard and if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena', 'Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: New Schools in Rural and Semi-rural Areas
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to set up new schools in rural/semi-rural areas under various schemes during the next three years; 29 (b) if so, the number of schools proposed to be set up, State and year-wise; (c) the details of the targets, if any, fixed by the Government in this regard; and (d) the action plan prepared by the Government to achieve the targets fixed in this regard?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the funds allocated to the Government of Madhya Pradesh by the Union Government for welfare of the tribals during the last five years and the activities and works for which the said funds have been allocated and the details thereof; (b) the names of the districts which have been provided funds out of the funds provided to Madhya Pradesh by the Union Government for welfare of the tribal ; (c) whether the concerned districts have utilised the above funds; (d) if so, the works for which the fund has been utilised and the details thereof; (e) the funds allocated to Sivani and Balaghat districts under Balaghat Parliamentary Constituency for tribal welfare along with the details of the works for which the said funds have been provided; and (f) the names of the agencies through which the above work has been done and whether these agencies are authorised and the details regarding the completion/ non-completion of work along with the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to improve Heritage Temples combined with Leisure under its 5 Trillion Economy Aspirations in Tirupathi, Srikalahasti, Sullurupeta, Naidupeta, Venkatagiri, Gudur and Satyavedu constituencies which are having prominent temples setting up Indian Tourism Development Corporation Office (ITDC) for conducting 3 Nights/4 Days, 4 Nights/5 Days, 5 Nights/6 Days, 6 Nights/7 Days, 8 Nights/9 Days Circuit Package Trips; and (b) if so, the details thereof ?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any steps for effective implementation of National Education Policy, 2020; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any special guidelines/directions have been issued to States/UTs regarding the Policy ; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the details of Ramsar Sites, declared as such, under the United Nations Convention on Wetlands, State- wise; (b) whether it is a fact that the vast wetlands stretch of Pallikkaranai Marsh in Chennai which is a fully qualified wetland expanding over several hundred square kilometres area, has not been declared a Ramsar Site; (c) if so, the reasons therefor and the action being taken by the Union Government to include Pallikkaranai Marsh wetlands under the scope of Ramsar Convention; and (d) pending its declaration as Ramsar Site, the plans for protecting the Pallikkaranai wetlands from degradation?

topic: Inflation and its Impact on Food and Other Items
from: ['Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath', 'Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of Inflation and its impact on various food and other items; (b) the reasons for increase in inflation on each item/ sector and whether urban poor have been the worst hit by the high inflation that has prevailed over the past one and a half years, and the persistet uptick in fuel prices continues to pose a major threat for them; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the corrective steps being taken in this regard?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to set up new Kendriya Vidyalayas (KVs) during the current academic year; (b) if so, the States where these new KVs are proposed to be set up; (c) whether any new KV is proposed to be set up in Sundargarh and other Scheduled Districts in Odisha and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the steps taken/ proposed to be taken by the Government in this regard ?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to recommend loss making PSUs identified for strategic stake sale for closure and will not wait endlessly and make repeated attempts to get a bidder, if so, the details thereof; (b) the steps taken by the Government regarding the assets of PSUs and the fate of the employees in respect of PSUs closed abruptly without any bidder to revive; (c) the number of companies or PSUs identified for disinvestment and the period of pending disinvestment; and (d) the manner in which the Government will achieve the target of disinvestment?

Will the Minister of DEVELOPMENT OF NORTH EASTERN REGION be pleased to state: (a) the number of start-ups and other unique business opportunities that have received funding under the North East Venture Fund since 2017, State-wise and year-wise; (b) the sector-wise details of such start-ups and unique business opportunities, especially food processing, healthcare, tourism, segregation of services, IT, etc; (c) the number of jobs generated through such start-ups and unique business opportunities, including details of skilled and unskilled labour and female participation, State-wise and year-wise; and (d) the total amount invested under the North East Venture Fund from 2017 to till date?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has noticed that the cost of education especially in the Higher Education is very high which is not afforable for the common students; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the steps taken or porposed to be taken by the Government to to make the Higher Education afforable in addition to support the financially backward students for education?

topic: Funds for Development of Sites in Kottayam
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has listed any proposals from the State Government of Kerala of sites in Kottayam to be developed under the Swadesh Darshan and PRASAD Schemes; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has allocated any funds for the development of the aforesaid sites; and (d) if so, the details thereof, including the amount of funds utilized?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of numbers of beneficiaries registered under E-shram Portal till date, State/district-wise; (b) details of total number of E-shram cards issued in the State of Maharashtra, district-wise along with the details of bank account seeded E-shram cards; (c) whether the Government will share the unorganized labourers data with State governments; if so, whether the Government has envisaged data sharing security measures for the same; and (d) whether the Government is planning for linkage of One-Nation-One-Ration Card, E-Shram Card (especially bank account seeded) and the Election Commission Card for furthering benefits to the unorganised labourers? 31

topic: Development and Maintenance of Sites of Historical Importance in Jharkhand
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether there are any special programs/ plans undertaken for the development and maintenance of Sites of Historical and Cultural importance in the State of Jharkhand; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the amount of funds allocated for the development and maintenance of Sites of Historical and Cultural importance in the State of Jharkhand; and (d) the status of historical sites in Palamu?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the general retention rate of students in Government schools, at the primary, elementary, secondary, and higher secondary levels, State-wise; (b) whether the Government maintains information and data on the rate of drop-outs among children belonging to weaker sections and disadvantaged groups admitted under Section 12(1) (c) of the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act 2009; (c) if not, whether the Government is planning to do so; (d) if so, the retention rate of children with disabilities, at the primary, elementary, secondary, and higher secondary levels, State-wise; and (e) the retention rate of children belonging to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes, at the primary, elementary, secondary, and higher secondary levels, State-wise?

topic: Quality of Training in Industrial Training Institutes
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the number of Industrial Training Institutes running across the country at present, State-wise; (b) whether the Government is satisfied with the quality of training being imparted by these Industrial Training Institutes, if not, whether any steps are being taken to improve the quality of such Institutes; . (c) whether the Government proposes to establish other Industrial Training Institutes in the country including Rajasthan; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the problem of unemployment has aggravated in the country during the last five years; (b) if so, the details of the unemployment rate during the said period, year-wise; and (c) the number of unemployed that have been provided employment during the last five years and the steps being taken by the Government to provide employment to the unemployed?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the cryptocurrencies that are traded in India; (b) if so, whether trading in cryptocurrency is legally permitted in India and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has allowed the cryptocurrency exchanges as a legally permitted entity in India; and (d) if so, the details of Acts that are applicable to cryptocurrency and cryptocurrency exchanges?

topic: National Strategy for Meetings, Incentives, Conferences and Exhibitions (MICE)
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to adopt a National Strategy for Meetings, Incentives, Conferences and Exhibitions (MICE) which is one of the important segments of business tourism; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of Indias share of Global market in this MICE segment of business tourism at present; and (d) the proportion of Indians going abroad or outbound for such tourism and the details thereof? 32

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made an assessment of the impact of COVID-19 and the lockdown on tribal communities; (b) if so, the details thereof including the tribal population and districts affected by COVID-19; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the details of the measures that have been undertaken by the Government to address the problems faced by tribal communities during COVID-19?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the ESIC hospitals are constructed by the Ministry and if so, the complete details of the construction of these hospitals; and (b) whether the Government proposes to construct an ESIC hospital of 500 beds in view of the population of Darbhanga which is the centre of the Mithila and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Singh, Shri Rajiv Ranjan Alias Lalan Singh', 'Kumar, Shri Kaushalendra']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether there is an increasing trend in high net worth income group of Indian industrialists who have left the country and settled abroad in the last five-six years and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether it is true that approximately 35000 Indian industrialists or even more such high net worth people have left the country from 2014 to 2021 and taken the status of NRI ; (c) if so, whether the Government has any plan to stop such people from taking NRI status; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of TOURISM . be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry of Tourism has launched the Swadesh Darshan scheme to cover the rural parts of the country for development of tourism and employment; (b) if so , the details thereof and if not the reasons therefor; (c) the details of the numbers of persons who got employment directly or indirectly due to development of the tourism sector in India; (d) whether the Government has identified most backward areas of all States to promote development of the tourism sector in india; and (e) if so, the details thereof and the steps taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the total number of beneficiaries under the Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana; (b) whether the scheme had expired on 30th June 2021; and (c) whether the Government has extended the duration of the scheme; and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the main features of the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana; (b) the details of funds sanctioned, allocated and utilised so far under this scheme in tribal dominated States including Jharkhand, Odisha, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra; (c) whether the Government has received any information regarding misuse of funds allocated under this scheme; and (d) if so, the details thereof along with the measures taken by the Government to tackle the problem?

topic: Development of Ancient Places of Pilgrimage in Nanded
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: 33 (a) whether the Government has received any proposals seeking development of ancient places of pilgrimage in Nanded; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of action being taken by the Government to develop places of pilgrimage in Nanded district; (d) whether various other places including Nanded are likely to be included in the budget 2022-2023 to promote development of tourist places; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Identification of Tourist Spots of Odisha
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the number of tourist spots of Nabarangpur, Malkangiri and Koraput districts of ODISHA which have been identified by the Government during last five financial years; (b) the funds allocated by the Government for the development of the said tourist spots; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that over 20,000 families, mostly Adivasis/tribals, face the threat of displacement, as a result of commercial licenses given for coal mining in the States of Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and Odisha; (b) if so, the detail of action taken by Government thereto; and (c) the post-covid action and vaccination process taken for almost 14 million tribes of the country therefor?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to develop the infrastructure facilities of ESI Hospitals; if so, the details thereof; (b) whether it comes to the notice of the Government that the infrastructure facilities of ESI Hospitals in Kerala is less; . (c) if so, the action taken to improve the infrastructure facilities; (d) whether the Government proposes to develop the infrastructure facilities of Asramam ESI Super speciality Model Hospital Kollam Kerala, if so, the details of proposals pending and the action taken thereon; (e) whether the Government proposes to provide more human resources to Asramam ESI Hospital Kollam; if so, the details thereof; and (f) whether the Government proposes to provide modern equipment for Asramam ESI Hospital Kollam, if so, the details thereof?

topic: Constraints and challenges in Environmental Protection
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the details of measures taken for environmental protection; (b) the details of the environmental constraints and challenges and the plans being made by the Government to overcome such challenges; (c) whether Joint Forest Management will be implemented in the form of an integrated programme of the people in the National Forest Policy, 1988; (d) the steps taken for its implementation and the details thereof; (e) whether the Government is contemplating to chalk out a programme of economic development of forest dwellers on the basis of ecological development, if so, the details thereof; (f) the details of the steps taken to reduce the emission of greenhouse gases; and (g) the number of forest areas identified in Prayagraj district including the steps taken for its development?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the schemes being implemented by the Government for increasing womens employability and their skills development have yielded expected results during the last three years; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise, scheme/ programme-wise and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the cases of irregularities/corruption in the implementation of the said schemes have come to the notice of the Government during the said period; and 34 (d) if so, the details thereof, State-wise scheme/ programme-wise along with the action taken/being taken by the Government till date?

topic: Monitoring Norms of Directorate General  of Valuation
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the guidelines/norms to monitor the under/over valued export/import issued by the Directorate General of Valuation in the country; (b) whether cases of violation of the said guidelines/ norms have come to the notice of the Government during the last three years and the current year; (c) if so, the details thereof, State/UT and company- wise and the reasons therefor along with the action taken/being taken by the Government in such cases; (d) whether the Government has estimated the revenue loss on account of such under/over valued export/import across the country during the said period; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor along with the manner in which such loss is likely to be recovered from the violators and the further steps taken/being taken by the Government in this direction?

topic: Evaluation of the Level of the Higher Education
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether any survey or study has been conducted by the Government to evaluate the level of higher education in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the action plan of the Government to improve the standard of higher education in the current global scenario?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the extent of pollution has increased in Delhi and adjoining areas in November, 2021; (b) if so, whether the Government has examined the causes, if so, the details thereof; . (c) the steps taken by the Union Government and NCT of Delhi to check the alarming pollution of NCR and Delhi; (d) whether the Honble Supreme Court has issued any directions in this regard, if so, the details thereof and action taken thereon; and (e) whether the problem of pollution recurs during these days each year, if so, the steps being taken to prevent such reoccurence in future?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether it has come to the notice of the Government from any source, public or private, that there is an authorization vulnerability in CDSLs KYC API, leading to exposure of massive amounts of sensitive data on the internet; (b) if so, the assessment of the vulnerability that has come to the notice of the Government and whether it has taken measures to secure this vulnerability; (c) if not, the steps that the Government is actively undertaking to detect such threats and vulnerabilities in the CDSLs KYC API; and (d) whether there have been any other cases of similar data leaks or KYC frauds and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Uniform Plan to issue ST Certificates
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is proposing the ease the procedure for the issue of ST certificate and to issue caste certificates to tribal people across the country including in Tamil Nadu; if so, the details thereof; (b) the efforts being taken by the Government to increase the literacy level of tribals in the country; (c) whether the Government has any plan to introduce a special housing scheme for Tribals; and (d) whether the Police department of various states still treat some tribal communities as habitual offenders; and if so, the proposal of the Government to change this colonial mindset?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT 35 be pleased to state: (a) the details of current unemployment rate in the country both in rural and urban Sector; (b) whether it is a fact that the unemployment rate in rural areas is rising day by day; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the action taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the detail of proposal to replace the entire e-learning process into offline education system for all children in the schools and colleges of the country; and (b) the time by which digital media is likely to replace the classroom education?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the details of the mid day meal along with components (raw material, cook honorarium etc) for each student, year-wise and State-wise particularly of Parliamentary Constituency, Amravati; (b) whether the Government has conducted any survey or complied to any survey for minimum necessary amount to provide nutrition food to each child and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether during the complete lockdown due to global corona pandemic online classes were arranged in all the Government schools across the country particularly in Maharashtra including Amravati; (d) if so, the details of the assistance provided by the Union Government to the States for online education; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Funds Allocation to North Eastern States
contents: Will the Minister of DEVELOPMENT OF NORTH EASTERN REGION be pleased to state: (a) the funds allocated to the North-Easter States including Assam during the period from 2004 to 2014 and after 2014 so far; . (b) whether the allocated funds have been utilised by these States within the stipulated time frame; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) if not, the reasons therefor; and (e) the steps taken or proposed to be taken by the Government to ensure the proper utilisation of allocated funds within the prescribed time-limit?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of multicrore Bitcoin scam recently unearthed in Karnataka wherein a person was arrested in connection with hacking of bitcoins worldwide; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the money involved in this case; (c) whether the Government proposes to hand over the investigation to ED/CBI/any special Central agency or special investigation team as the scam involves transaction of international nature; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the action taken or being taken by the Government for fair investigation of the scam and the time by which it is likely to be initiated?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government maintains data on the number of tea-garden workers in the North East region; (b) if so, the details thereof, State, district and gender-wise and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government has conducted an assessment of the economic impact of COVID-19 on tea- garden workers in Assam, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) whether the Government has or intends to provide economic relief to tea-garden workers in light of COVID- 19, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) whether the Government has received any proposals from the State Governments in the North-East to provide suport to tea-garden workers for the same; (f) if so, the details thereof, including the Governments response thereto? 36

topic: Beautification of Ancient Heritage of Nalanda
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is contemplating to take any special steps for the beautification of the renowned ancient heritage in Nalanda; (b) whether the Government is contemplating a scheme for the construction of a five-star hotel in Rajgir to provide facility to the pilgrims and foreign tourists visiting the said place; (c) whether the Government is contemplating to connect Nalanda directly to Patna and Gaya airports through express-way road; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of municipal solid waste (MSW) disposal by dumping it on the outskirts of the urban centres, which release methane and carbon dioxide and increase the effects of greenhouse gases thereby posing a major urban environmental problem; (b) whether the Government proposes to adopt proven waste to energy conversion techniques, as adopted by the European Union and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the existing environmental laws have proved to be ineffective due to lack of enforcement, the lack of resources and technical challenges faced by a large number of Indian companies, especially the SMEs and if so, the steps taken in this regard; and (d) the necessary steps taken/proposed to be taken by the Government to devise and adopt some sustainable actions to address the myriad issues faced by the country particularly environmental degradation?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government agrees with the view that an effective professional capacity building strategy is required for providing continuous support and mentorship to teachers? (b) if so, the steps taken/proposed to be taken by the Government in this regard and (c) if not, the reasons therefor? .

topic: Pradhan Mantri Atmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar Yojana
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the salient features of the Pradhan Mantri Atmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar Yojna and the details of the funds sanctioned allocated and utilized so far in Maharashtra under the said scheme ; (b) the details of the number of beneficiaries covered under this scheme so far in Maharashtra alongwith the targets set and achievements made thereunder and the details of the reaction thereto; and (c) the details of the steps being taken by the Government to comprehensively cover the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme in the State?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is planning to open Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya and Kendriya Vidyalaya in newly created Districts in Assam specially Charideo in Jorhat Constituency; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reason therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government has received any proposal from Telangana requesting for release of funds on account of formation of 21 new rural districts in the State; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any decision has been taken by the Union Government in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: 37 (a) whether as reported the Uttarakhand State Wildlife Board has cleared a proposal by the Wildlife Institute of India to introduce rhinoceroses in the Corbett Tiger Reserve to boost tourism and revive the habits of species that survive on low-height grass; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government will take similar steps for providing rhinoceroses to Anamalai Tiger Reserve located in Tamil Nadu; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Sharma, Shri Kuldeep Rai', 'Tatkare, Shri Sunil Dattatray', 'Kolhe, Dr. Amol Ramsing', 'Sharma, Shri Anurag', 'Kirtikar, Shri Gajanan Chandrakant', 'Selvam, Shri Ganesan', 'Bhamre, Dr. Subhash Ramrao', 'Annadurai, Shri C.N.', 'DNV Senthilkumar S, Dr.', 'Kumar, Shri Dhanush M', 'Rathod, Shri Ratansinh Magansinh', 'Tripura, Shri Rebati', 'Pon, Dr. Gautham Sigamani', 'Bhavana Gawali (Patil), Ms.']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has observed Shikshak Parv recently and if so, the details thereof alongwith the theme of the Parv and programmes organized to mark the occasion; (b) the funds sanctioned and utilized for this purpose; (c) the various academic initiatives to modernize the education sector launched by the Government during the Parv; (d) whether the Government has taken steps to train the teachers to rapidly changing era in the country, particularly in remote , rural and backward areas to learn about new systems and techniques for efficient teaching after the implementation of the New Education Policy, 2020 and if so, the details thereof and the outcome thereof; (e) the steps taken by the Government to open more primary and secondary schools in the State of Maharashtra; (f) the other steps taken by the Government to make our education system globally competitive and also make the youth future secured; and (g) whether the Government proposes to train teachers in remote areas, rural and backward villages after implementation of New Education Policy 2020 and if so, the details thereof? .
