Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government keeps updating the list of recognised State Scheduled Tribes; and (b) the steps taken by the Government to include new tribes who fulfill the necessary criteria of recognisation into the state Tribal list of different States?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that China is investing in tech-companies in India; (b) if so, whether many companies are lobbying in favour of China and whether many anti-India activities of these companies have came into light, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government plans to initiate investigation against them; and . (d) if so, the details thereof along with the time by which it is likely to be completed and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Kanumuru, Shri Raghu Ramakrishna Raju', 'Kesineni, Shri Srinivas']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of gross borrowing ceiling limits and net borrowing ceiling limits of Andhra Pradesh, prescribed by the Ministry for the financial year 2021-2022 along with full calculation details; (b) whether these borrowings are taken into consideration by the Ministry while arriving at state gross borrowings ceiling limit and net borrowing ceiling limit as per FRBM Act since the borrowings of state-owned entities are being serviced/escrow state revenue through State Budget and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Ministry would disclose the office Memorandums in the public domain from time to time about states gross borrowings ceiling limit consents with full calculation details for ensuring transparency in public financial matters as RBI and other externally aided agencies have been doing the same and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the States can resort to additional borrowings by exceeding the borrowing limits prescribed by the Ministry in the name of State-owned shell/suit case companies for financing routine Government expenditure/ freebie schemes and if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Telugu Desam Party']

topic: Loan to Women Entrepreneurs under PMMY
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that women entrepreneurs are being provided loan on priority to set up industries under Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY); (b) if so, the details of targets given to banks for providing loans to women entrepreneurs under the scheme during current financial year in Maharashtra; (c) whether it is also a fact that a large number of loan applications are being rejected on technical grounds; (d) if so, whether the Government would issue proper directions to banks for correction of the mistakes found in the applications and accepting them; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has announced Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (PNGKY) to get basic facilities to the weaker sections of society in Bihar and Parliamentary constituency Katihar; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the aims and objectives of the said scheme; (c) the details of financial assistance released to Bihar and Parliamentary constituency Katihar under the said package; (d) the number of people who are benefited from this package; and (e) the details of the criteria laid down by the Government for availing the benefits of this scheme?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the proposal of State of Odisha for release of Rs. 903.03 Cr. under CAMPA APO 2021-22 has been received by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change; (b) if so, whether there is any valid reason for delay in approval of the balance funds of Rs.37.25 Cr. and whether it will affect the afforestation and forest & wildlife management programmes in the State of Odisha during FY 2021-22; and (c) the year-wise and State-wise details of budgetary allocation and expenditure on National afforestation programmes to improve the forest cover in the country from 2014-15 to 2021-22?

topic: Development of Tourist Circuits in Bundelkhand
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to develop centres of tourist interest and link them with the revived major ponds/lakes/dams in Bundelkhand under the Jal Jeevan Mission; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to develop tourist circuits by interlinking these sites; and (d) if so, the details thereof? .

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the number of school students in the country who do not have access to any form of online learning or e- learning State and UT-wise break-up; (b) the measures taken to ensure seamless continuation of learning for students who lack such access; (c) the details of measures taken to equip teachers with appropriate resources to continue conducting classes during the Covid-19 pandemic; and (d) the frameworks, if any, for the safe reopening of schools and universities and contingency plans for prolonged e-learning in case of extended closure of schools and Universities?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has implemented a seven year strategy (2017-18 to 2023-24) to reduce the number of bonded labourers to 50% of the 2016 estimate; (b) if so, the details thereof including the progress made till date, and if not, the reasons therefore; (c) whether the Government has implemented a three year action plan (2017-18 to 2019-20) to survey bonded labourers across States and if so, the details thereof including the progress made till date, and if not, the reasons therefore; (d) the details of the Year-wise budgetary allocations and funds released towards addressing the issue of bonded labour, from 2014 till date; and (e) whether the Government has a strategy to eradicate bonded labour, if so, the time set to completely eradicate bonded labour and the budgetary allocation made to complete this target from 2014 to date?

topic: Inclusion of Transgender Children in School Education
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the reasons to remove the manual titled Inclusion of Transgender Children in School Education: Concerns and Roadmap from the National Council for Education Research and Training (NCERT) website; 662 (b) whether the Government considers it important to sensitise the education system for Transgender children; and (c) whether the NCERT have another manual for teachers on building sensitivity towards Transgender children in school and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a)the details of the State-wise allocation and utilisation of funds under the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) since 2019; (b) whether the Government has allocated funds for the installation of Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Systems (CAAQMS) in India and if so, the district-wise details of funds allocated in the State of Tamil Nadu and CAAQMS installed in the State till date; and (c) whether the Government has an assessment mechanism to look over the effective implementation of the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether any target has been fixed for the private sector banks for implementation of Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana in Jharkhand including Ranchi and if so, the details of the banks that have achieved such target; (b) the details of targets fixed for the private sector banks providing loans under the Pradhan Manthri Awas Yojna along with the name of banks that have achieved the targets; (c) whether the Government has introduced any scheme for providing a loan of Rs. 10,000 to the vendors during the corona pandemic; and (d) if so, the details thereof including the number of venders benefitted therefrom?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the total amount of stipend sanctioned for the apprentice getting apprentice-ship training during the year . 2021-22 to 2025-23 (till March 2026) under National Apprentice-ship Training Scheme (NATS); (b) the total number of apprentices likely to be trained by industrial and commercial organisations; and (c) the details thereof?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has data of displaced tribal population over the last five years; (b) if so, the reasons for displacement and number of displaced persons, State-wise; (c) the details of assistance provided to such tribals by the Government; and (d) whether the Government provides any compensation as Intellectual Property Right to the Tribals for the traditional knowledge of tribal medicines and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether any cases of forgery and fraud at a large scale involving crores of rupees by Public Sector Banks (PSBs) including Punjab National Bank by way of issuing false Sale Certificate has come to notice of the Government; (b) if so, whether this is the biggest ever case of fraud and forgery in the Punjab National Bank and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has issued any guidelines or circulars by stating that both OTS (One Time Settlement) and SARFAESI action can not be initiated simultaneously and if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor along with the action being taken by the Government against the guilty officers/ officials of the bank?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the number of tigers killed by poachers in Bandhavgarh Forest area of Madhya Pradesh during the last three years; 663 (b) whether an Inter-State racket of poaching of wild animals in Bandhavgarh forest was busted by the State Government of Madhya Pradesh recently and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the said poaching racket was operating from other States and involved residents of the Wildlife Sanctuary, for poaching of tigers in Madhya Pradesh and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government is aware that such rackets are also involved in poaching of wild animals in other States, if so, the reaction of the Government thereto; and (e) whether the Government is considering to conduct any high level inquiry in this regard and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the rate of unemployment in the entire country has risen to record levels during the course of the pandemic as per the data released by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) and if so, the details thereof for the last five years, State-wise; (b) whether immediate, as well as long-term solutions are being taken regarding the creation of jobs and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the manner in which the Ministry intends to execute its plans despite a decrease in allocation for the MGNREGA Scheme; and (d) whether it has taken or plans to take measures to cope with this increased demand for work and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to provide any support to train school teachers in regional languages to implement the policy of regional-language based instruction for school children envisaged in the National Education Policy 2020; (b) if so, whether the Government has prepared any detailed action plan for the implementation of the Multilingual Education (MLE) policy under the NEP, in terms of pedagogical changes, logistical requirements, and selection of the regional language for instruction by schools and students; (c) the details of any pilot project the Government has undertaken or plans to undertake to try the MLE model is schools; and (d) the details of the budget allocated and utilised for Teachers Training during the last 3 years (2019-20, 2020- 21 and 2021-22), State-wise?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that Census 2011 indicated that India had 45.6 crore migrants and 2016-17 Economic Survey tracked only inter-State migrant mobility to 6 crore; (b) if so, whether migrant workers play an important role in nation building and meeting the needs of a particular State; (c) if so, whether after passing laws for reservation to locals by different States, migrant workers have been hit hard in regard to harassment, deaths in those States especially in Maharashtra, Haryana, Jammu and Kashmir, Tamil Nadu and Gujarat; and (d) if so, the steps taken or being taken by the Union Government in consultation with States after recent killing of workers in Jammu and Kashmir for safety, security and employment to migrants in these States?

topic: Appointment of Independent Directors in PSBs
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has established guidelines to avoid conflict of interests in appointments of independent directors to the boards of Public Sector Banks (PSBs); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has established an independent vetting/screening process to avoid conflict of interest for candidates being considered for the said posts; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the details of proposals under consideration for establishing a screening process in this regard?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry has commissioned a survey of degraded forests in Meghalaya; (b) the details of the Detailed Project Report for Meghalaya; (c) whether the DPR has not been completed so far for Meghalaya, if so, the reasons therefor; and (d) the expected date of completion for the same? 664

topic: Agreement With IRCTC to Strengthen Tourism Industry
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry has signed an agreement with the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) to strengthen the hospitality and tourism industry; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the necessary steps taken/proposed to be taken by the Government to encourage and promote strategic and technical cooperation in the Indian hospitality and tourism sector; (d) if so, the details thereof along with the areas identified for promotion of the tourism industry in the country; and (e) the other necessary steps taken by the Government to strengthen the hospitality and tourism industry after the coronavirus pandemic left it in heavy losses?

topic: Construction and Maintenance of Public Libraries
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the number of Public Libraries functioning at present in the country, State/UT- wise including Bihar; (b) whether the Government is planning to carry out construction or maintenance work of public libraries located in various parts of the country including Gujarat during the last three years; (c) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise including Bihar; and (d) the details of funds spent for this purpose, State/ UT-wise?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is advising from time-to- time not to use plastic bags; (b) if so, whether the Government proposes to close the manufacturing units of plastic bags; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the details of losses caused by use of plastic? .

topic: Funds to Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the present status of the implemenation of Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY) and the achievements made under the scheme, so far; (b) the list of centres set up in the State of Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Gujarat district-wise; (c) the amount of funds allocated, disbursed and utilised, State-wise; (d) the number of beneficiaries of PMKVY in Tamil Nadu, particularly in Thiruvannamalai district of Tamil Nadu; and (e) the amount of funds allocated, disbursed and utilised for the aforesaid project?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that there are about eight lakhs companies registered in the country but only 23000 are providing apprenticeship facility; (b) if so, the steps being taken to provide apprenticeship facility in all companies; (c) whether a target was fixed to provide apprenticeship to five lakh youth during 2019-20; (d) if so, whether the target has been fully achieved; (e) if not, the reasons therefor; (f) the number of the youth provided apprenticeship State-wise and companies-wise; and (g) the steps taken by the Government against the company not providing apprenticeship facility and also against the companies not meeting the target?

topic: Minimum Wage for Tea Garden Workers
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government intends to increase minimum wage for tea garden workers in Assam and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (b) whether the Government intends to provide pattas for the over 6 lakh plus tea-garden worker families in Assam 665 to help secure land ownership and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government maintains data on the number of tea garden workers covered by Ayushman Bharat and Employes State Insurance respectively; (d) if so, the details thereof, year-wise from 2014 till date of the number of tea garden workers covered under ESI and from inception till date for Ayushman Bharat, and whether the Government intends to take any measures to increase coverage thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the number of cooperative banks operating in the country, State-wise; (b) the details of the assets and liabilities of these banks; (c) the quantum of loans disbursed by these banks; (d) whether there are any Non-performing Assets of these banks and if so, the details thereof, Bank-wise; and (e) the rules and laws which are applicable to check any irregularity therein by Reserve Bank of India?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the amount of funds allocated by NABARD to the Government of Odisha during the last three years; (b) whether the said funds have been allocated for Mega Piped Drinking water Supply Projects; and (c) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the scheme such as Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana has started in the country including the State of Bihar; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, reasons therefor in Bihar particularly in district Gopalganj; . (c) the details about the number of beneficiaries under the Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana in Bihar particularly in district Gopalganj; (d) whether the scheme has covered rural part of the country, if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of the amount sanctioned to State of Bihar and spent under this scheme?

topic: Projects Pioritised For the Development of Tourism in  West  Bengal
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) the details of the projects prioritized for the development of tourism in West Bengal and funds provided thereunder during the last five years; (b) whether the Government provides any special package to the States/UTs for the development of tourism and if so, the details thereof indicating the package provided during the said period; (d) the monitoring mechanism put in place by the Government to review the progress of such projects; and (e) the other measures being taken by the Government to promote tourism in West Bengal?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether Anamalai and Mudumalai tiger reserves in Tamil Nadu have attained the elite global tag; (b) if so, the details thereof and the number of tiger reserves in the county that have attained the tag, State- wise; and (c) whether any steps are being taken by the Government to further promote and conserve the tiger population in the country, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the progress achieved in SUNREF Green Housing Programme as conceived by the National Housing Bank (NHB) along with the EU and French Development Agency; 666 (b) the details of funds sanctioned and utilized under the programme so far; (c) whether the Government is contemplating to utilize investment in green solutions in existing housing schemes of Andhra Pradesh; and (d) if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the increase in the chemical and pharmaceutical pollution of rivers and soil due to irresponsible discharge of chemicals and pharmaceutical compounds from industries and if so, the details, thereof; (b) whether there are any regulations that limit the concentration of API residue in the wastewater released from hospitals, and pharmaceutical manufacturing units and if so, the details thereof; (c) if not, whether the Government plans to implement a framework that limits the concentration of API residue in the wastewaters released from hospitals and pharmaceutical manufacturing units; (d) whether the common effluent treatment plants are capable of neutralizing API residue present in the wastewater of hospitals and pharmaceutical manufacturing units; and (e) if not, whether the Government is exploring any novel technological interventions to neutralize the API residues present in the wastewaters of hospitals and pharmaceutical manufacturing units?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the number of Indian Institute of Science (IISCs) have been established as on date State-wise including year wise, district wise; (b) whether Government has considered increasing engagement between IISCs and Insdustrial Training Institute (ITIs) to facilitate transfer of knowledge between domestic and foreign skill development standards and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is in talks with other countries for skill development and migration of grey and blue collar workers and if so, the details thereof; (d) the number of IISCs that have been IT-enabled post Covid 19, and how many apprentices have enrolled therein previous year, State wise; . (e) whether the Government has taken any specialised efforts to ramp up the enrollment in centres which have been impacted poorly due the the pandemic; and (f) whether the Government is considering amendments to the Apprenticeship Act, 1961 to enable institutions to provide formal apprenticeship training?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government plans to consider wage revision proposals of public sector general insurance companies; (b) if so, the details thereof including the details of negotiations being conducted for the same; (c) whether the Government has observed rising online loan apps and related cases of individual debt burden in India; and (d) if so, the details thereof including the manner in which such loans are being regulated by the Government?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether there is shortage of teaching faculty in the Universities throughout the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is facing the shortage of qualified teachers; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government has any plan to give more concessions in eligibility related norms for appointment in the Universities; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the financial allocation made by the Ministry over the last five financial years across the country; (b) the details of the financial allocation for the same period to Odisha; and 667 (c) the details of fund released and spent, district wise?

Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Central Advisory Board on Archaeology (CABA) has not met for years and if so, the details thereof and the time and details of the last meeting held by the Board; (b) whether the Government has any plans to revamp and reconstitute CABA and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor and the present composition of the Board; (c) whether the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) is marred by the absence of subject experts for the top posts including the DG and qualified Archaeologists as Assistant Archaeologists in various circles of ASI; (d) if so, the details thereof and the current status of manpower in ASI and vacancies; and (e) the effective steps taken by the Government to fill up the vacancies?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Registrar General of India (RGI) and the National Commission for Scheduled Tribes has concurred with recommendation of Odisha Government for inclusion of Jhodia and Dora community in the Scheduled Tribes list; (b) if so, the details thereof and the current status of application; and (c) if not, the reasons for non-inclusion and the process by which these two communities will be included in the list of Scheduled Tribes?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the number of registered company as One Person Company (OPC) in India during the current year, State- wise; (b) the number of the said companies out of them which have been registered by the NRIs; (c) whether some of OPC have changed their identity as Public or Private company during the current year as per the flexibility given by the present Government; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the initiatives undertaken by the Government to provide skill training to domestic workers; and (b) the details of such initiatives/schemes undertaken by the Government to provide skill training to domestic and workers working in unorganized sector?

topic: Credit to Agriculture Sector in Maharashtra
from: ['Jadhav, Shri Sanjay Haribhau', 'Raut, Shri Vinayak Bhaurao']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government announces such specific measures so that Commercial banks will be able to deliver adequate and timely credit in agriculture and the allied sector as well as to Self Help Groups (SHGs) in the State of Maharashtra which is essential for economic and social development; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government will allow Women SHGs to act as banking Correspondents by infusing adequate liquidity; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Madhav, Shri Kuruva Gorantla', 'Chinta Anuradha, Smt.', 'Ramesh, Shri T.R.V.S.', 'Sridhar, Shri Kotagiri', 'Satyanarayana, Shri M V V']
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that the share of cesses and surcharges in gross tax revenue has increased from 10.4 per cent in 2011-12 to 19.9 per cent in 2020-21; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is contemplating to include revenues from cesses and surcharges as a part of 668 the divisible pool, as per recommendations of 15th Finance Commission; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the measures identified by the Government to moderate the increasing average interest burden ratio of the States including Tamil Nadu to counter the fiscal crisis?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has started to restructure the Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan in alignment with New Education Policy-2020; (b) if so, where this restructured project framework and norms could be accessed in the public domain; (c) the details of the consultation process followed for the same; and (d) the steps being taken by the Government to ensure that the new framework is fully implemented?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the total number of Universities at present run by the Government in the country and the number of students enrolled therein; (b) the total number of private Universities/Colleges at present in the country and the students enrolled therein; (c) the total number of students belonging to reserved categories enrolled in private Universities/Colleges; and (d) the details of safeguards in the National Education Policy, 2020 which ensures higher education to students from marginalised, disadvantaged and under-represented groups?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government and University Grants Commission (UGC) has initiated a series of online talk with stakeholders to streamline the forms and procedures to reduce the compliance burden in the Higher Educational Institutions (HEI); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether it is a follow-up action of Government for the ease of doing business to ease the lives of these stakeholders; and (d) if so, the details thereof? .

from: ['Gandhi, Smt. Maneka Sanjay', 'Nete, Shri Ashok Mahadeorao']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the number of environmental clearances sought by the NHAI from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change for diversion of forest lands in 2021; (b) the project-wise breakdown of the total number of clearances granted, rejected and pending before the Ministry; (c) whether the Government has given environmental clearance to Nizamabad-Jagdalpur(National Highway no. 16)which passes through Shironcha under tribal parliamentary constituency Gadchiroli-Chimur of Maharashtra and if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor including the time by which the environmental clearance in respect of the said route is proposed to be given?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has assessed the impact of demonetisation on business, employment, agriculture and poverty; (b) if so, the measures taken by the Government to tackle its impact on businesses, employment and poverty alleviation initiatives; (c)the overall amount which the Government has exchanged in lieu of old currency notes; and (d) whether any post demonetisation study has been done or any report has been published and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the estimated size of the non-agricultural informal sector in the country as a percentage of the total informal sector, State-wise; (b) the policy in place/in the pipelines for helping small and informal firms grow over time into medium or larger formal sector firms; and (c) whether the Government is of the view that an urban social welfare programme along the lines of the 669 National Rural Employment Guarantee Act is necessary for upliftment of the urban informal class?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is maintaining the statistics of the boarding schools run by various organisations across the country and mainly in boarding school hubs like Panchgani and Pune in Mahrashtra, Bengaluru in Karnataka and Ooty in Tamilnadu and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether there is a regulation on the fee limit of these boarding schools; and (c) whether the IB and IGCSE Syllabus incorporated by few of these schools will not be a hindrance for further studies of these students in our education system and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the extent to which the implementation of New Education Policy, 2020 has been effective on ground; and (b) whether the Government is collaborating with private companies to accelerate the process in this regard; (c) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the minor forest produces that are a major source of income for tribal communities of Uttar Pradesh and Odisha; (b) the district-wise information on minor forest produces of Uttar Pradesh and Odisha procured at minimum standard price; (c) the district-wise information on communities dependent on minor forest produce for livelihood; (d) the details of the minor forest produces for which the minimum standard price has been fixed by the Government; and (e) the initiatives undertaken by the Government to provide transportation and market linkage of the said minor forest produce in Uttar Pradesh and Odisha? .

Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the details of all original surveys and documents of the site around St Cajetan Church Goa; (b) the details of all permissions granted for development around St Cajetan Church; (c) whether a survey has been carried out or action taken to confirm, if any illegal activity/encroachment has been carried out around the Church and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Policy for Welfare of Tourism Employees
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether tourism in Odisha was affected during and post-pandemic; (b) if so, the details thereof and the losses suffered in the industry; (c) whether the Government has taken measures to revive the tourism industry in Odisha and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has initiated schemes or policy for the welfare of tourism employees across the country and specifically for Odisha; (e) if so, the details thereof and the total beneficiaries thereunder; and (f) the comparative performance of the tourism sector during the years 2020-21 and 2019-20?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has proposed to restart enrolment in various courses of Lalit Naryan Mithila University, Directorate of Distance Education in interest of students despite the fact that it has been stopped from 2020-21 session; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FINANCE 670 be pleased to state: (a) whether any scheme has been started for providing financial assistance to the banks functioning in rural areas of the country or is proposed to be started by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD); (b) if so, the details thereof and the purpose of granting this financial assistance; and (c) the details of the assistance provided by NABARD during the last three years and current year, State-wise?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the number of institutions functioning presently in district Karakat Parliamentary Constituency in Bihar to impart skill development training; and (b) the number of youths benefitted by the said training in the said Constituency?

topic: Research on Cheap Water-Proofing Material in IIT- Hyderabad
from: ['Pasunoori, Shri Dayakar', 'Reddy, Dr. Gaddam Ranjith', 'Maloth, Smt. Kavitha', 'Borlakunta, Shri Venkatesh Netha']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that IIT-Hyderabad has developed cheap waterproofing material from fly ash; (b) if so, the details of the research and the extent to which this helps in cheaper waterproofing solutions; and (c) the steps taken for commercially exploiting this research?
party: ['Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

from: ['Kataria, Shri Rattan Lal', 'Gandhi, Smt. Maneka Sanjay', 'Baalu, Shri Thalikkottai Rajuthevar', 'A. Raja, Shri']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether many nations of the world and International Monetary Fund/UNO have welcomed the call of the Prime Minister in Glasgow, if so, the details thereof; . (b) whether environmental experts were consulted before the target was announced in Glasgow; (c) the basis on which Green House Gas (GHG) reduction commitments have been firmed up by the Government and the extent to which the involvement of States and private industry has been assured; (d) the details of Nationally Determined Contributions for emission reductions along with targets for various stakeholders in Government and Private Sector; (e) whether India has demanded that developed countries must take measures for net-zero emissions by the end of this decade, if so, the details thereof and the reaction of the developed countries thereto; (f) the stand of India on the Green Resilient and Inclusive Development (GRID) strategy and whether it would be consistent with Nationally Determined Contributions of individual countries; and (g) whether differentiation of GHGs mitigation policies among the developed and developing countries has been highlighted in various forums and if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam']

contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether traditional rural professions like weaving, spinning, blacksmithing, carpentry and oil crashing are dying out in the country due to which youth are migrating to towns and cities; (b) if so, the reaction of the Government thereto; (c) whether the Government is formulating any scheme to check the migration of unemployed youths by creating additional employment opportunities; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the laws to stop child labour in the country; (b) whether any survey has been made by the Government to find out the number of child labourers in the country, if so, the details for 2019-20 and 2020-2021; (c) whether the Government is aware of the increase of child labour in the Country; if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise and if not, the reasons therefor; and (e) the steps taken/being taken to completely eradicate child labour in the Country with some action plan in coordination with States? 671

Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the present status of 100-bedded ESI Hospital at Karon-Deoghar district of Jharkhand; (b) whether the Government has taken steps to open the hospital for patients; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the criteria and provisions laid down for the industries and the oil, gas and energy sector companies for spending the Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) funds; (b) whether the Government proposes to issue instructions for spending the full amount of CSR funds of the oil, gas, and engry sector companies operating in Odisha including Nabarangpur, Malkangiri, Koraput and Jugathsingpur districts on the development activities in the concerned districts itself in view of the backwardness of these districts; (c) if so, the details thereof along with the time by which the said instructions are likely to be issued; (d) if not, the reasons therefor, and (e) the details of expenditure under CSR funds by the companies operating in Nabarangpur, Malkangiri, Koraput and Jugathsingpur districts of Odisha during each of the last five years?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the number of Government primary schools is decreasing for the first time in the country after independence because parents are giving priority to private schools; (b) if so, the number of primary schools closed in the country during the last three years and the details thereof, State-wise; (c) whether there is a shortage of about nine lakh teachers in the primary schools and this number is highest in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh; . (d) the steps taken by the Government to improve the basic facilities and to meet the shortage of teachers in the schools; (e) the number of schools in the country having access to electricity, State-wise; and (f) whether the Right to Free and Compulsory Education Act is getting ineffective due to influence of private schools and if so, whether the Government is considering to implement a uniform education system?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of any poaching cases of endangered and rare wildlife (listed in Scheduled I, II, III and IV of Indian Wildlife Act 1972) in twin Districts of Ladakh, if so, the details of cases registered since 2014; (b) the details of culprits convicted as per law and the details of the outcome of these cases and if not, the reaction of the Government thereto; and (c) whether the Government has any report of Wildlife Crimes and Wildlife Trades from UT Ladakh in the recent years and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reaction of the Government thereto?

topic: PM Jeevan Jyoti and PM Suraksha Bima Yojanas
contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the date since which Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana and Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana were launched in the country; (b) the number and details of bank account holders registered under the said schemes, State-wise and scheme- wise; (c) the number and details of registered bank account holders who have been benefited since the start of the said schemes till October 2021 including the amount deposited thereunder, State-wise; and (d) the number and details of women who have been insured under the said schemes till October 2021 in the country including the number of women who have been provided assistance along with the types of assistance provided to them?

Will the Minister of FINANCE 672 be pleased to state: (a) whether according to a Research Report of State Bank of India the informal sector shrank to 15 per cent of GDP in 2021 from 52 per cent in 2018; (b) if so, the details thereof along with its impact on employment and livelihood of vast majority of people employed/engaged in informal sector; (c) whether the Government has taken note of this undesirable trend and put in place required remedial measures; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any data regarding the new Startup companies registered in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has any data pertaining to total number of Unicorn companies in the country; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the amount sanctioned and the number of beneficiaries in National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS) from its launch till now; and (b) whether the Government proposes to extend this scheme to Students of Jawhar Navodaya Vidyalayas and Kendirya Vidyalayas and residential school?

from: ['Mishra, Shri Janardan', 'Kushawaha, Shri Ravindra', 'Katheria, Prof. (Dr.) Ram Shankar', 'Pathak, Shri Subrat', 'Shukla, Shri Ravi Kishan', 'Kumar, Shri Narendra']
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is likely to formulate any action plan to lay down norms for Teachers Training Institutes across the country; (b) if so, the details thereof along with norms laid down in this regard; . (c) the restrictions likely to be imposed on the institutes flouting the said norms; (d) the total number of teacher training schools/ colleges in the country, State-wise, especially in Rajasthan; (e) whether the National Council for Teachers Education gives accreditation to the B.ed. Colleges in States and if so, the details thereof; and (f) if not, the reasons therefor?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to ensure the timely disbursement of pension from the Artistes Pension Scheme and if so, the details of action taken thereon; (b) whether the Government will address the grievances of artists eligible for pensions under the scheme regarding the inordinate delay in disbursement of pension and if so, the details thereof along with the details regarding the number of pensioners from Kerala under the scheme; (c) whether the Government proposes to simplify the disbursement of pension and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has conducted an enquiry regarding the delay in disbursement of pension and if so, the details thereof; (e) the action taken by the Government to redress the grievances of the pensioners; and (f) whether the Government proposes to process the application for pension in a time bound manner and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government provides hundred per cent funds for the construction of buildings of schools up to class 10th; (b) if so, the details of the amount provided State- wise and district-wise; (c) the number of schools up to class 10th which have no buildings in Madhya Pradesh; (d) whether funds have been sanctioned for the construction of school buildings; (e) if not, the time by which funds are likely to be provided for the construction of school buildings along with the details thereof; (f) whether construction of school buildings up to class 10th have been sanctioned in Seoni and Balaghat districts of Balaghat parliamentary constituency; and (g) if so, the details of the amount School-wise? 673

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has noticed that Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) guidelines have not been strictly adhered to by all the companies, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has noticed that some companies are spending CSR funds for Government schemes, if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Government has modified the guidelines in respect of CSR spendings and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to impart education of communal harmony to the students in schools and colleges; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the number of buildings owned by Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) existing in Mumbai; (b) whether it is true that LIC has acquired the buildings namely Angrewadi, New Badam Wadi, East & West villa, Devkaran Building, Bhatia Building and 45 other buildings in default and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether these buildings are very old, nearly 100 years and are beyond repairs; (d) if so, whether the structural audit of these buildings has been done by LIC and if so, the details thereof including the number of buildings found in dilapidated conditions and action taken to redevelop them; (e) whether these buildings are known as Cess Building in Mumbai and hence MHADA has asked LIC to hand over these buildings to them, by keeping the ownership with LIC as it is for the redevelopment as per the laws existing in Maharashtra for these cess buildings to save the lives of the residents of these buildings; and (f) if so, the action initiated by the LIC to protect the lives of the residents? .

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received a representation regarding denial of salary and other perks to Kendriya Vidyalaya employees during Covid-19 pandemic; (b) if so, the details thereof and the response of the Government; (c) whether the Government has received a representation of Ex-PGT Biology, Kendriya Vidyalaya, CECRI, Karaikudi, Sivaganga regarding denial of Salary, recovery of salary and other benefits; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government has given a reply of Unstarred Question on 08.03.21 that the Government has not denied salary and other benefits of Government employees including Kendriya Vidyalaya teachers during Covid-19 pandemic; and (f) if so, the details thereof and the response of the Government thereto?

from: ['Ramesh, Shri T.R.V.S.', 'Rangaiah, Shri Talari', 'Reddy, Shri Magunta Sreenivasulu', 'Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun']
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has undertaken an assessment of the adverse impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on Skills Strengthening for Industrial Value Enhancement (STRIVE) project and if so, the details thereof; and (b) the steps undertaken by the Government to step up the functioning of STRIVE project to achieve the set targets by the end of the current year in Tamil Nadu?
party: ['Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is preparing any plan to promote eco-tourism in Jharkhand; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the funds released to the State Government in this regard? 674

topic: Benefits of Security Schemes to Labourers
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of Labourers covered under Social Security Schemes in Bihar; (b) the criteria and the guidelines to provide benefits of Security Schemes to labourers of unorganized sectors; (c) whether any identification and registration have been carried out of unorganized sector labourers to cover them under Social Security Scheme; and (d) if so, the details of the labourers for whom identification and registration have been conducted?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether unemployed youths were to be given training and employment under the centrally sponsored skill development scheme Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY) (2016-20); (b) the total number of unemployed youths who have been given training and the number of youths who have been given employment in the country, during the last three years and the current year so far; (c) the details of the amount spent by Government under PMKVY in the country during each of the last three year till the date, in this regard; and (d) the total amount spent by the Government under PMKVY during the said period in the State of Gujarat?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether there are any measures to estimate the number of youth who may require skill training due to unforeseen unemployment in the Covid-19 pandemic; (b) whether there are any plans to launch skill training for the aforementioned youth; (c) whether there are any plans for youth and the labor who may require skill development/training in small cities so that they do not travel for employment to metro cities during this unforeseen Covid-19 pandemic; and (d) if so, the details thereof? .

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to provide monetary assistance to eligible students as special welfare measure through the Direct Transfer of Benefits (DBT) across the country, if so, the details thereof along with the amount to be provided under it; (b) the details of the amount provided State-wise and district-wise; (c) the time by which it is likely to be implemented; (d) whether the Government has decided to cover girl students belonging to the Scheduled Tribes also under the scheme; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that disruption of education due to prolonged closure of schools across the globe is likely to have alarming effects on learning loss and it also poses threat to gender equality and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is aware that there is a need to take corrective steps to do justice as girls study time was constrained by increased household chores; and (c) if so, the response of the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Van Gram developed by various States in the country; (b) the State-wise details of infrastructure established in such villages during the last three years till date; (c) the details of the financial aid issued for this purpose during the above mentioned period; and (d) the steps taken/proposed to be taken for suitable and timely completion of these projects?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the forest cover is depleting over several parts/ districts in the country including Uttar Pradesh; (b) whether proposals regarding conservation and development of forests have been received from Uttar Pradesh; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the action taken in this regard by the Government?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the present status of loan disbursement in the State of Bihar under Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana; (b) the details of beneficiaries and total amount disbursed under the Yojana upto November, 2021 in Bihar; (c) whether any target has been fixed under the Yojana for other States in the country including Bihar; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the origin, historical background and present status of the Brokpa (Dard Aryan and Dard Shina) Tribes and total numbers of villages and population in Ladakh and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is aware of that the Aryan valley is divided into Leh and Kargil Districts and the Aryan Tribal Community is demanding for inclusion of Dartsik, Garkhone and Gurgurdho villages of the Aryan valley in Leh District and making of a separate Sub Division of Leh District; (c) the Aryan community of Ladakh is also demanding a reserved seat of Councilor in Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (LAHDC) Leh for them and also demanding official mechanisms to preserve and promote the important cultural identity of Dard Aryan including Language and customs; (d) if so, the reasons and details thereof; and (e) the action has been taken by Government on the demands of the Aryan Tribal Community of Ladakh?

from: ['Pratap Chandra Sarangi, Shri', 'Singh, Shri Rajbahadur', 'Yadav, Dr. Krishnapal Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken by the Government for free plantation and conservation in declining forest areas in the country; (b) whether there is any proposal to make it mandatory for every citizen to plant a certain number of plants each year; (c) if so, the details thereof along with the area of land in hectare where forests are likely to be developed in Odisha and Madhya Pradesh; (d) whether the Government allocates budget to the State Governments under any scheme for plantation, if so, State-wise and year-wise amount of budget allocated in this regard; and (e) whether the Government is taking any measures to monitor the plants so as to keep them alive after plantation and if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of acreage for opium farming in the country and the extent to which this acreage has been increased or decreased during the last ten years, State-wise; (b) whether the Government proposes to remove morphine rule and give it on lease on an average basis demand made by opium producing farmers in other States including Rajasthan; (c) if so, the time by which it is likely to be done and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the details of opium production along with the opium product codeine phosphate imported from abroad during the last five years?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the State of Haryana has fared poorly in the sustainable development goal of Life on Land as per the Niti Ayog India Index 2021; (b) if so, the reasons and details thereof; (c) whether the Government is taking steps to promote agroforestry, afforestation of wastelands, and other relevant practices to increase the tree cover in States dominated by agriculture such as Haryana and Punjab; and 676 (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the facilities being provided by the Government in Ganganath Jha Research Institute of Central Sanskrit University at Prayagraj; (b) the number of the teachers employed and the students enrolled in the said institute; (c) whether the Government has any plan for purchasing land and constructing buildings for complex of the institute; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the steps taken or being taken by the Government to extend the complex of the above-said institute keeping in view the requirement of today?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the number of nationalised bank branches is very less in Nanded district of Maharashtra; (b) if so, whether enormous difficulties are being faced by the traders, farmers in making financial transactions and obtaining loans owing to shortage in the number of bank branches; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has prepared any action plan to set up new branches of nationalised banks; (e) if so, the details thereof along with the time by which the work is likely to be completed; and (f) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of effective steps taken by the Government for successful implementation of Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana to ensure maximum benefits to girls; (b) whether the Government has determined any specific role of the States under this scheme; . (c) if so, the details thereof and the target fixed under the scheme; and (d) the details of funds allocated under this scheme, State-wise including Chhattisgarh?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that Forest Advisory Committee (FAC) of the Central Government has decided to approve mining in non-forest land even before forest clearance to contiguous forest land has been granted, in mining blocks which consist of both types of land and if so, the details of cases in which such permission has been granted; (b) whether grant of such approvals sets a wrong precedent and put undue pressure on regulators to approve mining in forest land, if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the details of action taken/proposed under Forest Conservation Act, 1980 for contravention of the Act?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether Skill Development Centres are working in the State of Bihar and how many youths and girls have benefited in their lives on the basis of training and if so, the details thereof, district-wise; (b) whether the Skill Developments Centres are operational in district Bhagalpur, Bihar and are also planned to be opened in future so that youth and girls can be trained; and (c) if so, the details thereof and name of the institute where centers are running at present?

from: ['Vasava, Shri Mansukhbhai Dhanjibhai', 'Darbar, Shri Chhatar Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the total number of tribes across the country; 677 (b) the State-wise total population number of aboriginal tribes especially in Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh; and (c) the details of ongoing or proposed schemes by the Government for the development of aboriginal tribes in the country?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether there has been under utilization of the funds allocated to Research and Development (R&D) Scheme for Conservation and Development for the last three years; (b) whether the Government has undertaken assessment on the reasons for the same and if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps undertaken by the Government to improve the usage of funds?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that students from outside the district have been admitted in Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya (JNV), Churachandpur, Manipur in violation of the norms and whether any complaints have been received by the Government in this regard; (b) if so, the action taken by the Government against the persons responsible for this and if no action has been taken till date, the reasons therefor; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to prevent such instances in future?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) the details of loans given to Telangana by the Reserve Bank of India(RBI), External Agencies under Externally Aided Projects and refinancing institutions of the Government during the last five years, year-wise; (b) the details of repayment of principal and interest by Telangana to these lending institutions during the last five years, year-wise; (c) the details of total public debt of Telangana which is outstanding as of 30th November, 2021; and (d) the estimated amount of principal and interest to be paid by Telangana towards the outstanding dues during the financial year 2021-22, 2022-23 and 2023-24, lending institution-wise?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of deaths of more than 121 children in Attappady tribal hamlets in Kerala over the last eight years; (b) if so, whether the Government has sought a report from the Government of Kerala on this matter; (c) if so, the details thereof and reaction of the Government in this regard; (d) the details of the prevailing issue of child malnutrition among tribal children in Attappady leading to stunting and infant death is to be addressed by any targeted intervention other than existing programs ; (e) if so, the details thereof; (f) whether it is fact that many expectant and young mothers in Attapady belonging to the Scheduled Tribes are suffering from malnutrition and diseases like sickle cell anaemia; and (g) if so, the details thereof and action taken to provide targeted nutrition for them?

topic: New Kendriya Vidyalayas in Uttar Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to construct any new Kendriya Vidyalayas in Jaunpur, Noida, Greater Noida and Noida Extention of Gautam Buddh Nagar Parliamentary Constituencies of Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Kendriya Vidyalayas which are already functioning in Noida and Greater Noida were built many years ago, are now unable to meet the requirement of the population which has increased many times during these years ; and (d) if so, the steps taken by the Government to build new Kendriya Vidyalayas in Noida and Greater Noida or atleast to add one more shift in the existing KVs; (e) the estimated time for completion of the project along with the total amount of funds allocated for the same; and (f) the schemes for conversion/ upgradation of Government school classrooms into digital classrooms along with the funds being spent for the same in Jaunpur District? 678

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether there has been any progress in the enquiry/ examination of the issue of Air and Water pollution caused due to unauthorised disposal of fly ash by the industries in the district Jharsuguda of Bargarh PC in Odisha by the Central Pollution Control Board; (b) if not, the expected time by when it is likely to be taken up by the Central Pollution Control Board; (c) if so, the report submitted by the Board; and (c) whether the Government proposes to give direction to the Board to cause enquiry without the knowledge of any quarter so that truth about pollution and its degree can be ascertained without any cover up?

topic: Development of Tourism in Nabadwip and Nadia
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: from (a) whether the Government has received any the Public suggestions/representations Representative to improve, develop and promote tourism in Nabadwip and Nadia; (b) if so, the details thereof and the action taken by the Government in this regard; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government proposes to provide financial assistance to the State of West Bengal for development and promotion of tourism in Nabadwip as well as Nadia; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Career in Environment and Wildlife Conservation
contents: Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken by the Government to enhance youths interest in environment and wildlife conservation; (b) whether the Government is considering on imparting training to the youth or on other schemes to enable them to make career in this field in this regard; and (c) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Dropout Rate in Government and Private Schools
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION . be pleased to state: (a) the number of students dropped out of Government and Private schools at the primary, secondary and higher levels between March 2020 to November 2022; (b) the number of children currently out of the education system; and (c) the number of Government and Private schools shut down in the country between March 2020 to November 2022?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the proposed or sanctioned Advance Technical Centre (Tec Hub) in Belagavi, Karnataka has not been functional even after the lapse of two years of sanction; and (b) if so, the present status and the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the details of the members nominated from the tribal class in the Executive Council, Finance Committee, Building Committee in Indira Gandhi National Tribal Unversity, Amarkantak, Madhya Pradesh; (b) the details of the teacher appointed against the posts of 07 Professors, 13 Associate Professors and 40 Assistant Professors vide Advertisement No. IGNTU / Rec. Cell/ T-01/2020 dated 07/09/2020 and the number of applications received for these posts; (c) the time by when the handover of all the buildings were given to the University built up to October, 2021; and (d) the credibility of the online entrance test, 2021 conducted for the admission at the undergraduate and postgraduate level in the said University and the details of reasons for the delay of five months in admission?

Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether some kind of loan is being provided to youths under Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana across the country including Rajasthan and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is contemplating to launch such scheme now or in future and if so, the details thereof; 679 (c) whether the Government has received any complaints regarding non-payment of loan in time by the banks; and (d) if so, the details thereof along with the necessary steps taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE , be pleased to state: (a) whether Sandila industrial area under Misrikh Parliamentary Constituency of Uttar Pradesh is getting polluted and the Ganga river passing through the said area is also getting affected from pollution; (b) if so, whether the Government has taken or proposes to take any measures to make Sandila industrial area and the Ganga river passing through the said area pollution-free; and (c) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) the details of the objectives of the Skill India Programme; (b) the details of the number of people who have been provided skill training, State and district-wise since the launch of the Skill India Programme therefrom; (c) whether the Government keeps a record of the number of people who secured employment after being skilled under Skill India Programme and the present status therein; (d) if so, the details thereof, State and district-wise thereof; and if not the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether there is still a multiplicity of norms and parameters which creates a diffusive effect of Skill Development Programmes, which needed to be streamlined; (b) if so, the response and the steps taken by the Government in this regard; (c) whether there is a need to rationalise the whole spectrum of skill development processes and systems including inputs, outputs, funding/cost norms, third party certification and assessment, monitoring/tracking mechanisms, and empanelment of training providers; . (d) if so, the steps taken to bring about uniformity and standardisation among the skill development schemes; (e) whether there is a need to define the outcomes of skill training programmes in terms of placement achieved in wage and self-employment, both for fresh trainees as well as existing workers; and (f) if so, the steps taken by the Government and success achieved so far?

topic: Ekalavya Model Residential Model School in Kalimpong
contents: Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the status of Ekalavya Model Residential school proposed to be constructed in Kalimpong district by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs; (b) the status of the work completed and pending in the school infrastructure; and (c) the reasons for the delay, if any?

Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) the quantum of funds spent in the State of Punjab since the inception of the National Culture Fund (NCF) scheme; and (b) the quantum of funds allocated to various institutions/departments during the last three years and district-wise details of the allocated funds?

Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) steps taken by the Government for the better implementation and monitoring of Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojna (PMKVY) for skill training of youths so that more and more youths can be benefited and employed; (b) whether the Government has conducted any study/ survey regarding benefits accrued by PMKVY since its inception; and (c) if so, the State/UT wise details of the same?

Will the Minister of CORPORATE AFFAIRS 680 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has data on how many companies from the State of Uttar Pradesh have declared themselves bankrupt post-lockdown due to Covid-19; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of the cases resolved under the newly established method of insolvency i.e.; Pre-packaged Insolvency Resolution Process (PIRP) of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, till date, along with the amount of claims resolved under these cases; (d) the number of companies from the State of Uttar Pradesh who have filed for Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code in 2020, so far; (e) whether there is any usual delay in the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code; and (f) if so, the reason therefor and the steps taken by the Government to resolve the issue of delay in resolution?

topic: Set up of New Hotel Management Institutes
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has decided to set up new hotel management institutes besides introduction of hospitality education through Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs); (b) if so, the details thereof along with the total number of hotel management institutes functioning at present in the country, location-wise; (c) whether the Government has identified the sites therefor; and (d) if so, the details thereof, State-wise?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) the total sanctioned strength of the primary junior and inter-college teachers in Uttar Pradesh; (b) the number of posts that have been lying vacant among these posts; and (c) the steps proposed to be taken by the Government for filling up these posts?

topic: Development and Modernisation of Facilities at Tourist Places
contents: Will the Minister of TOURISM be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has formulated any action plan for the development and modernization of facilities provided at various tourist places of the country including North-Eastern Region? (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the number of tourist spots that have been covered under the scheme and the details thereof, State-wise; and (d) the amount of funds allocated for the said purpose during the last three years?

topic: Social Security to Industrial and Unorganised Workers
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether there is dissatisfaction amongst the beneficiary members of pension scheme implemented for providing social security to industrial and unorganized workers, due to shortcomings in the scheme; (b) if so, whether the Government has taken any decision to link dearness allowance and Government grants in the pension scheme so as to get proper benefit of pension; (c) the response of the Government on the recommendations contained in the report of the Parliamentary Committee presented in the Parliament on 20 February, 2009; (d) whether an expert Committee had presented its report to the Government on 5th August, 2010 to give proper benefit to the pensioners of 1995 scheme under social security; (e) if so, the details of the said report of the expert Committee thereof; and (f) whether the Government proposes to provide dearness allowance and grants to the pensioners of 1995 as per their demands?

topic: Skill Development of People Living in Border Areas
contents: Will the Minister of SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has launched any scheme in the country particularly in West Bengal for skill development of youths so that talented youths of rural areas could be brought forward in development process of the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; 681 (c) whether the Government has formulated any policy for the people living in bordering areas under the said scheme; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government intend to counter the crisis related to shortage of University seats across the Central Universities; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Governments expenditure on Research and Development is approximately 0.65 per cent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP); (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the steps taken or proposed to be taken by the Government to increse the funds to support the research in Central Universities?

topic: Casualties of Workers in Factory in Gandhinagar
contents: Will the Minister of LABOUR AND EMPLOYMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the fact that in the recent past, five workers died after inhaling toxic gas while cleaning an underground effluent tank at a pharmaceutical factory in Gandhinagar of Gujarat; (b) whether it is mandatory for the service provider to provide proper gear with helmet and gas mask to the workers before entering into the effluent tanks for cleaning where the presence of toxic fatal gases is certain; (c) whether the Government plans to compensate the family of those workers who lost their lives in harness, if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government plans to take action against the factory owner and the service provider responsible for the death of the workers due to deliberate irresponsible behaviour?

topic: Funds for Renovation of Jama Masjid
contents: Will the Minister of CULTURE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted a survey to assess the damage and the scope of work in Delhi Jama Masjid; (b) if so, the details thereof; . (c) whether ASI has allocated any funds for the repairing of the Jama Masjid; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of the repairing done in Jama Masjid by ASI in the past?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to promote and publicize the National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS) in Bundelkhand along with Banda and Chitrakoot districts of Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details of the scheme being formulated in this regard, and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the total number of seats available in Bundelkhand including Banda and Chitrakoot districts of Uttar Pradesh under NMMSS; and (d) whether the Government is considering to increase the number of such seats and if so, the details thereof, State-wise?

topic: Ghani Khan Choudhary Institute of Engineering and Technology
contents: Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the guidelines of All India Council for Technical Eduation (AICTE), University Grants Commission (UGC) and other regulatory bodies for recruitment process, qualifications of teaching staffs and other have been followed in recruitment of teaching and non-teaching staffs in Ghani Khan Choudhary Institute of Engineering and Technology (GKCIET); (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of TRIBAL AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry, in a study to analyse the infrastructure-based performance of Tribal villages in the districts of Telangana, found that 40 percent of villages lacked in one or more amenity crucial for sustainable village development; 682 (b) if so, the results and details of the Government study to analyse the same; (c) the actions proposed by the Government to improve the infrastructure in such areas; and (d) the funds sanctioned towards infrastructural development in tribal villages in Telangana?

Will the Minister of EDUCATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the irregularities have been reported and complaints received regarding the functioning of a large number of NGOs operating in the field of education with the help of grants from abroad and big companies; (b) if so, the details thereof during the last five years, State-wise and date-wise including Rajasthan; NEW DELHI; December 14, 2021 Agrahayana 23, 1943 (Saka) (c) whether any assessment has been made of the funds spent through NGOs in the field of education for Government schools in the country; and (d) if so, the details of the funds spent in the field of education especially in Rajasthan during the last five years NGOs-wise, head-wise and year-wise?
