Will the Minister of FINANCE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plan to include petroleum products under the Goods and Services Tax (GST); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is planning to introduce use of clean fuels as a criterion for giving subsidies to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises; and (d) if so, the details thereof? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether under the Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH), maximum cost of Rs.30,000/- per ha. is given for cultivation of spices like ginger and turmeric, out of which 40% is given as subsidy to the farmers for cultivation; (b) whether it is a fact that this cost is very low and needs to be enhanced atleast four folds with immediate effect to encourage and motivate farmers to increase the cultivation of such crops; (c) whether the Government will consider enhancing the cost of cultivation; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that farmers are being exploited by middlemen; (b) if so, the steps being taken by the Government for the protection of the interests of farmers and to save them from the cluches of middlemen; and (c) the steps being taken in the direction of agricultural reforms?

topic: Data on Tenant Farmers and Sharecroppers
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any data on number of tenant farmers and sharecroppers in the country; . (b) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise and if not, whether the Government has any plans to maintain the data of tenant farmers and sharecroppers in coming years; (c) whether the Centre and various State Governments are recognizing tenant farmers and sharecroppers for availing any of the Government agricultural schemes, if so, the details of the schemes along with the list of the States which are recognizing the tenant farmers and sharecroppers and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government has any intention to include the tenant farmers and sharecroppers as farmers in database of AgriStack; and (e) if so, the details of the steps taken to include them and if not, the reasons for not including them in the database of AgriStack?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the National Investigation Agency (NIA) needs additional infrastructure and domain experts to probe cyber terrorism and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether it is also a fact that the NIA was given the mandate to probe cases related to cyber terrorism two years ago; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the total number of such cases being investigated by NIA as of now?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the amount of funds disbursed to the farmers since the launch of the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) Yojana till date, year-wise; 84 (b) whether there are any other similar programmes initiated by the States that complement this programme and if so, the details thereof; (c) the manner in which the farmers deprived of the benefits of the said scheme are proposed to be provided these benefits; and (d) the time by which the said benefits are likely to be provided?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the employment under Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushal Yojana (DDU-GKY) has fallen following the onset of COVID; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the reasons for the fall in employment rate; and (d) the efforts being made by the Government to increase the employment under DDU-GKY?

from: ['Patil, Shri Unmesh Bhaiyyasaheb', 'Gavit, Dr. Heena Vijaykumar']
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the programmes being undertaken by the Government for identifying the talents amongst youth in rural areas of various States and UTs particularly in Maharashtra; (b) the details of the number of beneficiaries under these programmes during the last five years, State/UT-wise; (c) the details and the objectives of the Fit India Cyclothon; (d) whether the Government has constituted any Committee/team to assess the condition of all the stadiums in the country; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Centrally Sponsored Schemes being implemented by the Government for the promotion of sports in the country; (b) the funds allocated under these schemes during each of the last three years and the current year, sports- wise; and . (c) the details of the expenditure incurred on these schemes during the said period, year-wise?

from: ['Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath', 'Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government extends sops or concessions under transport and marketing scheme for agri exports, through mandis and at purchase centres; (b) if so, the details and the results thereof, State- wise; and (c) if not, the time by which such a scheme is proposed to be announced for the country including Andhra Pradesh and Telangana?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) the details of total number of Akashvani Kendras currently operational under Prasar Bharati across the country, State/UT-wise including the State of Chhattisgarh; (b) the details of the number of the said centres which have become paperless and have adopted the e- office system; (c) whether the employees at the said centres have adapted themselves to the e-office system for the operation of the said centres; (d) whether any efforts are being made to make the remaining centres paperless; (e) if so, the details and the time by which the said centres are proposed to be made paperless, State/UT- wise including the State of Chhattisgarh; and (f) the total number of Akashvani Kendras currently operational and also the number of non-operational centres in the State of Chhattisgarh?

topic: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Gramin in Bihar
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to start the work of next phase under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Gramin (PMAY-G), if so, the details thereof including the time by which it is likely to be started 85 particularly in the villages of Bhagalpur district of Bihar and if not, the reasons therefor; (b) whether the names of the villages in the Bhagalpur district of Bihar under the said scheme have been finalized, if so, the details thereof and the time by which the houses are proposed to be allotted to the people and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) the number of houses proposed to be allotted under the next phase in coming three years in the Bhagalpur district of Bihar along with the details of the people who got houses in the district during the last two years under the said scheme?

topic: Computerization of Gram Panchayats in Jharkhand
contents: Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds allocated by the Government for the development of Gram Panchayats in the State of Jharkhand from the year 2019, district-wise; (b) the details of the Panchayats in the State which have been computerized, district-wise; and (c) the total number of Panchayats which have been computerized in the said State?

topic: Houses for Homeless BPL People in Maharashtra
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the total funds allocated by the Ministry for the construction of houses for homeless people living Below Poverty Line (BPL) in rural areas of Maharashtra during each of the last three years; (b) the number of people benefited under the said scheme in the State, particularly in Shirdi Parliamentary Constituency in Ahmednagar district during each of the last three years; and (c) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to provide houses to the remaining homeless people living Below Poverty Line (BPL) in rural areas of Maharashtra, particularly in Ahmednagar district?

from: ['K. Navas, Shri Kani', 'Dhanorkar, Shri Balubhau Narayanrao (Alias Suresh)']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has provided additional funds for the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural . Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) for the remaining period of the financial year 2021-22, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (b) the latest net balance of the MGNREGS; (c) the number and details of States and Union Territories which have a negative net balance; and (d) the details of the amount due to the MGNREGS workers as wage payments?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the aims and objectives of Rashtriya Khel Protsahan Puraskar (RKPP) Scheme; (b) whether the Government has revised RKPP scheme and if so, the details and the purpose thereof; (c) whether RKPP scheme has helped in the promotion of sports in the country and if so, the details thereof; (d) the number of corporates and voluntary organizations involved under RKPP scheme since its inception; (e) the details and the number of youth in the country benefitted/ awarded under the scheme during each of the last three years and current year, State/UT- wise and sports discipline-wise; and (f) whether the companies can spend their fund earmarked for Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) on promotion and development of sports and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that incidents of attack on media persons/murder of journalists, etc. are on the rise in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and the total number of journalists injured/killed separately, guilty persons arrested and the action taken against them during each of the last five years and the current year, State-wise; (c) whether the Government has received any report/ recommendations from the Press Council of India on the safety of media persons/journalists; (d) if so, the details thereof and the action taken by the Government in this regard; (e) whether the Government has constituted any committee to investigate the attacks on journalists and 86 settle the case within a specified time frame and if so, the details thereof; and (f) the other steps taken by the Government for the protection of journalists, bloggers, scribes, reporters, Newspaper Offices and TV Stations?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government allocates funds to the recognized National Sports Federations (NSFs) in the country; (b) if so, the details of funds allocated to the recognized Sports Federations in the country since 2018, year and Federation-wise; (c) the utilization of these funds by the Sports Federations during the said period, year and Federation- wise; (d) whether any instances of misuse of funds by NSFs have come to notice during the said period; (e) if so, the details thereof and the remedial action taken by the Government thereon; and (f) whether the Government has undertaken an annual audit of these Sports Federations and if so, whether any cases of financial mismanagement have been identified and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government acknowledges that the funds allocated for Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) being lower than the previous year are causing many States to run into a negative account and if so, the details of the NEW DELHI; December 15, 2021 Agrahayana 24, 1943 (Saka) measures taken by the Government to address the delays in payments caused to the workers; (b) whether the Government sees merit in the usage of a highly digitized ecosystem for a scheme for a section of the society that might necessarily not have the knowledge of such platforms, thereby making the operations difficult for them and if so, the mechanism in place to address such issues; and (c) the details of the MGNREGS funds allocated to the State of Punjab, district-wise?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Covid-19 pandemic caused disruption in the activities under the National Young Leaders Programme; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the measures taken by the Government to keep the development programmes for the youth active during the COVID-19 Pandemic?

topic: Setting Up of Cold Storage in FPIs
from: ['Shinde, Dr. Shrikant Eknath', 'Vikhepatil, Dr. Sujay Radhakrishna']
contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) the initiatives taken by the Government in Food Processing Industries (FPI) sector regarding renewal of the contemporary technology and protection against climate change, price fluctuations, demand shocks and also sustained investment; (b) the details of the procedure for setting up of cold storages under this Ministry at the State level; and (c) the number of cold storages being operated in the country till date, State/UT-wise particularly in the State of Maharashtra? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has initiated any steps to export agro-based products from the Union Territory of Ladakh; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Bordoloi, Shri Pradyut', 'Gandhi, Smt. Maneka Sanjay', 'Kesineni, Shri Srinivas']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is cognizant of the Supreme Courts observation in 2016 of the low percentage of destruction/disposal of seized narcotics, if so, the details of measures taken to address the same; (b) the details of the quantity of drugs seized by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) between 2014 and 2021, State-wise; (c) the details of disposal of quantity of drugs seized by the NCB during the said period, State-wise; (d) the total quantity of drugs seized and total quantity of drugs destroyed during 2019, 2020 and 2021, year-wise; and (e) the details and reasons for which the NCB has not updated its monthly Drug Situation Report (DSR) since March 2019, and the time by which the reports of pending months are likely to be made available to the public?
party: ['Indian National Congress', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Telugu Desam Party']

contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the names of all the Ministries which have received the caste based census data from 2011; (b) the manner in which the data was provided to thereof, the detail the respective Ministries, Ministry-wise; (c) the major scheme/projects of the Government where the caste based census data was utilized by the Ministry since its receipt; and (d) the change that the data had brought in the various Government Programmes being implemented by them?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any statistics regarding number of girls missing cases reported in the country; and (b) if so, the details of such cases reported, number of girls identified and return home, found dead during each of the last five years, State-wise?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has defined the meaning of anti national under any legislation or 11 rules or any other legal enactment that is enforced in the country, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Supreme Court has prescribed any guidelines to deal with crimes relating to anti national activity, if so, the details thereof; and (c) the number of people arrested for indulging in anti national activities during the last three years, State-wise? 685

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted an internal inquiry to investigate the lapses on the part of Delhi Police in preventing the outbreak of deadly violence in North-East Delhi on 24th, 25th and 26th of February, 2020; and (b) if so, the details thereof along with the relevant details of any action taken against police personnel who failed to prevent such an outbreak?

Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether various websites and videos provide fake information regarding various Government Schemes; and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the actions taken by the Government to curb such websites and videos?

topic: Linking of Birth & Death Certificates with Aadhar
from: ['T. Sumathy (A) Thamizhachi Thangapandian, Dr.', 'Ravikumar, Dr. D.']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to link birth and death certificates with Aadhaar to maintain real-time databases of citizens; (b) if so, whether the Government is cognizant of the fact that this will be a violation of the Supreme Courts judgment in Puttaswamy case, if so, the comments of the Government in this regard; (c) the justification for linking birth and death certificates with Aadhaar, even in violation of Supreme Courts judgment; (d) whether the Government has any poposal to use this data for building NATGRID, if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government has any proposal to use this database for the National Register of Citizens; and (f) the safeguards that have been put in place to prevent usage of this data for any other purpose?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of persons who have availed the benefit of EWS reservation for an appointment in Government services till date; (b) the total number of seats increased/additional seats created over a period of two years to provide a ten per cent EWS reservation in the central universities; and (c) the number of funds/additional funds provided to the Ministries for the implementation of the EWS reservation?

Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that Cooperative Societies are a State subject under Entry 32 of the State List of Seventh Schedule of the Constitution of India and if so, the need for creating a separate Union Ministry for the same; (b) whether a need assessment was conducted to determine the establishment of a Ministry for cooperative societies, if so, the details thereof, if not, the rationale in doing the same; (c) whether there was a request from the States to establish a union Ministry to govern Cooperative Societies, if so, the details thereof; (d) if not, whether an open discussion was held with the States to collect feedback and to inform them about the establishment of the Ministry, since it is a State subject; and (e) whether any objectives have been identified to be achieved under the Ministry by the Cooperative Societies and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Spread of Illicit Drugs through Dark Web
from: ['Shrangare, Shri Sudhakar Tukaram', 'Naik Nimbalkar, Shri Ranjeetsingh', 'Singh, Shri Pradeep Kumar', 'Saraswati, Shri Sumedhanand', 'Koli, Smt. Ranjeeta']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any mechanism to curb the spread of illicit drugs through the dark web; 686 (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) the fresh steps taken by the Government for developing a more focused approach with enforcement agencies for upgrading the skills for cracking down effectively online drug trade particularly in Maharashtra, Bihar and Rajasthan?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has organized Awareness- cum-Training Programme for farmers to adopt good agricultural practices within the country including Assam; (b) if so, the details thereof including the number of districts covered in Assam; (c) the details of the funds sanctioned and utilized for these programmes; and (d) the details of the target set alongwith its response?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has approved any employment oriented scheme in order to provide employment in villages, if so, the details thereof State- wise particularly in the State of Maharashtra; and (b) the details of villages included under the said scheme and the quantum of expenditure incurred under the same, State-wise?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any poposal to introduce The Prohibition of Employment as Manual Scavengers and their Rehabilitation (Amendment) Bill, 2020, if so, the details thereof, if not, the reasons therefore; and (b) the details of technology that would replace the manual scavengers in the cleaning task in wake of above proposal of the Government?

from: ['Nath, Shri Balak', 'Koli, Smt. Ranjeeta', 'Saraswati, Shri Sumedhanand']
contents: Will the Minister of HEAVY INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether the use of electric vehicles is increasing in the country; (b) if so, whether the Government proposes to set up an institute for funding business, providing loans for public transports and commercial vehicle segment with focus on electric vehicles; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government is also formulating any scheme to provide incentive for manufacturing of equipments so as to promote the conversion of vehicles into electric vehicles; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) the time by which final decision is likely to be taken in this regard?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

from: ['Reddy, Shri Y. S. Avinash', 'Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath', 'Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar', 'Singh, Shri Rajiv Ranjan Alias Lalan Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of HEAVY INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plan to increase the Electric Vehicles (EV) to reduce carbon in all over the country, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government aims to have Electric Vehicles sales accounting for 30 per cent of private cars, 70 per cent for commercial vehicles and 80 per cent for two and three wheelers by 2030 as there is an immediate need to decarbonise the transport sector; (c) if so the details thereof and the steps being taken by the Government in this regard; (d) whether the Government agrees that it is the right time to introduce maximum EV as petrol and diesel cost are very high, if so, the details thereof; and (e) the steps taken by Government to support EV manufacturing companies and consumers?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Janata Dal (United)']

contents: Will the Minister of HEAVY INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether there are zero electric buses operational for transport of passengers and cargo in Andhra Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to sanction and deploy electric buses in Andhra Pradesh? 687
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government have chalked out any action plan to ensure dispatch of requisite quantity of pesticides which is fixed for various States in the future; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has proposed to set up the Integrated Criminal Justice System (ICJS), if so, the details thereof; (b) whether it provides comprehensive profiles of persons convicted of various offences, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether data of undertrial prisoners are also collected, if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the ICJS would be integrated into the e- courts phase 3 project and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether any safeguards have been built into the ICJS to prevent unnecessary breaches of privacy, if so, the details thereof?

topic: Utilisation of Potential of Cooperative Sector
contents: Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plans to develop a roadmap for effective utilization of the potential of the cooperative sector in all parts of the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, whether the Government intends to formulate a plan in the near future; (c) whether the Government has any specific plans in certain States like West Bengal, Jharkhand and North Eastern States which have beginners advantage to promote cooperative ecosystem in particular sectors like dairy, sugar, etc. to boost the economy; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of the way in which social media is used by the citizens during crises, if so, the details thereof; . (b) whether the Government intends to establish a centralized website, app, or portal which may be used by the citizens for crisis communication; (c) if so, the steps taken to create the same and the timeline when the same is expected to be completed; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has jurisdiction over all crimes related to human trafficking, if so, the details thereof; (b) the criteria and procedure for allocation to the National Investigation Agency (NIA); and (c) the rate of solving human trafficking cases by Anti Human Trafficking Units (AHTU) during the last five years along with the number of cases solved during the said period, State-wise?

topic: WTOs New Regulation on Fisheries Sector
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has examined the expected impact of World Trade Organisations new regulation on fisheries sector, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has agreed with the WTO regulation, if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of prime focuses of Ministerial level Conference (MC12) of WTO; (d) whether the Government has discussed this matter with any of the stakeholders from fisheries sector, if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the Government will have proper discussions with the stakeholders from fisheries sector on WTOs propsed regulation on fisheries sector?

topic: Economic and Social Upliftment of Farmers
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the schemes being run for economic and social upliftment of the farmers in the country State-wise; (b) the details of the laws enacted in the interest of the farmers for increasing their income in the country; (c) whether all the laws are being implemented in an effective manner and if so, the details thereof; 688 (d) whether any provision has been made by the Government to check the incidents of suicides being committed by the farmers due to financial distress in the country and provide compensation to the families of the farmers committing suicide and if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of various schemes formulated for the progress of farmers in Bihar?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the status of homelessness and number of people homeless in the country; (b) the details of the funds Government allocate to provide temporary accommodation houses to them during extreme weather conditions like heat wave, rainy season, and cold wave; (c) whether Government is constructing built up houses for homeless population, if so, the details thereof; and (d) the total allocation that the government has made for providing houses to people who are homeless or without houses?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether a majority of differently abled people living in rural areas are unemployed and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has formulated any scheme to impart training to make such people self- employed and entrepreneurs and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has signed any memorandum to provide cooperation and support to such people for providing training, employment and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the salient features and present status of the said memorandum of agreement?

topic: Grievance Redressal Mechanism for Pre and Post Matric Scholarships
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the names of the States that have put in place Grievance Redressal Mechanism to address the problems of students trying to access the Pre and Post Matric Scholarship; . (b) the States that do not have any such mechanism; and (c) the plan of the Government to ensure that all States institutionalise Grievance Redressal Mechanism and if so, the timeframe to complete this?

from: ['Barne, Shri Shrirang Appa', 'Pathak, Shri Subrat', 'Jadhav, Shri Prataprao', 'Kushawaha, Shri Ravindra', 'Shukla, Shri Ravi Kishan', 'Tiwari, Shri Manoj Kumar', 'Gupta, Shri Sudheer', 'Mahato, Shri Bidyut Baran', 'Mandlik, Prof. Sanjay Sadashivrao']
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has recently celebrated the National Milk Day in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the aims and objectives of celebrating the National Milk Day; (c) whether the Government is aware about the miserable condition of dairy farmers and that lots of dairy farmers are leaving the profession and if so, the details thereof along with the reasons for the same; (d) whether the Government proposes to provide any financial assistance to the farmers in dairy industry and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether inferior breeds of cattle, unorganized dairy sector, lack of investment and farmers unawareness towards current technology etc. are some of the difficulties faced/being faced by the farmers dealing in this sector; and (f) the details of steps taken by the Government for influx of investment in the dairy sector so as to make it financially attractive and lucrative sector?
party: ['Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena']
state: ['Maharashtra', 'Uttar Pradesh', 'Maharashtra', 'Uttar Pradesh', 'Uttar Pradesh', 'NCT of Delhi', 'Madhya Pradesh', 'Jharkhand', 'Maharashtra']

contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Agricultural Technology Management Agency (ATMA) scheme provides Grants- in-Aid to the State Governments with the objective to support their efforts to make available the latest agricultural technologies; (b) if so, the amount of Agriculture Infrastructure Fund utilized to build food storage and warehousing in rural areas of Gopalganj district in Bihar; and 689 (c) the details of the outcome of the scheme in Bihar?

from: ['Bhamre, Dr. Subhash Ramrao', 'Sharma, Shri Kuldeep Rai', 'DNV Senthilkumar S, Dr.', 'Tatkare, Shri Sunil Dattatray', 'Kolhe, Dr. Amol Ramsing', 'Raut, Shri Vinayak Bhaurao', 'Sule, Smt. Supriya Sadanand']
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any policy to encourage modernization of poultry farming especially in dry and non-irrigated areas of the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has assessed the actual demand for poultry products in the country, if so, the outcome thereof; (c) whether any steps have been taken by the Government to fight against poultry disease outbreaks and diagnosis, waste management and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government has taken note of the fact that the poultry farmers bear huge losses every year ;and (e) if so, the details of the estimated loss incurred by the poultry farmers in each of the last three years and the current year and the amount of compensation paid by the Government to poultry farmers thereof?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Indian National Congress', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Nationalist Congress Party', 'Nationalist Congress Party', 'Shiv Sena', 'Nationalist Congress Party']

from: ['Singh Deo, Smt. Sangeeta Kumari', 'Roy, Dr. Jayanta Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the National Backward Classes Finance & Development Corporation (NBCFDC) implements schemes for welfare of Other Backward Classes (OBCs), if so, the details of funds allocated under each scheme during the last three years, year-wise and States-wise; (b) the details of the proposals received/sanctioned/ pending along with the physical progress/achievements made therein and complaints received under each of the schemes during the last three years, year-wise,state- wise; (c) whether most of the backward classes have not been able to avail the schemes of NBCFDC due to lack of awareness and publicity in mass media, and (d) if so, the steps being taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details regarding the progress made so far under Deen Dayal Upadhyay Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDUGKY) especially in the State of Maharashtra ; (b) whether the challenges faced by National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM) in rural areas have been effectively addressed, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the National Council for Vocational Education and Training (NCVET) has set any separate goals under DDUGKY; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Jolle, Shri Annasaheb Shankar', 'Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.', 'Simha, Shri Prathap', 'Karadi, Shri Sanganna Amarappa', 'Surya, Shri L.S. Tejasvi']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to take any steps for the development of rural villages as Smart Villages in the line of Smart Cities project; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the roadmap envisaged by the Government for the development of villages as Smart Villages?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Committee to Nominate Movie for Oscars
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the Oscar Committee rejected the movie Udham Singh saying it portrayed hatred against the British; (b) the details of the composition of the Committee selected by the Government to nominate a movie for the Oscars; (c) whether there is any laid down procedure to nominate members, if so, the details thereof; (d) the details of the criteria as applied by the Committee to select a movie to be nominated for the Oscars; and 690 (e) whether the Government has any proposal to rectify the situation and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Agrawal, Shri Rajendra', 'Singh, Shri Rajbahadur', 'Yadav, Dr. Krishnapal Singh', 'Pratap Chandra Sarangi, Shri', 'Gupta, Shri Sangamlal Kadedin', 'Chaudhary, Shri P.P.', 'Solanky, Shri Mahendra Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Deendayal Disabled Rehabilitation Scheme(DDRS) has been implemented in the States of Madhya Pradesh, Odisha , Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh, if so, the details thereof; (b) the funds allocated and projects sanctioned under this scheme in the country, State-wise including in Uttar Pradesh,district-wise; (c) the number of women beneficiaries under the scheme; and (d) the steps taken by the Government to increase accessibility and outreach of the scheme?

topic: Sale and Purchase of Properties in J&K
from: ['Naik, Shri Raja Amareshwara', 'Sonkar, Shri Vinod Kumar', 'Singh, Shri Bhola']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has altered the land laws of Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) wherein no domicile or permanent resident certificate is required to purchase non-agricultural land in the UT of J&K; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has drafted SOPs for sale and purchase of land in J&K in the light of the Big Landed Estates Abolition Act, 1950; (d) whether a large number of operational difficulties has been reported during the sale and purchase of properties in UT of J&K; (e) if, so, the Governments reaction thereto; and (f) the other measures taken by the Government in this regard?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Accessibility of Sports at Village level
from: ['Kashyap, Shri Suresh Kumar', 'Singh, Shri Rajbahadur', 'Yadav, Dr. Krishnapal Singh', 'Solanky, Shri Mahendra Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to make sports accessible to the masses at the village level; (b) the details of budgetary provisions made for the same, State/UT-wise and (c) whether the Government proposes to acquire land with the State Governments to promote sports in the country and if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken by the Government to promote One District One Product (ODOP) Scheme; (b) the details of the measures taken to provide jobs to unemployed youths and to promote entrepreneur under the said Scheme; (c) whether Hathras and Aligarh districts of Uttar Pradesh have been included or are likely to be included in the above said scheme; (d) if so, the details of products of Hathras and Aligarh identified for inclusion in the said scheme; and (e) if not, the time by which these districts are likely to be identified?

from: ['Chinta Anuradha, Smt.', 'Nallakonda Gari, Shri Reddeppa', 'Singari, Dr. Sanjeev Kumar', 'Madhav, Shri Kuruva Gorantla', 'Rangaiah, Shri Talari', 'Madhavi, Smt. Goddeti', 'Reddy, Shri Pocha Brahmananda']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the progress of construction of state-of art Forensic Science Laboratory in Amravati, Andhra Pradesh; and (b) the details of funds allocated and utilized under the proposal?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']
state: ['Andhra Pradesh', 'Andhra Pradesh', 'Andhra Pradesh', 'Andhra Pradesh', 'Andhra Pradesh', 'Andhra Pradesh', 'Andhra Pradesh']

topic: Promotion of Dairy Industry and Animal Husbandry
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has formulated any action plan to boost dairy industry or increase its production and export during the last five years; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the roadmap of the action plan and the extent to which dairy products has increased compared to its production in the past?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received any request from the State of Kerala for including all the districts in the State in the expansion of oil palm cultivation; (b) if so, the details thereof and the decision taken by the Government; (c) the details of annual action plan submitted by the State under National Mission on Edible Oils-Oil Palm and the status of approval of the same; (d) whether the Government is planning to drastically increase palm oil production in the country; (e) if so, the details thereof and the measures proposed for expansion of palm oil cultivation; and (f) the details of oil palm cultivation and palm oil production in the country presently, State-wise?

from: ['Misra, Shri Pinaki', 'Ram Mohan Naidu, Shri Kinjarapu', 'Chidambaram, Shri Karti P.']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has released its Annual Report for 2019 and 2020; (b) if so, the date on which it was released and updated on the NCB website; (c) if not, the reasons therefor along with the time by which the aforementioned Report would be available in the public domain; (d) whether it is a fact that NCB published last monthly Drug Situation Report in March 2019; . (e) if so, the reasons for which NCB has not been publishing monthly Drug Situation Report since 2019; and (f) the details of links to all Drug Situation Reports published by NCB since February 2019?
party: ['Biju Janata Dal', 'Telugu Desam Party', 'Indian National Congress']

topic: Information to Citizens at Village Level
from: ['Patel, Shri Gajendra Singh', 'Uikey, Shri Durga Das']
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any action plan for providing information to citizens at village level and to ensure for publicising broadcasting; (b) the arrangements made by Government so that information on welfare schemes of Government reaches to people at panchayat level; (c) if so, the details thereof, State-wise; and (d) if not, the time by which it is likely to be made?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is implementing any scheme to increase the stock of indigenous cattle breed in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and the details of Indian breed cows, State-wise; (c) whether there is any difference between the quality of milk of foreign breed cows and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether it has been found in the research that the A2 quality milk obtained from cows of indigenous breeds is more beneficial for human health and if so, the details thereof? (e) whether there is a decline in the total number of indigenous cattle as per the latest livestock census; and (f) if so, the details of steps the Government proposes to take to conserve and encourage indigenous breed cows, State-wise?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the total number of pick-pocket, cell phone missing/ snatching, bike and car thefts complaints being registered in National Capital Territory (NCT) region from 2014 to 2021; (b) whether any recovery of above said articles have been done so far along with the recovery percentage rate; and (c) if so, the details of the cases regarding above categories for which only complaint have been received but no FIR has been filed along with the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the reasons that growers have not been able to enter into contract with retailers to push production of organic cotton; (b) the method adopted by the Ministry for addressing the increased labour requirements, greater variability in organic yields year-to-year, lower fiber quality, etc; (c) whether lack of seed breeding efforts and non- availability of seeds is contributing to less production of organic cotton; and (d) if so, the steps being taken by the Ministry to address these issues in a time-bound manner?

topic: Setting up New Hybrid and Electric Vehicles Manufacturing Units
from: ['Madhav, Shri Kuruva Gorantla', 'Gurumoorthy, Shri Maddila', 'Reddy, Shri Magunta Sreenivasulu', 'Reddy, Shri Adala Prabhakara', 'Satyanarayana, Shri M V V']
contents: Will the Minister of HEAVY INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set up new hybrid and electric vehicles manufacturing units and battery manufacturing units under National e-Mobility Programme during the last three years in Andhra Pradesh, if so, the details thereof; and (b) whether the Government is contemplating to set up such units in other States/UTs, if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government would contemplate to add the provision in the Act to have Planning Board for every Panchayat by involving some technocrats and local elected representatives and non-elected officials to make perspective plans for villages, as Panchayats are vital organs of our democratic process and development and a significant part of funds are allotted to them? (b) whether the Government would organise a study to explore the need for such Boards as mandatory? and (c) if not, whether the Government is content with the present State of developmental planning by Panchayats?

from: ['Kathir Anand, Shri Durai Murugan', 'T. Sumathy (A) Thamizhachi Thangapandian, Dr.']
contents: Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plans to establish a National Cooperative Societies Development Fund to cater financial support to enhance the outreach of Cooperative Societies in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the steps taken by the Government in this regard; (c) whether the Government has demarcated the powers, jurisdiction and roles and responsibilities of this newly formed Ministry in dealing with Multi State Co- operative Societies and the Co-operative Societies functioning within the State; and (d) if so, the details thereof and the manner in which the centre would work in tandem with the State Governments without infringing upon the rights of the State Governments enshrined in the Constitution?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: 693 (a) whether Integrated Bee Development Centers (IBDCs) have been established in the North-Eastern Region (NER) under the National Beekeeping and Honey Mission (NBHM), if so, the details of the number of such centres, State-wise; (b) the number of honey testing laboratries established in Meghalaya under NBHM; and (c) the steps taken to promote the beekeeping industry in Meghalaya?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has formulated any plan to provide livelihood opportunities to the Transgender community; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to impart skill training to Transgender community to enable them to obtain suitable employment?

topic: Sports Competitions under Khelo India Scheme
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the number of sports competitions organized at the national level by the Government under Khelo India Scheme; and (b) the facilities made available for the above competitions at the national level especially for the identification of sports talent at the rural level and for participation in sports competitions of international level especially in the State of West Bengal during the last three years; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Beesetti , Dr. Venkata Satyavathi', 'Nallakonda Gari, Shri Reddeppa', 'Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun', 'Patil, Shri Sanjay(Kaka) Ramchandra', 'Reddy, Shri Pocha Brahmananda']
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has proposed an amendment in Cinematograph Act,1952; . (b) whether the Government is aware that the proposition goes against the Supreme Court decision wherein the court ruled that the Government cannot weigh in on cases which have already been reviewed and classified by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC); and (c) if so, the steps taken by the Government to ensure that the proposed amendment maintains the autonomous powers of CBFC in certification acceptable media for public consumption?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether Government has received a report from a Committee for Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) India to carry out a systematic selection method for Target Rating Point (TRP) under the Information and Broadcasting Ministry headed by Prasar Bharati to review the existing guidelines for TV ratings and recommendations; (b) if so, details of the report and recommendations therein; (c) whether any recommendations by the Government have specified TRP schedule and rating procedures for news, entertainment, infotainment and audio, etc., if so, the details thereof; (d) whether it is also a fact that BARC mess remains unresolved till date; and (e) if so, the details of the proposal if any, by the Government for an early resolution therein?

topic: Funds for Schemes in Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the amount provided under various schemes of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying to various States including the States of Haryana, Assam and North-Eastern States during the period from the year 2014 to 2021; (b) whether the said amount has been spent within the time limit; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, whether the Government has fixed any responsibility in this regard? 694

topic: Implementation of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act,  2016
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that while the schemes under Scheme for Implementation of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016 (SIPDA) have increased exponentially from 2016, the fund allocation has increased by only 9%; if so, the reasons for this meagre increase; (b) the amount eventually spent by each SIPDA sub-scheme in the last three years; (c) whether the Government is aware that a single allocation of funds to SIPDA with further allocation to sub-schemes based on expected demand prioritizes some sub-schemes at the cost of others; (d) if so, whether the Government has taken any steps to redress the same; and (e) whether the Government has considered allocating a specific amount to each sub-scheme as opposed to having a single allocation of funds for SIPDA annually?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that Malayalam, the language widely spoken in Kerala, has still not been accorded as the official language of Kerala, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government of Kerala in 2015 had forwarded the Malayalam Language (Dissemination and Enrichment) Bill, 2015 that was passed in the Kerala Legislative Assembly, for the final assent of the President of India, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government has sought any clarification from the State Government/Central Ministries in this regard and if so, the details thereof like nature of clarification, date of seeking clarification and the date of providing clarification; (d) whether the Government will be able to provide a time-frame to expedite the process of giving assent by the President if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Malayalam Language Bill is still pending approval of the Union Government; and (f) if so, the details thereof along with the reasons for the delay in getting the approval of the President? .

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the number of beneficiaries who got assistance under the Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI) scheme in West Bengal; and (b) the number of applications received from West Bengal as on date, district-wise?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the details of names and population of indigenous variety of cows in the country; (b) the steps taken by the Government to protect these Desi breeds (Indian); and (c) whether there is any institute or research centre to develop our Desi breed cows, if so, the details thereof along with name and location?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has released funds to the States particularly to the State of Andhra Pradesh under the poultry venture capital fund; (b) if so, the details of amount of funds sanctioned, released and expenditure incurred, number of entrepreneurs benefitted so far, State-wise; and (c) whether the Government has undertaken additional steps to enhance the entrepreneurial skills of the beneficiaries, if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the country is becoming an important destination for health enhancing food products; 695 (b) if so, the incentives being given to the farmers of the country to enable more production of world class food products; and (c) the measures being taken by the Government to develop food products of Gujarat at par with the world class food products?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government plans to undertake a survey to identify/collect data on the exact number of manual scavengers in the country, if so, the number of manual scavengers present in the country, State-wise; (b) the number of scavengers died while on the job due to asphyxiation in the country during the last three years; (c) whether Government has planned to make very stringent rule to end manual scavenging and the rehabilitation of manual scavengers, if so, the details thereof; (d) the list of safety/protective equipment/gear provided to manual scavengers like mask etc.; (e) the details of the schemes and their allocations for the rehabilitation of manual scavengers for the last three years; and (f) the number of persons penalized under the Act for flouting its provisions by engaging any person for manual scavenging?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government maintains data of insurance companies under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY), if so, the total number of insurance companies providing insurance service to the farmers, State-wise/UT-wise; and (b) the total premium paid by the Centre, State and farmer including the percentage of each party, in each year since the commencement of PMFBY till date, State/ UT-wise?

topic: Setting up of TV Transmitters in Backward Areas
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) the details and the number of TV transmitters set up and presently working in the country especially in the backward and rural areas as on date; (b) whether various projects are pending for want of financial and technical sanction in various States; (c) if so, the details thereof State/UT-wise including backward and rural areas in the country; (d) the time by which these projects are likely to be granted sanction; and (e) the time by which the construction work is likely to be started, location-wise?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the current position regarding the implementation and extension of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS); (b) whether the budget for MGNREGS is lower than the revised estimates for the previous year, if so, the reasons thereof; (c) whether the Government agrees that in the light of the employment crisis exacerbated by the COVID-19 crisis employment opportunities in small towns and rural areas must be improved; (e) whether the Government is willing to commit to an expansion of the budget and annual temporal scope of the MGNREGS in order to combat the looming employment crisis, the brunt of which will be borne by small towns and rural areas; and (f) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Violation of FCRA Rules by NGO
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received any complaints against violation of Foreign Contribution Regulation Act, 1976 Rules by some NGOs in the State of Andhra Pradesh which are misusing FCRA Rules by 696 indulging in Christian conversion by inducements, allurement and misrepresentation since 2018, if so, the details thereof; and (b) the action taken by the Government against the NGOs and the steps taken to obviate such incidents in future?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the provisions made by Government under Khelo India Scheme to build new Infrastructure complexes and Construction of Stadia Complex for Sportspersons in the Lok Sabha constituency of Porbandar in Gujarat; and (b) whether the Government is setting up Khelo India State Centres of Excellence (KISCE) under Khelo India in the District of Porbandar in the State of Gujarat, if so, the details thereof along with the time by when the same is being set up?

topic: Olympic Sports Academy in Uttar Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government for the development of 46 sports being played at Olympic games; (b) the details of the Sports Academies established/ set up in respect of the sports mentioned above, State/ UT-wise and sports-wise; (c) whether the Government is contemplating to establish Olympic Sports Academy in Uttar Pradesh; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering having the options of auto-registration and payment of insurance amount under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) so that few farmers are not left out due to non- payment of crop insurance amount in time; . (b) if so, whether the Government intends to utilize the experience of private sector insurance professionals to further streamline the process of the PMFBY across the country; and (c) whether there is a dedicated cell in the Ministry to monitor the scheme State-wise and district-wise?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that there has been nearly 30% reduction in fish species in the Ganga river during the period from 2016 to 2020; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the reasons for such significant reduction; (c) whether the Central Inland Fisheries Research Institute, Kolkata has conducted any study on the issue and taken any steps to improve the fish species; (d) if so, the details thereof and the time by which the said species are likely to be improved; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the total number of villages covered under the SVAMITVA scheme, State-wise, down to district-level of the State of Rajasthan, and their expected year of mapping; (b) whether as per the framework and guidelines of SVAMITVA, 46,543 villages in the State of Rajasthan will be mapped under the scheme by 2023, if so, the details of the progress made as of November 2021, (c) whether the Government has any updated action plan to meet SVAMITVA targets post-COVID-19, if so, month-wise year-wise details ofvillages to be covered in the State of Rajasthan till 2023; (d) the number of property loans that have been granted through the SVAMITVA Scheme since 2020, State-wise, year-wise data down to district-level for the State of Rajasthan; and (e) whether the Government has prioritised areas with high pendency of land disputes in the mapping plan under SVAMITVA and if so, whether any experts in the field of land rights and related studies were consulted in the process? 697

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government considers relaxation of the norm to sanction for providing connectivity to habitation 100 and above for 18 AIP Districts and 250 and above in 12 Non IAP districts of Odisha, since tribal dominated districts cover more than 40 per cent of total population of State; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Governments considering to share funds towards the cost of post five-year maintenance of Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) roads; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether NABARD Consultancy Services (NABCONS) and National Institute of Rural Development (NIRD) has hired the staff as per MoU/Mandate; (b) if so, the number of staff permitted for full time payroll as per mandate and MoU; (c) the details of Mandates/MoUs and Staff details along with PF and ESI details working for Deendayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY) programme; (d) whether the Union Government has released the total sanctioned funds for NABCONS and NIRD; and (e) if so, the details of the funds allocated to the respective States?

topic: Conservation of Indigenous Breeds of Cattles
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by Government to conserve indigenous breeds of cattles particularly Hallikar, Amrithmahal ,Khillari etc. which are native to the State of Karnataka; (b) whether the Government has conducted census of such breeds of cattle, if so, whether the numbers are declining or increasing during the recent years; (c) whether Indian Council of Agricultural Research in association with Animal Husbandry and Veterniary Department of Karnataka has undertaken any measures to protect such breeds, if so, the details thereof alongwith the funds sanctioned and utilised so far; and (d) the status of implementation of Rashtriya Gokul Mission in the State of Karnataka?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has planned to increase the premium under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) reassessing the extensive crop failure caused this year due to higher rainfall; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

topic: National and State Legal Service Authority
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of cases in which the National and State Legal Service Authorities supported the victims of atrocities against SCs and STs in 2020 and 2021; (b) the number of awareness camps being organised under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989 and Rules 1995 by the National and State Legal Service Authority in 2020 and 2021; (c) the budget allocated for the National and State Legal Service Authority to support the victims, under the said Act and Rules for 2020 and 2021; and (d) whether the State Government has prepared any plans in the past or proposed any measures so as to engage the victims of atrocities with State Service Legal Authority, if so, the details thereof?

topic: Dr. Ambedkar Scheme for Social Integration
from: ['Udasi, Shri Shivkumar Chanabasappa', 'Shrangare, Shri Sudhakar Tukaram', 'Singh, Shri Pradeep Kumar', 'Naik Nimbalkar, Shri Ranjeetsingh']
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: 698 (a) the number of couples provided incentives for inter-caste marriages under Dr. Ambedkar Scheme for Social Integration across the country during the last three years, the details thereof, year-wise, State/UT-wise particularly in the States of Karnataka, Maharashtra and Bihar; (b) the precise reasons for very slow implementation of the scheme for promotion of inter-caste marriages in Karnataka, Maharashtra and Bihar; and (c) the corrective steps taken by the Government for release of incentives to all the inter-caste couples in Karnataka, Maharashtra and Bihar on regular basis immediately after such marriages?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

from: ['Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.', 'Simha, Shri Prathap', 'Karadi, Shri Sanganna Amarappa']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has recently released any report on the adverse impact of global warming on the agricultural production in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) has also assessed the impact of global warming on the agriculture sector of the country; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the remedial measures taken by the Government in this regard?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether there is any plan of the Government to set up food processing industry (FPIs) in tribal areas; (b) whether there is plenty of forest produce in tribal areas on which 90 percent of tribals are dependent for their livelihood; (c) whether the Government proposes to increase the value of forest products by bringing and processing primary forest produce and food stuff in Baitul and rest of Madhya Pradesh to the Government warehouses and food processing centres; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Singh, Shri Sunil Kumar', 'Koli, Smt. Ranjeeta', 'Patel, Shri Devji Mansingram', 'Nath, Shri Balak']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is promoting protected cultivation in the country; (b) if so, the details of the steps taken/being taken by the Government in this regard; and (c) the details of the areas covered under protected cultivation in the country during the last three years, State-wise?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether there are several cases pending for investigation/delayed due to absence/delay in furnishing forensic reports; (b) if so, the details thereof with the kind of forensic reports, number of forensic labs and forensic experts required and currently present for investigations in the country, State/UT-wise; (c) the details of the steps taken by the Government to increase the infrastructure of forensic labs and number of trained technical experts; and (d) the details of the number of pendency of cases due to absence/delay in furnishing forensic reports in Saran and the steps taken by the Government?

from: ['Saraswati, Shri Sumedhanand', 'Shrangare, Shri Sudhakar Tukaram', 'Singh, Shri Sunil Kumar', 'Koli, Smt. Ranjeeta']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the total number of subsidy applications received and sanctioned by the National Horticulture Board (NHB) for integrated development of commercial horticulture in the country, State-wise including Rajasthan; (b) whether the Government has formulated any plan for promotion of post-harvest and cold chain infrastructure for horticulture products and if so, the details thereof; and 699 (c) the fresh steps taken by the Government for simplification of subsidy scheme guidelines, documentation and processing of new applications ?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: BPRD findings on Women in Police Force
from: ['Jothi Mani, Ms. S.', 'K. Navas, Shri Kani', 'Muraleedharan, Shri K.']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the Bureau of Police Research and Developments (BPRD) latest findings indicating that women make up only 10.30 percent of Indias Police Force; (b) whether the Government is taking any steps to ascertain the causes for this gender divide and if so, details thereof; and (c) the steps taken by the Government or plans to take to reduce this gender divide?
party: ['Indian National Congress', 'Indian Union Muslim League', 'Indian National Congress']

contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether any schemes with regard to providing facilities and priority to the landless labourers in animal husbandry sector is under consideration; and (b) the details of schemes of the Government to connect landless labourers to modern dairying business?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is planning to develop Integrated Check Post infrastructure in the Indo-Nepal, Indo-Bangladesh, and Indo-Bhutan Borders in the North Bengal region, if so, the details thereof; (b) the steps taken by the Government to develop Indo-Nepal trade and movement of people through border outposts in Panitanki and Pashupati Nagar under Darjeeling District; and (c) whether the Government is considering developing a new Indo-Nepal border outpost at Binnabari under Khoribari block of Darjeeling District and if so, the details thereof? .

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to strengthen livestock sector in the country, if so, the details thereof; (b) the details of the fund earmarked and target fixed in this regard; and (c) the time by which action is likely to be taken along with the details thereof?

topic: Formulating Roadmap for Fit India Movement
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government have launched a campaign Fit India Movement in August, 2019 for physical fitness, eating habits to keep the environment clean and keep diseases away, which is very important for the lifestyle of citizens; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has taken any steps to make Fit India Movement program successful by formulating a roadmap and coordinating with Ministry of Education, Ministry of Panchayati Raj and Ministry of Rural Development through their Ministry; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of the status of Fti India Movement as on date?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made any efforts to define hate crime in the criminal law framework of the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether it is true that the National Criminal Records Bureau (NCRB) had collected data on the hate crimes, cow vigilantism and mob lynchings, but left it out of its 2017 Report, and if so, the reasons thereof; 700 (d) whether the Government has made any effort to give effect to the guidelines laid down by the Supreme Court in Tehseen Poonawalla v. Union of India; and (e) if so, the details thereof, and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to set up high-powered Police Technology Mission to adopt the future technologies for fulfilling grass root level policing requirements and to tackle some of the routine challenges faced by Police; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the aims and objectives of the Police Technology Mission?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the progress made under the Fit India movement since its inception in 2019, State-wise; (b) whether the Government has been successful in reaching every school/university, village/panchayat of the country in promotion of the movement, if so, details thereof; (c) if not, what percentage of India has been made aware and has participated in the movement; and (d) the details of initiatives and awareness campaigns that have been undertaken to spread awareness on fitness in India under this scheme?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made any assessment to find out if the prisons in the country are overcrowded; (b) if so, the details thereof alongwith the reasons therefor; (c) the total capacity of prisons in the country alongwith the total number of prisoners therein, State- wise; (d) the details of the total number of foreign prisoners in the country, country-wise; and . (e) the steps taken by the Government to ensure that the prisons of the country are not overcrowded?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of budget estimate, revised estimates of funds for Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme(MGNREGS) for fiscal 2019-20, 2020- 21; (b) whether the Government considers inflation factors while fixing the budget allocation under MGNREGS; and (c) the amount of outstanding wage payment for the last financial year 2019-20, 2020-21?

Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is earning revenue through Frequency Modulation (FM) Radio; (b) if so, the revenue being earned as on date therefrom, State-wise; (c) the details of FM Radio stations working as on date, State-wise; (d) the average estimated cost of setting up FM Radio station; (e) whether the Government proposes to set up some more FM Radio stations; and (f) if so, the details thereof and the names of those places, State-wise?

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) whether some States and districts are lagging behind in respect of development and some other States and districts are developing rapidly causing a huge gap between States and regions specially between the districts selected in Backward Region Grant Fund (BRGF); (b) if so, the schemes being implemented by the Government to bring the backward region at par with developed States; and (c) the extent to which BRGF is helpful for improving the conditions of less developed States? 701

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is implementing the Border Area Development Programme (BADP) in all border districts in 17 States through the State Governments; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the funds allocated and spent by the Government of West Bengal under the BADP during the last five years, district-wise including North Dinajpur and South Dinajpur; (d) whether the Government has accorded In- principal approval for issuance of identity cards to all Indian citizens living in all the border districts of the country, if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government has further asked Registrar General of India (RGI) for preparing a scheme in this regard, if so, the present status thereof; and (f) the other steps proposed to be taken by the Government to expedite the implementation of BADP in the country?

topic: Banning Banking Service by Cooperative Societies
contents: Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government noticed the problems faced by cooperative societies due to the recent order issued by RBI banning them from banking services; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to overcome such movements?

topic: Beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the total number of registered farmers and the number of farmers found eligible and ineligible for the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana and also the number of farmers who were deprived of registration in the country since 2019, till date; (b) the steps being taken by the Government to include those farmers under the scheme who were deprived of registration; and (c) the details of farmers who have received the amount under the said scheme in the country till date, instalment-wise, district-wise and State-wise?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of people living Below Poverty Line (BPL) in the country based on BPL census, State-wise; (b) whether the list is being used in determining the beneficiaries under poverty alleviation programme; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Changes in Rules for Sanction under PMGSY
from: ['Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made any changes in the Rules for sanction, construction etc. of Rural Roads under Pradhan Mantri Gramin Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government received any complaints regarding development of Rural Roads after such amendments in the Rules governing PMGSY; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of the corrective steps taken by the Government to make scheme as village friendly?
party: ['Biju Janata Dal', 'Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Restrictions on Karnataka and Kerala Border
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that the people of Kerala from Manjeswaram and Kasaragod Taluks are still facing difficulties due to restrictions imposed by the Government of Karnataka on the Kerala-Karnataka border at Thalappadi in the name of Covid Pandemic and now on Omicron COVID-19 variant outbreak; (b) if so, whether the matter been brought to the notice of the Government; (c) if so, the details about the Central Government policies in State Borders on the matter; 702 (d) the steps that have been taken so far by the Central Government to repeal such policies earlier and nowadays -of Karnataka denying freedom of movement to the dependents of the city of Mangalore in Karnataka for medical, educational, trade, and employment purposes; (e) whether the State Government of Karnataka has taken note of the plight of the people of Kerala, if so, the details thereof; and (f) the steps taken by the Central Government to give permissible relaxation on travel restrictions in Kerala State Borders?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that the Union Government is faced with a high flow of job seekers in the flagship Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the total number of job seekers registered under the MGNREGS across the country as on date, State-wise particularly in the State of Tamil Nadu; (d) whether the Union Government is facing any impediments and hindrance to provide employments to all job seekers under the scheme; and (e) if so, the details thereof?
