topic: Schemes for Social Justice and Equality
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has been succesful in providing social justice and equality among people through its various schemes with regard to poverty, homelessness, gender inequality, racial discrimination and etc. during last five years specially during corona pandemic; (b) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise and the outcomes thereof, if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) whether any developmental steps taken in this regard, if so, the details thereof?

topic: Mission on Edible Oilseeds and Oil Palm
from: ['Rathod, Shri Dipsinh Shankarsinh', 'Kundariya, Shri Mohanbhai Kalyanji']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether to reduce the dependency of imports for edible oils, the Government launched any Mission on edible Oilseeds & Palm Oil plantation; (b) if so, the details of the response received for the Mission; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; (d) the details of area of crops sowed since the of launch of the Mission; crop-wise, district-wise & State- wise; (e) whether any targets have been set in this regard; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao', 'Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set up the Central Victim Compensation Fund, if so, the objectives thereof; (b) whether the Government has made any review of the modified Central Victim Compensation Fund, if so, the details thereof and the extent to which modifications made has so far been able to achieve its objectives; (c) the details of the amount allocated for victim compensation by the Government and disbursed to each State; (d) the amount of fund utilized by each State for victim compensation; (e) whether the Union Government has observed any underutilization of funds by State for victim compensation; and (f) if so, the action taken thereon to increase utilization of Central Victim Compensation Fund?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Biju Janata Dal', 'Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether power generated from Hydrogen cell, solar, Methanol fuel cell is affordable and environment friendly and can be easily used at inaccessible places; (b) if so, whether the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) propose to use green technology like Methanol and Hydrogen to meet the demands of fuel and logistics; 703 (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) the details of the funds spent till date for adopting green technology for the use of CAPF; (e) whether the dependency on diesel and petrol has reduced with the use of the said technology; and (f) if so, whether the said technology is likely to be adopted in the future?

from: ['Bhabhor, Shri Jaswantsinh Sumanbhai', 'Kachhadiya, Shri Naranbhai Bhikhabhai', 'Patel, Shri Parbatbhai Savabhai']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the manner in which the Government is committed to release funds for payment of wages and materials for proper implementation of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS); (b) whether the amount of funds released for the said work during current year is higher than the last financial year; (c) if so, the extent to which the said funds have been increased as compared to the last year in Gujarat; and (d) the measures being taken for smooth implementation of the said scheme in Dahod, the tribal domain area of Gujarat?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Cultivation of Indian and Exotic Fruits
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has identified globally popular fruit crops including dragon fruit and avocado; (b) whether some Indian fruits have also been identified as having commercial properties and high nutritious value to promote their cultivation in a big way; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the State of Punjab has also been identified to promote the cultivation of exotic fruits and indigenous fruits; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS . be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware about the recent demolition of a catholic church at Lado Sarai in Delhi; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the competent authority has taken requisite legal steps before taking action against the Church; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the actions taken against authority; (e) whether the Government has received any requests to maintain the pre-demolition status quo in case of the church; and (f) if so, the details thereof and the action taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to ensure that the cradles of Green Revolution are there, viz., policy support from Government, good number of proven institutions, human resource and willing and progressive farmers to adopt new technologies and policies; (b) whether the Government is planning to focus on One Health concept, which includes soil health, plant health, animal health and also human health; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: in the (a) the schemes including skill development schemes being run by the Government for the welfare of Scheduled Castes country, (SCs) State-wise; (b) the funds sanctioned, utilised and the achievements made during the last three years, State- wise; (c) whether any target has been fixed in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof and the achievements made, scheme-wise? 704

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) works undertaken in Andhra Pradesh in 2019-20, 2020-21 and 2021-22, district-wise; (b) the details of mandays provided to labour during the above period, month-wise, year-wise and district- wise; (c) whether it is true that second tranche of MGNREGS dues to the tune of Rs. 5,000 crores are pending for payment to the State Government of Andhra Pradesh; and (d) if so, the steps taken by the Government to release the pending dues?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds sanctioned, allocated and utilised under the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) across the country during the last 5 years and the current year, State-wise, including the State of Telangana, district-wise; (b) the details of the rural road projects sanctioned in Telangana during the said period and the present status thereof; (c) whether the Government has given approval for implementation of phase-III of PMGSY in the country; (d) if so, the details thereof including the number of districts proposed to be included under the same along with the details of funds to be sanctioned in this regard in Telangana; and (e) the details of the targets fixed under the same?

topic: Expansion of Local and National Schemes for Rural Development
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to facilitate the active participation of women, youth, local people and rural communities including weaker sections of the society in the expansion of local and national schemes for rural development in view of the National Law particularly in Karnal, Panipat and Kurukshetra Parliamentary Constituencies in Haryana; . (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps taken for the training of rural communities and capacity building for the effective implementation of climate change adaptation programs on local level along with the details thereof particularly in Karnal and Panipat Parliamentary Constituencies in Haryana?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the huge shortage of personnel in the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the adverse impact on the speedy disposal of cases due to staff shortage; (c) whether any steps are being taken to create additional posts in the NCB and if so, the details thereof; (d) the corrective measures, if any, taken to improve the technical competence of the NCB personnel and acquaint them with latest surveillance and investigation techniques; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the sports quota in the Union and State Government jobs also extend to para-athletes and if so, details thereof; (b) whether the sports quota in the Central and State universities also extend to para-athletes and if so, the details thereof and the admissions made thereunder; and (c) whether there is any officially recognized association or tournaments at the Government level to select such para-athletes and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Gandhi, Shri Feroze Varun', 'Reddy, Shri Anumula Revanth']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT 705 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government admits that Socio Economic and Caste Census (SECC) 2011 data is unusable for any statutory exercise; (b) if so, whether the Government has taken any steps to update the 2011 SECC and repeat the same in 2021; (c) whether the Government is creating a searchable database with citizen data that updates itself in real time, if so, the details thereof; (d) the objective of developing and maintaining such a database; (e) the citizen-related details that the Government will be storing in the database; and (f) whether the database will be linked to Aadhaar, and if so, whether the database will facilitate the accessibility of inter departmental sharing of Aadhaar related details?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has evolved any mechanism to assess losses to farmers on account of price fluctuations of agricultural produces; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Adhikari, Shri Dibyendu', 'Sudhakaran, Shri Kumbakudi', 'Jothi Mani, Ms. S.', 'Margani, Shri Bharat Ram', 'Chidambaram, Shri Karti P.']
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that India ranked 142 out of 180 countries listed in the World Press Freedom Index compiled by Reporters Without Borders in 2021, dropping two spots from 2020, remains bad, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has ascertained/ identified the reasons for the same, if so, the details thereof and the remedial measures taken in this regard; (c) whether the Government is aware of the incidents reported in Tripura where police booked 102 people including journalists under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Editors Guild of India (EGI) has objected on such a harsh law for penalizing the journalists for merely reporting on and protesting against communal violences, if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the Government has taken steps to protect the safety and freedom of journalists, if so, the details thereof?
party: ['All India Trinamool Congress', 'Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Indian National Congress']

contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying has taken into consideration timely supply of Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD) vaccine to the State of Odisha under National Animal Disease Control Programme and the release of Central Share in time as per the Budget Provision for effectively and timely implementation of different Centrally sponsored schemes like Livestock Health and Disease Control Programme, Assistance to States for Control of Animal Diseases, Peste des Petits Runinants - Eradication, National Livestock Mission and National Animal Disease Control Programme; and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the details of the progress of Gram Swaraj Abhiyan in Haryana; District Wise (b) the number of village people in the State who have benefited under different segments, if so, the details thereof, district-wise along with the figures thereto; and (c)the number of villages which are yet to benefited therefrom?

from: ['Muraleedharan, Shri K.', 'Chowdhury, Shri Adhir Ranjan', 'Dhanorkar, Shri Balubhau Narayanrao (Alias Suresh)', 'Mohammed, Shri Faizal P.P.']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of households that got employment under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) so far in the financial year 2021-2022 as compared to the previous year; (b) the number of households that had applied for the programme but did not get employment under the scheme in 2021-2022; and 706 (c) whether the Government has provided all such households an unemployment allowance, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?
party: ['Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress', 'Nationalist Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that certain media channels have tried to manipulate the system of Television ratings through corrupt means; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the action taken/proposed to be taken by the Government against these media channels; (d) whether the Government has ordered any study into the issue of Television channels manipulating Television Rating Points (TRP) using corrupt means; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) the details of the preventive measures taken/ being taken by the Government to avoid such things from happening in the future?

topic: Survey of Sportspersons in North Eastern Region
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted any survey in the North Eastern Region for improving the facilities and financial assistance needed by the Sportspersons to perform better in view of future sporting events; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the status of the setting up of the 1000 new Khelo India centers announced in June 2020 and the total number of Centres to be instituted in North Eastern Region?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to increase the annual income limit of 8 lakh rupees fixed for economically weaker sections, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government proposes a plan to relax the land/property related provisions in the norms fixed for reservation to economically weaker sections in Rajasthan, if so, the details thereof; . (c) whether the income of mother and father has been included in the family income of the applicant in the guidelines fixed for reservation to economically weaker sections despite the applicant having a separate family ration card, if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government proposes to bring about any amendment in this procedure, if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the salient features of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between the Government of India and the United Nations World Food Programme (UNWFP); (b) the detailed steps envisaged by the Government to achieve the Strategic Outcomes enlisted under the said MoU; (c) the details regarding countrys performance with regard to SDG 2 (Sustainable Development Goal - 2) during the last five years, especially with regard to sustainable agriculture practices; and (d) the ways and means in which the MoU can help to supplement countrys domestic efforts in this regard?

Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is contemplating bringing out a new policy on over-the-top (OTT) censorship whereby OTT platforms are allowed to self regulate; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has any proposal to bring paradigm shift in the cinematography policy and its censorship in the country; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Development of Rural Areas under CSR
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether any new initiatives have been taken for equitable development of rural areas under Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) during the last three years, if so, the details thereof; 707 (b) the details of expenditure incurred on rural development under Corporate Social Responsibility during each of the last three years; and (c) the specific areas under which these CSR activities have been carried out?

topic: Roadmap for the Development of Sports
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) whether any discussion has been held with the representatives of the States and Union Territories in order to prepare a roadmap for the development of sports in the country; (b) if so, the details of the sports representatives of various States who participated in the above discussion; (c) the details of the suggestions and proposals received during the said discussion; (d) whether any proposal for development of sports has been received from the State Government of Bihar; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao', 'Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Ghosh, Shri Dilip', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the role of infrastructure is crucial for agricultural development and for taking the production dynamic to the next level, if so, the facts in this regard; (b) whether the Ministry has formulated a Central Sector Scheme to mobilize a medium long term debt financing facility for investment in viable projects relating to post-harvest management Infrastructure and community farming assets in the country particularly in Odisha; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has assisted the State Governments for bringing improvements in the infrastructural facilities in the agriculture sector, if so, the details thereof including allotment of funds during the last five years particularly in West Bengal; (e) whether the Government has undertaken any study for assessing the impact of initiatives/schemes since 2014 on the income of farmers particularly in West Bengal and if so, the details thereof; and . (f) the extent to which the farmers will get benefits of the Central Sector Scheme?
party: ['Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Biju Janata Dal', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

from: ['Maadam, Smt. Poonamben Hematbhai', 'Chikhalikar, Shri Prataprao Patil']
contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is planning to provide a mechanism to link agricultural production to the market by bringing together farmers, processors and retailers with mega food parks; (b) if so, whether there is any planning to start it in Saurashtra region of Gujarat especially in Jamnagar; and (c) the criteria set by the Government for setting up of a food park?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the quantum of fund allocated/released for promotion of fishery in the North Eastern(NE) States particularly in the State of Assam during the last five years; (b) the detail of centrally sponsored schemes being implemented for development of fisheries and welfare of fisherman in NE States particularly in the State of Assam; and (c) the number of beneficiaries , schemes-wise, State- wise and year-wise during the said period?

Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether a high-level team of Film section of Doordarshan visited Guwahati two/three years back and held a meeting with different Feature Films Producers regarding telecast of Regional Feature Films in different Doordarshan Channels of the North East; (b) if so, the details and the action initiated after this meeting; (c) the details and the number of Feature Films in Regional languages in BCN Format, U-Matic Format, Betacam Format, DVC Pro Format available in different 708 tape libraries of capital stations of Doordarshan in North Eastern Region; and (d) the steps taken by Prasar Bharati to transfer the programmes to digital format and preserve these feature films, Doordarshan Kendra-wise break-up of the programmes?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana (PMAY) completes five years of its implementation; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the amount allocated under the scheme so far since its implementation and the number of houses constructed, year-wise, State/UT-wise; (c) the future plan of the Government under the scheme for the next three years and steps, if any, taken to attain the objective of Housing for All by 2022 particularly for the State of Tamil Nadu; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun', 'Patil, Shri Sanjay(Kaka) Ramchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) the details along with the amount of Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in Direct-to-Home (DTH) broadcasting services; and (b) the details of the FDI inflows to various services providers?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken steps to ensure that the genuine beneficiaries are not deprived of the benefits under the Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G) scheme; (b) the number of days taken to build a house under the scheme, State-wise; . (c) the number of beneficiaries that are remaining to be provided land by States/UTs, State-wise; (d) the details of the houses built under the scheme along with the time taken to build these houses, State- wise and the details of funds disbursed under PMAY-G; (e) whether the Government has any proposal to increase per unit assistance amount under PMAY-G and if not, the reasons therefor; and (f) the number of landless beneficiaries that are covered under the PMAY-G State/UT-wise?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the names of schemes and the total budget allocated under schemes for the development of rural roads in West Bengal during the last five years, district- wise including North Dinajpur and South Dinajpur districts; and (b) the details of the roads constructed so far and the length (in km.) of rural roads constructed, district- wise including of North Dinajpur and South Dinajpur districts?

topic: Programmes for Rural Poverty Alleviation during Corona Pandemic
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of policies and programmes formulated by the Government to overcome the horror of corona pandemic and also to provide adequate employment in the villages for rural poverty alleviation as well as all- round development of villages; and (b) the State-wise details of number of villages which have received or are receiving the benefits of these policies formulated by the Government so far?

topic: Setting up of Small Food Processing Units
from: ['Sharma, Shri Jugal Kishore', 'Kora, Smt. Geeta', 'Kamait, Shri Dileshwar']
contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES 709 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to encourage the setting up of small food processing units at farm level keeping in view of the abundance of agricultural produce in certain geographical area; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has identified such cereals, oilseeds, vegetables, fruits etc. which may be processed and packed in small scale food processing units particularly in Supaul Bihar, West Singhbhum Parliamentary Constituencies in Jharkhand and Jammu & Kashmir Parliamentary Constituencies respectively; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of youth trained under the Target Olympic Podium (TOP) Scheme; (b) the details of youth who are trained under the said scheme in the State of Odisha, district-wise; and (c) the details of the amount of fund allocated and spent for implementation of the scheme in the State of Odisha since inception along with the outcome thereof?

topic: Employment Opportunities in Animal Husbandry and Dairying
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a)whether there is huge potential in livestock and dairying sector and a large number of people are employed in the said sectors in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise; (c) the details of the animal husbandry and dairying related schemes implemented by the Government to expand the respective sectors across the country including coastal States like the State of Kerala; and (d) the various steps taken by the Government to increase the employment opportunities in these sectors and to protect indigenous species?

from: ['Suresh, Shri Doddaalahalli Kempegowda', 'Ambareesh, Smt. Sumalatha', 'Kateel, Shri Nalin Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that Indigenous bovine breeds of India are robust and possess the genetic potential to play crucial role in the national economy, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether it is true that the population of Indigenous bovine breeds is declining and their performance is below the potential at present, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to introduce any specific programme on development and conservation of indigenous breeds;and (d) if so,the details thereof?

from: ['Sharma, Shri Vishnu Datt', 'Sharma, Dr. Arvind Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether Government is making any efforts to stop the degrading practice of manual scavenging which still continues at some places despite claims of it being eliminated; and (b) if so, the details of efforts made and outcomes/ achieved thereof?

from: ['Sagar, Shri Arun Kumar', 'Rawat, Shri Ashok Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: particularly Parliamentary in Shahjahanpur Constituencies (a) whether work is being carried out under Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY) in the and country, Misrikh of Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof, particularly in Shahjahanpur and Misrikh Parliamentary Constituencies including updated status in Uttar Pradesh as on date; and (c) the details of the Central funds allocated including the utilization of the said funds during each of the last three years, State-wise? 710

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that resilient and high-yield rice varieties would be available by the year 2024 developed by using gene editing techniques; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether it is also true that the gene-editing guidelines are facing delay in the country; (d) whether it is also true that a proposal from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute (IARI) is pending with an appraisal committee for almost two years; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Old Age Home & Drug Ban Scheme
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of proposals that have been received from the State of Madhya Pradesh including the Bhopal Lok Sabha constituency under the old age home and drug ban scheme in the year 2021-2022; and (b) the number of cases for which approval has been issued and the number of cases which are pending for approval?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plan to discipline and strengthen the private security agencies after the major role they played during peak period of COVID-19 to enable them to be more effective in rendering services? (b) if so, the details thereof? (c) whether the Government has undertaken any study on how these agencies could be more effective so that their base could be broadened further to generate more employment; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the number of grain banks established in Jaunpur district of Uttar Pradesh; (b) whether the Government intends to increase the number of grain banks established in Jaunpur district; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the funds allocated by the Government for the same?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to form a special panel to probe atrocities by police; (b) if so, the details thereof and findings thereof; and (c) if not, the time by which such probe will be conducted, State-wise?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to provide subsidy to the farmers for purchasing baler to collect paddy straw from their farms; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the number of balers supplied in Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh during each of the last three years?

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the number of Gram Panchayats in the country that have prepared their development plans, State-wise? (b) the total number of activities planned for these villages versus the number of activities completed, State- wise? 711 (c) whether the Government is considering proposals to improve the scheme which come from implementation level (d) if so, the details thereof? and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the number of institutes for testing of seeds and fertilizers in the country along with the details thereof; (b) the total amount spent on the said institutes during the last three years along with the total testing work carried out by them; (c) whether several problems are being faced in testing of specimen in the said institutes due to shortage of sufficient staff and equipments; and (d) if so, the corrective steps taken by the Government in this regard and the target fixed for specimen testing by the said institutes during last three years and the current year?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the details of Beej Gram Yojana implemented in the country particularly in Rajasthan during the last two years and the current year; (b) the details of the funds allocated and utilized in various States of the country, State-wise including Rajasthan during the said period; (c) whether National Seeds Conference had been organized to help farmers during the time of sowing during the last three years in view of the changing scenario of the country; (d) if so, the details of the issues discussed in the conference and the outcome thereof; and (e) the intention of each State Government particularly Rajasthan in this regard and the outcome of such conferences?

topic: Cold Storage for Processed Food Items
contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES . be pleased to state: (a) the number of cold storages set up for storing perishable commodities, processed food items, poultry meat, sea food etc., in Maharashtra; (b) whether there is shortage of cold storage facilities in some districts; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the steps taken by Government to establish more cold storages, including in the Public-Private Partnership mode and the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether Kendriya Bhandar having majority share holding of Government did excellent work during demonetization and COVID period and efforts were appreciated by the Government, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether Kendriya Bhandar has attained unprecedented growth of 400% during the last three years, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether Kendriya Bhandar has played crucial role in Delhi to provide pulses/onions etc. at very low price during crisis, if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has decided to promote multi-State Co-operative Societies, if so, whether the Government has plans to restore stationery OM which was applicable till 31.03.2015; and (e) whether the Government plans to expand services of Kendriya Bhandar, like Delhi to other cities/States for the benefit of countrymen, if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether, the Government proposes to set up veterinary RT-PCR lab etc. in the State of Rajasthan for testing of viscera, sample etc. of animals considering the geographical location and peoples dependency on animal husbandry in the State; (b) if so, the time by when it is likely to set up; (c) if not, the reasons along with the details thereof; (d) whether the State Government has sent any proposal to the Union Government regarding setting up of any lab managed by the Centre in the State of Rajasthan; and 712 (e) if so, the details of the progress and the decision made on the said proposal?

from: ['Kundariya, Shri Mohanbhai Kalyanji', 'Rathod, Shri Dipsinh Shankarsinh']
contents: Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether there is any independent evaluation conducted on National Council of Cooperative Training (NCCT); (b) if so, the details thereof and the steps taken by the Government to create capable Human Resource for neo-cooperative movement in the country; (c) whether financial audits are conducted on NCCT activities; and (d) if so, the details thereof including the audit paras still pending for action?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether recruitment racket was being operated in CRPF-CISF which has been exposed; (b) if so, the number of such cases came to light during the last four years; (c) whether the officers of the department have also been found involved in such a recruitment racket; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Setting up Facilitation Center for International Film Producers
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has recently announced to set up a Facilitation Center with Single Window Clearance System for grievances of International Film Producers; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether specific policies have been framed for areas such as Animation and other related sectors, Visual Effects (VFX) to attract investments from major film markets of abroad; and (d) if so, the details thereof? .

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the details of allocations and release of funds under 14th Finance Commission and 15th Finance Commission for Gram Panchayats in Andhra Pradesh, Tamilnadu , Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat, year-wise; (b) whether it is a fact that some funds are yet to be released; and (c) if so, the details thereof and by when the funds are going to be released?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Centrally-Sponsored Schemes being implemented for the promotion of agriculture in Uttar Pradesh ; (b) the details of the amount allocated in this regard during each of the last three years and current year; (c) the amount of funds utilized under those schemes along with the targets set and the achievements made in this regard; and (d) whether some proposals received from the State Governments are pending with the Union Government and if so, the details thereof and the reaction of the Government thereto?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of availability of National level medical Institutes specifically for physical Disabilities like Locomotor Disabilities i.e. Pt. Deendayal Upadhyaya National Institute for Persons with Physical Disabilities (Divyangjan) (PDUNIPPD) and for rehabilitation training and research i.e. Swami Vivekanand National Institute of Rehabilitation Training and Research (SVNIRTAR); (b) the number of disabled persons who have availed Inpatient/Outpatient treatment during each year of the past five years; and (c) the total number of beds available for mental health patients and the occupancy rate of these mental health facilities in these institutes? 713

topic: Setting Up of Creches for Police Employees
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has prepared any plan to set up creches to look after the children of police employees/officers where both of the parents are in the police; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has received any proposals from the State Governments in this regard; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the reaction of the Government thereto?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government can provide data on incidences of fratricide in the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs), if so, the details on fratricide in CAPFs thereof during the last three years, State-wise; (b) whether the Government recognizes the increasing instances of suicides and fratricides in the CAPFs; (c) if so, the measures taken/being undertaken to promote the mental health and well-being of the jawans in the CAPFs and the details thereof; (d) whether stress management courses have been introduced in the CAPFs to tackle the problems of suicide and fratricide and if so, details thereof; and (e) whether the Government has been successful in administering the policy of 100 days with family for the jawans in the CAPFs, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Crisis Faced by Seafood Processing Industry
contents: Will the Minister of FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of the crisis faced by the seafood processing industry in the country, especially in the State of Kerala as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, if so, the action taken thereon; (b) whether the Government has made any attempts to understand the living conditions of people employed in the Seafood processing industry in the country especially in the State of Kerala including the number of . people depending on the said industry for their livelihood, if so, the details thereof; (c) if not, whether the Government intends to institute a study for the same; (d) whether the Government will consider providing special assistance to the seafood processing industry to tide over the present crisis caused by COVID-19; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Special Package for Dairy Industry in Kerala
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the severe impact to the dairy industry in the State of Kerala following the floods in 2018; (b) whether the Government is further seized of the losses suffered by the industry approximately to the tune of Rs.400 crore and milk production reduced to half of its previous capacity; (c) if so, whether the Government is going to introduce a special package to support the dairy sector of the State of Kerala and has taken measures to recoup the sector; (d) if so, the details thereof; and, (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that more than 80 percent of the farmers in the country are having less than two hectares of agricultural land; (b) if so, details thereof; (c) whether the Government have any plans to improve the income of these small farmers; and (d) the details of facilities provided by the Government to small farmers in the country for raising the collective power of small farmers?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS 714 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has maintained any data pertaining to the number of Sedition cases filed during the last three years; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the rate of Conviction to the number of cases filed with regard to Sedition cases is available with the Government; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is contemplating to fill the vacant posts of IPS in the country especially in the State of Punjab, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (b) the number and details of vacant posts of IPS have been filled during the last two years?

topic: Impact of Irrigation on Farmers Income
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted any assessment of increase in the income and prosperity of the farmers through various water projects in the country including Bundelkhand; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether investment in agriculture in the areas covered under water projects due to availability of water has also increased; and (d) if so, the details thereof, State-wise including Bundelkhand?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether a number of employees working in urban bodies have lost their lives while cleaning sewers/ septic tanks across the country during the last five years; . (b) if so, the total number of people who lost their lives while engaging in sewer cleaning process;the details thereof, State-wise and year-wise; (c) whether the Government has formulated any new concrete policy to discontinue the manual cleaning of sewers; if so, the details thereof;and (d) the latest measures taken by the Government to provide modern equipment, training and uniform to the people engaged in sewer cleaning; the details thereof, State-wise?

topic: Gram Panchayatâ€™s Access to Roads under PMGSY
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the length of roads constructed in Gujarat under the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) during the last three years and current year District-wise; and (b) the number of Gram Panchayats provided access to roads under the PMGSY during the said period?

from: ['Basheer, Shri E. T. Mohammed', 'Dubey, Dr. Nishikant']
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether it has come to the notice of the Government that the incidence of use of drugs is rising rapidly among women, children and budding generation in the country in an alarming way, if so, the details thereof; (b) the steps proposed by the Government to control it; (c) the number of women and children detained for selling/using drugs during each of the last three years and the current year; (d) the number of de-addiction Centres functioning across the country, State-wise; and (e) the details of financial assistance provided to these Centres during the said period, State-wise including Jharkhand?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE 715 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has analysed issues regarding the excessive use of fertilizers, and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government proposes to control and regulate the use of fertilizers considering the damage to the soil due to the excessive use and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to prepare block-wise soil health data and if so, the details of action taken thereon; (d) whether the Government proposes to prepare a data bank for fertilizers and if so, the details of action taken thereon; (e) whether the Government proposes to ban or control the use of fertilizers considering the nature of soil and if so, the details of the action taken thereon; and (f) whether the Government proposes to withdraw fertilizer subsidy and if so, the details thereon?

topic: Prime Minister Address to the Nation
contents: Will the Minister of INFORMATION AND BROADCASTING be pleased to state: (a) the various languages in which the Prime Ministers speeches/messages to the Nation are broadcast; (b) the steps taken by the Government to ensure that live telecast of the Prime Ministers address to the Nation is also comprehensible to the non-Hindi speaking population; and (c) whether the Government proposes to carry out direct translation of the telecast of Prime Ministers messages in the languages mentioned in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution and make them available to the regional channels?

topic: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Amendment Act,1989
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of cases registered under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989 from January, 2021 to November, 2021 involving ST people; and (b) the number of cases registered against police officials under this Act for falsely and intentionally implicating ST people in various theft cases? .

from: ['Gogoi, Shri Gaurav', 'Bordoloi, Shri Pradyut', 'Sangma, Smt. Agatha K.']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the reasons for selecting the North-East regions and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands for the National Mission on Edible Oils-Oil Palm; (b) whether the Government has assessed the adverse impact of oil palm plantations on biodiversity and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government has or intends to implement measures to mitigate the adverse effects of oil palm plantations; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?
party: ['Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress', "National People's Party"]

contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the date of launch of the Unique Disability Identification (UDID) cards for disabled persons; (b) the number of persons who have been issued such cards till date, the details thereof of the State of Maharashtra, district-wise; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HEAVY INDUSTRIES be pleased to state: (a) the details and the percentage of personal vehicles which are hybrid or electric and currently in use, State-wise including the State of Bihar; and (b) the steps being taken by the Government to promote adoption of hybrid and electric vehicles among the public?

from: ['Vasava, Shri Mansukhbhai Dhanjibhai', 'Darbar, Shri Chhatar Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: 716 (a) the measures taken by the Government to protect and promote the traditional agricultural produce in the country; (b) whether the Government proposes to encourage research work to improve the existing local varieties of agricultural produce and seeds; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the steps being taken in this direction?

topic: Arrests Made Under UAPA in  Tripura
from: ['Chowdhury, Shri Adhir Ranjan', 'K. Navas, Shri Kani']
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the number of arrests made in Tripura under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) along with the list of activities that are considered to be unlawful under UAPA; (b) whether the Government recognises a social media post that criticises the Government to be an unlawful activity; (c) if not, whether the Government can justify the arrests made in Tripura for posting and reporting about the recent communal violence in Tripura; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering the reservation system in the private sector as the Government is on a drive to privatize public sector companies, if so, the details thereof; (b) the number of OBCs who got Government jobs during the last years, Ministry-wise; and (c) the initiative taken by the Government for social empowerment of OBCs?
Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) whether any scheme has been formulated to improve the Panchayat system; and (b) if so, the details thereof? .

topic: Damages Caused by Rains and Floods in Puducherry
contents: Will the Minister of HOME AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has made any assessment of damages caused by the recent heavy rains and floods in Puducherry; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of relief provided by the Union Government to the UT administration?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received certain complaints about scams in scholarship of students belonging to SC/ST in educational institutions in different States of the country during the last three years; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any cases have been filed against the educational institutions involved in those scams; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds allocated to the State Government of Maharashtra during the last three years under the various schemes of Panchayati Raj; (b) whether the Government has expedited the village land survey mapping under SVAMITVA Scheme; and (c) the details of steps taken by the Government for ensuring uniformity in revenue laws of States under this scheme?

from: ['Jadhav, Shri Sanjay Haribhau', 'Bhavana Gawali (Patil), Ms.', 'Rajenimbalkar, Shri Omprakash Bhupalsingh alias Pavan', 'Tumane, Shri Krupal Balaji']
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE 717 be pleased to state: (a) whether Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) is effective for the compensation of crop loss during natural calamities, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Central Government, State Governments and farmers give their share to the designated insurance companies, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether insurance companies have not provided the benefits of crop insurance to farmers by formulating many new rules and if so, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government has reviewed the same including the details thereof; (e) whether the Government is aware that the rule made by insurance companies to apply for the compensation of crop loss within 72 hours is very difficult and inconvenient; (f) the direction given to the insurance companies for the convenience of farmers as electricity and internet gets affected during natural calamities and the monsoon; and (g) the steps taken by the Government to change the said rule and to protect the interest of farmers affected during natural calamities?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is implementing nutrition sensitive agricultural practices under the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM) programme, if so, the details thereof including the specific components of the programme and targets for the year 2021-22; (b) if so, the details of the districts in which the programme is being implemented including those in the State of Odisha; and (c) the details of component-wise quantum of funds allocated during the Financial Year 2021-22?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the details of the steps taken by the Government to encourage pisciculture and achievements made so far, State-wise, district-wise during the last three years; and (b) the number of farmers benefitted under the said scheme so far in the country along with the details thereof, State-wise, UnionTerritory-wise and district-wise? .

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is implementing any scheme to impart to the rural youths and farmers, skill development training relating to agriculture and its allied sectors and if so, the details thereof; (b) if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether any steps are being taken by the Government to impart special training to women farmers; and (d) if so, the details thereof along with the outcome thereof during the last five years?

topic: Agricultural Loss due to Natural Calamities
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether farmers have suffered huge loss of crops and livestock in March, 2020 due to natural calamities like severe hailstorm with rains and dust storm in Misrikh Parliamentary Constituency particularly in Misrikh, Sandila and Balamau areas of Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, whether the Government has provided financial assistance to the farmers in Misrikh Parliamentary Constituency by making assessment of the huge loss due to these natural calamities; (c) whether the Government has received requests from the public representatives in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof and the action taken by the Government in this regard so far?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that the State Government of Telangana has announced Rs. 3 lakhs ex- gratia payment to the bereaved families of 750 farmers who lost their lives in the farmers agitation, if so, the details thereof; and (b) the steps taken by the Government to get data of the number of farmers who have died from the State Governments where such an agitation was taking place? 718

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether heavy rain has caused extensive crop damage in Jharkhand during the last three months; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has fixed any accountability in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to do away with the difference of creamy layer and non-creamy layer in respect of backward classes; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Government is aware that the youth hanging in between the creamy layer and non-creamy layer feel frustration due to failure in getting selected for appointments and admission for education despite having the capability and the students and the youth lose their self-confidence, if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds sanctioned and allocated under the third phase of Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana in the State of Bihar; (b) the present status of the funds sanctioned under the said scheme; (c) whether the approved projects are likely to be completed within time limit in Bihar; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , . be pleased to state: (a) whether the State of Andhra Pradesh is among the highest in aquaculture production; (b) whether the Government is also aware that the State Government of Andhra Pradesh is now pushing hard to set up aquaculture hubs in the State; (c) if so, the financial and other assistance that Government would provide to the State for this purpose; and (d) whether the Government proposes to extend the the State of to River Ranching programme Andhra Pradesh and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the wages paid to the workers under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) in different States; (b) whether States, in addition to the Central funds are also contributing from its funds towards the wages paid to the workers under MGNREGS; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the quantum of funds contributed towards it?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that despite the Central Governments directive to State Governments to purchase maize from farmers at the Minimum Support Price (MSP) of Rs.1,870 per quintal, the Government of Madhya Pradesh is not purchasing maize from the farmers, forcing them to sell their produce between Rs.1,000-1,200 per quintal causing huge losses to them; and (b) whether the Government has any proposal to issue fresh directives to the Government of Madhya Pradesh to purchase maize from farmers at MSP of Rs.1,870 to protect the interests of farmers of Madhya Pradesh and if so, the details thereof and the action taken thereon?

topic: Contribution of Agriculture to the Economy
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE 719 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that more than 50 percent of the countrys workforce is employed in agriculture and it contributes about 20 percent to its GDP; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has any proposal to bring a separate budget for agriculture in view of its importance to the economy; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Employment to Rural Youth of SC/ST/EWS
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the rural youth of Scheduled Tribes/ Scheduled Castes/Economically Weaker Sections are provided employment as guaranteed under the employment generation schemes in the State of Odisha; (b) if so, the details thereof during each of the last five years; (c) the amount of funds provided by the Government under the said schemes during the said period; (d) whether the Government has assessed implementation of the said schemes and if so, the details of the said assessments; and (e) the further steps taken/being taken by the Government for effective implementation of said the schemes in the country particularly in the State of Odisha?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of components being covered under the National Food Security Mission (NFSM) and the details of the number of States/districts in which the NFSM is being implemented; (b) whether the Government is planning to include Tamil Nadu under NFSM to promote pulses and oilseeds cultivation and if so, the details thereof, district-wise; and (c) the target likely to be set in this regard along with the funds likely to be sanctioned for this purpose, district-wise in Tamil Nadu?

Will the Minister of COOPERATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware about the increasing illegal and irregular activities of the Cooperative Societies in the country, particularly in the State of West Bengal during the year 2012-2020, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is considering to take stringent action against such Multi-State Cooperative Organizations including any corrective steps taken/being taken by the Government to curb the same, if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Government has established any mechanism to provide relief to the investors of such Societies and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Chauhan, Shri Nihal Chand', 'Kashyap, Shri Dharmendra Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the salient features of Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (SAGY); (b) the details of the number of villages in the country developed under the said scheme since its launch till date State/UT-wise; (c) whether the Government allocates funds for the said scheme, if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has issued necessary guidelines for development of institutional infrastructure of the villages under the said scheme and if so, the details thereof; and (e) the steps taken by the Government to give impetus to the efforts of Members of Parliament for the successful implementation of the SAGY in their adopted Gram Panchayats?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether 80 per cent of economically active women are contibuting to the agriculture sector which includes agriculture labour force and self-employed farmers; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether some special policy measures are being taken by the Government to ensure the maximum participation of women in agriculture start-ups; and (d) if so, the details thereof? 720

topic: Inclusion of  Castes in  SC/OBC lists
contents: Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the criteria laid down for inclusion of a community/caste in the list of Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Classes and the procedure followed for this purpose in the country; (b) whether the Government has received any proposals from the State Governments for inclusion of any community/caste in the Central List of Scheduled Castes, if so, the details and status thereof, State/ UT-wise particularly in the State of Uttar Pradesh; (c) whether all the formalities have been completed in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Household Enlisted in SECC-2011 under PMAY-G in Odisha
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the number of Households enlisted in the Socio Economic and Caste Census (SECC) list of 2011 in Odisha and the verified number of beneficiaries listed for allocation of Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana-Gramin (PMAY-G); (b) the number of beneficiaries out of the verified list whose houses have been fully completed and the number of houses not completed yet; (c) the number of applications received in the State of Odisha who did not find place in the SECC list of 2011 and number of applicants who have challenged their exclusion in the verified list; (d) whether there has been any compliance of the advisories of the Ministry to the State Government after physical verification of the high-level committee sent by the Centre few months back; and (e) if so, the report thereof?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether any soil testing work is being done in the country, especially in Santhal Pargana in Jharkhand; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise; and . (c) the number of people who have benefitted by the soil testing work during the last three years and the current year?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set up any institutes for management, development and conservation of land resources in the country including Bihar; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) whether the Government has issued any guidelines to the State Governments to notify agricultural land under the Special Category to check its use for any other purpose?

topic: Phases of SAGY in UP and Bihar
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether all the works have been completed as per Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana in the villages adopted in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar in the first phase of the scheme; (b) the status of the villages thereof, parliamentary constituency-wise; (c) the status of the villages adopted in the second phase in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar under the said scheme; (d) the amount of funds released by the Government in the form of assistance for completing the works under the said scheme in each village adopted in the first and second phases; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is distributing artificial limbs and assistive equipments for Divyang persons on a large-scale; (b) if so, the details thereof for the last five years, year-wise and State-wise; and (c) if not, the reasons for reduction being noticed in such distribution during the last three years? 721

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether any measures were initiated to compensate the crop damage suffered by the farmers due to heavy rains that lashed Belagavi district in Karnataka recently; and (b) if so, the details thereof along with the time by which farmers are likely to get financial benefit/assistance?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) has not been successful in achieving its objectives and whether a few major States have implemented an independent crop insurance scheme as per their requirements rather than implementing the said scheme; (b) if so, whether any task force has been constituted by the Government to bring comprehensive reform in rules and regulations of the said scheme; (c) whether the said task force proposes to create a draft of an integrated crop insurance scheme in consultation with and as per suggestions of the States; (d) whether farmer organizations have also registered complaints regarding financial irregularities being committed by the private companies under the said scheme; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of roads constructed in Maharashtra and other States under Pradhan Mantrai Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY), State-wise; (b) the funds approved, spent/unspent during the last three years under PMGSY especially in the districts of Maharashtra; (c) the details of roads proposed to be constructed, district-wise in Maharashtra under PMGSY along with their length; . (d) the status of work completed in Yavatmal-Washim districts under PMGSY and the details of the amount sanctioned and released for this purpose; and (e) the time-frame fixed to complete the work and progress made till now in this regard?

topic: Crop Damage due to Stray Animals
contents: Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the number of stray animals is increasing day by day which is causing damage to the crops of the farmers; (b) if so, the district-wise details thereof in respect of Uttar Pradesh; (c) whether there is any scheme to compensate the farmers for the loss of their crops caused by wild animals; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the farmers are likely to be compensated for the loss of their crops through the insurance companies and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Funds for MGNREGS and Construction Work in Bihar
contents: Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) whether the funds sanctioned for Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) in the country for the current year have been released; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the funds sanctioned for MGNREGS and construction work in Bihar particularly in Karakat Parliamentary Constituency have been released; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set any target for the production of fruits and vegetables in different States of the country; 722 (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise including Madhya Pradesh; (c) whether the production of fruits and vegetables has been adversely affected due to lack of irrigation in different States of the country; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) the financial assistance provided by the Government in this regard, State-wise; and (f) the schemes being formulated by the Government to increase the production of onion, tomato, potato, etc. in different States of the country?

Will the Minister of RURAL DEVELOPMENT be pleased to state: (a) the details of the States where the wages under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) are lower than the minimum agricultural wages; (b) the details of the increase in MGNREGS wages in 2021-2022 if any; and (c) whether the Government has any proposal to further increase the MGNREGS wages, if so, the details thereof, and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any programme to improve the quality of soil in order to increase the productivity; (b) if so, the details of the specific programme in this regard in the country; (c) whether the Government has given any suggestions to the farmers from time to time to work for the improvement of the quality of soil; (d) if so, the details thereof along with the action taken in this regard; and (e) the number of farmers in districts Tonk and Sawai Madhopur in Rajasthan in respect of whom soil quality has been checked?

topic: Sports Authority of India in Jharkhand
contents: Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: . (a) whether our players have made the country proud worldwide in Olympics and other games; (b) the details and the number of schemes being implemented by the Government to encourage and provide better training to such players; (c) the details and the number of players who benefitted from the said scheme; (d) the action taken/being taken by the Sports Authority of India to train the players in the State of Jharkhand during the last three years; (e) whether international players are reported to be facing livelihood crisis and they had to work as labourers to earn livelihood, if so, the details thereof; (f) whether there is any scheme to improve the lives of such players; (g) if so, the details thereof; and (h) the details and the number of players in the State of Jharkhand who benefitted from the said scheme?

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government for monitoring proper utilization of funds allocated under various schemes to Gram Panchayats in the country; (b) whether the Government has received any complaint regarding misutilisation of funds in various States/UTs; (c) if so, the details thereof along with the action taken by the Government; and (d) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to ensure proper utilization of funds?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted livestock (cow, buffalo, goat, etc) census; (b) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise; (c) whether the Government proposes to provide nutritious animal food to cattlemen/cowsheds at an affordable or subsidized rates; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, whether the Government is likely to make provision to provide nutritious animal food in the same manner as food grains are provided to the people at affordable rates? 723

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the details of encouragement given by the Government to the State Governments for rearing of animals from 2014 to till date, State-wise; and (b) the amount of funds sanctioned/spent during the said period, State-wise and scheme-wise?

topic: Semen Station under Rashtriya Gokul Mission
contents: Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken into consideration sanctioning of a second semen station in the State of Odisha under Rashtriya Gokul Mission; (b) if so, the time by when the proposal submitted by the State Government of Odisha amounting to Rs. 2,750.75 lakhs will be sanctioned; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of SOCIAL JUSTICE AND EMPOWERMENT be pleased to state: (a) the population percentage of Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs) in the state of Telangana presently; (b) the percentage of reservation presently for SCs and STs; (c) whether there is any proposal from the State Government of Telangana to the Union Government seeking an increase in reservation as per the population percentage; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of YOUTH AFFAIRS AND SPORTS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has announced that the BRICS Games 2021 would be held in conjunction with . the Khelo India Youth Games 2021, which have now been postponed; (b) if so, the details of the new dates for the events to be organised; and (c) the details of the locations and sports facilities hosting the said Games?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the amount of credit limit currently given under Kisan Credit Scheme to livestock farmers; and (b) the details of the amount sanctioned and the number of beneficiaries added in the State of West Bengal during the financial year 2021-2022?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds sanctioned, allocated and utilized under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) Yojana in Maharashtra till date, district-wise; (b) the number of beneficiaries covered under the said scheme in Maharashtra along with the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has transferred any amount into the accounts of farmers in Maharashtra during the lockdown period; (d) if so, the details thereof, district-wise and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) whether the Government proposes to transfer a few instalments into their accounts in advance considering the COVID-19 crisis; and (f) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: 724 (a) whether a special variety of guava is produced in Prayagraj and Kaushambi districts of Uttar Pradesh and whether there is any plan for large-scale production and marketing of the same; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has conducted any study/survey for promoting the said fruit; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) the various steps taken by the Government for using science-based management of natural resources for carrying out sustainable production and development in agricultural sector; (f) the details of the action taken by the Government to ensure quality life to the farmers engaged in farming as the same is not satisfactory; and (g) the details of the beneficiaries in Uttar Pradesh including Prayagraj district under Pradhan Mantri Anndata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan (PM-AASHA)?

Will the Minister of AGRICULTURE AND FARMERS WELFARE be pleased to state: (a) whether farmers sold soybeans at Government- cut prices; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the import of soymeal results in pulling domestic soybean prices by 50%; and (d) if so, the details thereof? NEW DELHI; December 15, 2021 Agrahayana 24, 1943 (Saka) .

Will the Minister of PANCHAYATI RAJ be pleased to state: (a) the funds sanctioned by District Council from 2019 to 2021, Panchayat Committee-wise, Gram Panchayat- wise and the work-wise for the State of Uttar Pradesh, financial and year-wise; (b) whether any criteria has been set for the allocation of funds by the Central Government, if so, the details of the criteria; and (c) whether the allocation of financial assistance has been as per the rules during the said year?

Will the Minister of FISHERIES, ANIMAL HUSBANDRY AND DAIRYING , be pleased to state: (a) the details of the steps taken by the Government for the development of inland fisheries and aquaculture in the country; (b) the details of the funds allocated in this regard, State-wise including the State of Chhattisgarh; (c) whether the funds approved/released by the Government are not being utilized as expected; (d) if so, the reasons therefor; and (e) the details of the actions taken by the Government in this regard? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has been computing the total greenhouse gas emissions by the Railway sector for each year and if so, the details thereof during the period 2016-2021, year-wise; (b) the measures taken by the Railways to reduce its carbon emissions by 32% by 2030 in comparison to the 2005 levels; and (c) the details of the measures taken by the Ministry to bring the emissions in line with our countrys Paris Agreement targets?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has sanctioned Handloom Clusters for the State of Andhra Pradesh to be established in Mandal Headquarters; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of amount of allocations made for each cluster and the amount so far released under this project?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received any proposal from railway division regarding extending the Rayalaseema Express train upto Nanded and if so, the details thereof; . (b) whether no direct train is available for the devotees going to Tirupati for darshan of Lord Balaji from Nanded; (c) if so, whether the Government proposes to extend the said train upto Nanded; and (d) if so, the time by which the said proposal is likely to be implemented?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has finalised the list of eligible households under the National Food Security Act (NFSA) taking into account COVID-19 pandemic and lockdown of the economy, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (b) the number of vigilance committees that have been set up under Section 29 of NFSA, State-wise; (c) whether the Government has plans to introduce checks on Fair Price Shops to curb irregularities in the distribution of items and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government plans to introduce Food Stamp Scheme to overcome the flaws in the current procedure/structure of Public Distribution System (PDS); and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Broad Band Connectivity in Rural  Maharashtra
contents: Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds allocated and utilised in Maharashtra, particularly in Amravati Parliamentary constituency for rural broadband connectivity under BharatNet Project; and 89 (b) the number of Gram Panchayats in Amravati district of Maharashtra where facilities regarding high speed optical fibre cable network and optical mix of media (i.e. optical fibre cable/radio/sattelite) under BharatNet Project are being implemented?

Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) whether the mining lease given to Western Coalfields Limited (WCL) in four (04) Nagar Panchayats of Chhindwara district expired several years ago and there is no proposal to start any project there in the near future; and (b) if so, whether the Government would consider taking over the huge tracts of land given to WCL and provide pattas to the poor labourers of WCL living there for the past sixty years or so, so that houses could be built for them under various Government schemes?
