Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the companies including the Government owned BSNL and MTNL which have been given approval under the production linked incentive scheme for the telecom sector and the criteria on which these entities were given approval; (b) whether this scheme is expected to significantly reduce dependence on other countries for telecom products and if so, the timeframe set out by the Government and the expected outlay thereof; (c) whether some of the companies given approval under the scheme are facing problems with respect to meeting incremental investment and production targets for the first year due to pandemic challenges and if so, whether the Government is considering extending the scheme by a year or relaxing the targets for the first year; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of STATISTICS AND PROGRAMME IMPLEMENTATION be pleased to state: (a) the details of the average MPLAD projects (in terms of funds) sanctioned in West Bengal; (b) the details of the average projects sanctioned by All India Trinamool Congress (AITC) and Non-AITC MPs, separately, executed in the State (in terms of funds sanctioned); (b) the details of the Government schemes for the revival of closed and sick spinning mills across the country along with the impact of such schemes and the status of revival of such mills, especially in Maharashtra; . (c) whether the Ministry is aware that there is a massive delay in implementation of the projects sanctioned through MPLADS by opposition MPs in West Bengal; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the corrective steps proposed to be taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to resume the packaged food services under the catering services in the trains which had been discontinued during Corona period; (b) if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government has fixed any timeline to resume the said services; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the number of railway security guards who retired from Northern Railway during the period from 1st January, 2020 to 30th April, 2020; (b) whether the railway security employees have not been given the retirement benefits like pension and gratuity for one year due to which they are facing severe financial crisis; (c) if so, the reasons therefor; and (d) the time by which the pension and gratuity benefits would be given to them?

from: ['Jadhav, Shri Sanjay Haribhau', 'Tumane, Shri Krupal Balaji']
contents: Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the number of spinning mills across the country, State-wise including Maharashtra along with the number of such mills closed during the last eight years, district- wise and the reasons for closure; 90 (c) the total number of skilled and unskilled labourers laid off in the wake of closure of spinning mills along with the steps taken by the Government to provide employment to these labourers; (d) whether there is any proposal to set up spinning mill in Parbhani Parliamentary constituency of Maharashtra; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Expansion of Rail Network in Assam
contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of each of the schemes being implemented by the Government at present for improvement and expansion of rail network in Assam; (b) the amount of funds proposed to be allocated and released and spent so far in each district of Assam under the said schemes; (c) the details of the works/projects carried out for improvement and expansion of rail network in Assam during the last three years; and (d) the details of the newly constructed rail routes by the Government in Assam during the said period?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the handloom sector in the country is declining due to lack of support from the Union and State Governments; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the details of financial aid and institutional support extended by the Union Government and various State Governments to protect handloom sector during the last three years and the growth achieved; (c) whether any assistance is available from United Nations Organization for protecting and promoting handloom industry and weavers; and (d) if so, the details thereof and assistance/ recognition received by our country during the last three years?

topic: Transfer Policy of Coal India Limited
contents: Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) the details of the existing transfer policy approved by the Board of Directors of Coal India Limited for the officers of the Company; . (b) whether there is a rule for transferring an officer of Coal India Limited from its one subsidiary to another subsidiary company on company completing 15 years of service in one subsidiary company; (c) whether there have been instances during the current year where transfer of officials from Northern Coalfields Limited to Central Coalfields Limited has been stayed; and (d) if so, the reasons for putting a stay on the transfer(s)?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Kerala Government is dissatisfied with the preparedness of India Meteorological Department (IMD) for weather forecast, especially after the devastating floods in the recent years; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Ministry is aware that as per the BIS standards, Kerala requires 256 weather stations but there are only 21 Automatic Weather Stations (AWS) of which only 15 are functional; (d) towards the progress made by IMD setting up of 100 AWSs in Kerala immediately as promised to the Disaster Management Authority in August, 2018; (e) whether the Government is aware that the Kerala Government has hired private weather forecasters and makes use of weather warnings of IMD only for comparison; (f) if so, the details thereof; and (g) the details of the Ministrys action plan for the State?

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether our country is self-sufficient when it comes to sourcing radio-active materials for power generation through nuclear energy; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details regarding the use of commercial thorium for nuclear power generation? 91

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) the number of villages in the country, State-wise and district-wise; (b) the reasons for BharatNet Phases-I and II running behind schedule; (c) the reasons for only 34,000 Gram Panchayats (GPs) having been made service-ready in Phase-II; (d) the number of GPs that have been made service ready in Phase-I, State-wise and district-wise; (e) the details of the targets set and achieved under Phases-I and II; and (f) the time it will take to make all the six (06) lakh GPs service-ready?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of the biometric signatures/ authentication required for Aadhaar registration; (b) whether finger print is necessary for Aadhaar registration and if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the people who lost finger print due to absence of finger or due to leprosy or any other disease can register their name in Aadhaar, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor? NEW DELHI; December 16, 2021 Agrahayana 25, 1943 (Saka)

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to have any mechanism to ensure accountability on the social media; and (b) if so, the details thereof and the plan of action in this regard?

contents: Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry has launched a Startup Accelerator for product innovation, development and growth during the recent past and if so, the facts thereof along with its aims; (b) the State-wise details and the number of Startups which will be helped in the early stage of their journey along with the details of investment proposed in each Startup; (c) whether the Ministry proposes to scale up its network of incubators and accelerators to phenomenal levels and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the details of the other steps taken by the Ministry to boost the fledgling Startup ecosystem in the country? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether reports state that the Minister had pointed out that business houses should not just focus on profits or think of bypassing local laws at an event organized by the CII in August, 2021; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any sort of violations of bypassing local laws have been noticed by the Ministry on the part of top Indian business houses; and (d) if so, the action taken by the Government in this regard?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has approached CBI to nail people indulging into frauds in procurement of foodgrains in Punjab and whether CBI have registered cases against a number of persons in this regard; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has found involvement of officials and ministers of the Government of Punjab in this regard; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the steps taken by the Government to improve the situation?

Will the PRIME MINISTER . be pleased to state: (a) whether ISRO has any space programme lined up for the exploration and utilization of space resources; and (b) if so, the details of those programmes and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of MINES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any steps to increase the expenditure from District Mineral Foundation (DMF); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of the guidelines regarding expenditure of funds from DMF in Rajasthan and the work-wise details of total amount of funds spent in each of the districts during the last three years; and (d) whether any committee has been constituted to approve the scheme and review the said amount and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) the number and the details of Atal Tinkering Labs (ATLs) that have been established across the country managed by the Government and private sector, year-wise, State-wise and district-wise including Rajasthan; (b) the details of the amount of funds disbursed as of November 2021 to ATLs in the country, year-wise, State-wise and district-wise including Rajasthan; (c) the details of amount of funds earmarked for establishment of ATLs for the next three years; 727 (d) the number and details of private and Government run ATLs to be established for the next year in the country, State-wise and district-wise including Rajasthan; and (e) the number and details of ATLs which are functional post March 2020 and whether the Government has created any specialised auditory mechanism to review their functioning in the post COVID era and if so, the details thereof?

contents: Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) the amount of annual rainfall in the country over the last five years, specifically Pratapgarh district in Uttar Pradesh, Sagar and Dewas districts in Madhya Pradesh and Chittorgarh, Udaipur, Pratapgarh and Pali districts in Rajasthan; (b) whether there has been a decline in annual rainfall received in these States vis-a-vis the annual rainfall received across India; (c) if so, the details thereof and the action taken thereon for transportation of water to these States; (d) whether the Government has taken any measures to increase access to water resources in the above States; and (e) if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the quantum of funds utilised by the Government for import of textile-related machinery in the last three years, year-wise; (b) the details of the progress made in textiles under the National Capital Goods Policy; (c) whether it is in line with the expected results and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the details of initiatives adopted by the Government to minimise imports and enable the production and export of quality textile machinery in the coming years?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has or proposes to establish any mechanism to protect the rights of the consumers and if so, the details thereof; (b) the steps taken by the Government to protect consumers against unfair trade practices; (c) the number of consumer courts operational in the country and the number of cases disposed of during the last three years; and (d) the other steps being taken by the Government to strengthen the rights of the consumers?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to run private trains in the near future; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the future targets of the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of the rapidly changing weather and occurrence of natural calamities during the previous years; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to adopt new technologies to ensure accuracy in weather forecasting; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Kotak, Shri Manoj Kishorbhai', 'Khadse, Smt. Raksha Nikhil']
contents: Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the status of implementation of National Handloom Development Programme; 735 (b) whether there is a significant shortfall in the physical and financial achievements, if so the details of the last three years, State-wise specially in Maharashtra; (c) the detailed reasons for the shortfall, especially in Maharashtra; and (d) the efforts made to make the programme successful and to improve the living standards of handloom weavers in the country?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted any study to assess levels of hunger and malnutrition in India during the COVID pandemic and if so, details thereof; (b) the data on the quantum of foodgrain buffer stock maintained by the Food Corporation of India, year-wise between 2014 and 2021; (c) the data on the quantum of foodgrain from the buffer stock diverted for ethanol production, year-wise between 2014 and 2021; and (d) whether the Government is considering using excess stock to issue emergency ration rather than towards ethanol production and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) the detailed reports on survey and feasibility studies relating to the Industry Verticals specific with Nellore District Coast Line, Sea Coast and Ocean for food, energy, transportation, minerals, drinking water, leisure and health; (b) the details of sea/ocean water suitability activities for livelihood of citizens and revenue generation for Union and State Governments; (c) the details of survey, studies, assessment and feasibility done so far in this regard; (d) whether the CSIR Institutes/Organizations will add value to citizens and the Government in achieving five trillion economy; (e) if so, the details thereof and the time by when a final report is likely to be made; (f) the time by when Deep Sea Mining is going to start on the coastline of Nellore district for extracting polymetallic modules that are found on the deep ocean floor rich in metals like copper, cobalt, nickel and manganese; (g) whether tenders have been called for in this regard and if so, the details thereof; (h) whether the Detailed Project Report (DPR) has been prepared and the time by when it will be made available; and (i) the conclusive estimation of value of minerals, if commercially made available for Indian industry as import substitute to reach five trillion economy?

topic: Cold Storage Facilities on Kisan Rail
contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plans to introduce cold storage facilities on the Kisan Rail, if so, the details thereof; and (b) whether the Government intends on expanding the Kisan Rail, if so, the details of the routes identified in this regard?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the progress of the monsoon in the country was not as predicted by the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the reasons for the IMD predicting wrong weather forecast; and (d) the corrective steps taken in this regard?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether ineligible beneficiaries are being struck off from National Food Security Act (NFSA) in some States and if so, the details thereof in the last five years till date; (b) whether some States sought inclusion of more families in food security purview and if so, the details thereof; and 736 (c) the action taken thereof State-wise along with the number of beneficiaries under NFSA till date and State-wise?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether Rs. 1,703 crores is yet to be paid to the Government of Andhra Pradesh by the Ministry for procurement of paddy under National Food Security Act (NFSA) since 2012-13; (b) if so, the reasons for non-payment of dues to Andhra Pradesh and reasons for delay and the time by when the Ministry is going to clear the dues; (c) whether the Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister had written a letter in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

contents: Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has come up with the Productive Liked Incentive (PLI) for the benefit of telecom companies including the Government owned BSNL and MTNL and foreign and Indian corporates in the recent past; (b) if so, the details of funds provisioned and the purpose for which it will be used; (c) the details of various telecom activities (Categories) which are eligible for getting PLI and its veracity thereof; and (d) the company-wise details of the incentives given to mobile companies?

contents: Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) the details of the trend of the population living below the poverty line for the last ten years, State-wise; (b) whether the last official estimate of population below the poverty line was done in 2011-2012; (c) if so, the reasons for not updating the figure based on latest available data; (d) whether the population of poor has increased in size/number, based on the poverty line established by the Tendulkar Committee and if so, the details thereof and if not, the supporting evidence thereof; and (e) whether the consumer expenditure survey scheduled to be conducted in the year 2021 is likely to be undertaken and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons for delay in this regard?

Will the Minister of STEEL be pleased to state: (a) the details of the steps taken by the Government to bring down the prices of Steel to ensure that cost of this essential commodity comes down; (b) the details of the steps taken by the Government to bring down the prices of raw materials like iron ore, scrap steel, steel pellets and discourage the export of such items so as to make these easily available for use in steel plants; and 737 (c) whether the Government proposes to reduce tariffs on Steel imports in case the price rise continues and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Kathir Anand, Shri Durai Murugan', 'T. Sumathy (A) Thamizhachi Thangapandian, Dr.', 'Sahoo, Shri Mahesh']
contents: Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) the salient features of the One District One Product (ODOP) initiative; (b) whether it is possible for the scheme to extend to Taluk levels as some districts are famous and known for more than one specialised product; (c) if so, the details thereof including the list of products identified district-wise in the country under ODOP initiative so far, particularly in Tamil Nadu; (d) the details of the subsidy schemes and infrastructure development projects to promote ODOP initiative in the country; and (e) the details of the total funds earmarked for this ODOP initiative, State-wise?
party: ['Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Biju Janata Dal']

contents: Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of the salient features of Governments MeghRaj (G.I. Cloud) initiative; (b) the details of the number of Central Government Ministries which have started adoption of cloud-services to improve efficiency and reduce costs; and (c) the reasons for delay in adoption of cloud- computing services?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the difficulties being faced by the people of the area due to the withdrawal of trains running in the Shornur- Nilambur route; (b) if so, the reasons therefor; . (c) whether the Government is thinking of resuming those train services in these routes at the earliest; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Schemes for the Welfare of Weavers
contents: Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the details of the schemes being implemented for the welfare of weavers in Rajasthan; (b) the details of the schemes implemented for weavers in Banswara-Dungarpur Constituency along with the amount of funds being spent by the Government thereon; (c) whether there is any scheme for training of the weavers in designing in the said Constituency; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of coal mines auctioned in the last five years, State and value wise; 738 (b) the number of such auctions that have taken place in Odisha; (c) the details of the total value of the auctioned mines in Odisha; and (d) the percentage of the money generated through auction in Odisha that has been utilised in the State?

from: ['Sonkar, Shri Vinod Kumar', 'Naik, Shri Raja Amareshwara', 'Singh, Shri Bhola']

contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is proposed to run Marwar Express on regular basis from Jodhpur to Delhi Junction via Ringas- Sikar-Jhunjhunu; and (b) if so, the time by when the said train is likely to become operational?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: . (a) whether the Government is aware of the shortage/ crisis of semiconductors or microchips in the country, which are used in manufacturing of various electrical products and automobile industry and if so, the details of the relevant steps taken to mitigate the shortage of the semiconductors/microchips; (b) the details of the causes of shortage of the semiconductors/microchips in the country; (c) the details of the status of implementation of the Scheme for Promotion of Manufacturing of Electronics Components and Semiconductors (SPECS); (d) whether the SPECS will help address the shortage of semiconductors in the future and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether Government has any data to show impact of crisis of semiconductors/microchips on Indian economy and if so, the details thereof ?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the total funds released for various schemes/ programmes of the Ministry during each of the last two years, State and year-wise; (b) whether the funds released are being utilized by the States as per the prescribed norms and if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the corrective steps being taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to boost handloom exports; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is also considering to increase the production capacities of handloom sector from the current Rs. 60,000 crore to over Rs. 1.23 lakh crore and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether a committee has been formed to achieve the said objectives; and (e) if so, the details thereof? 739

topic: Facilities in Mira Road Railway Station
contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the works started on two railway stations namely Mira Road and Bhayandar on the western railways route to provide necessary facilities for passengers along with the details of the funds made available for the same; (b) whether the load on the Borivali station is likely to be reduced if stoppage is provided to the long distance trains at both the above stations due to the start of 5th and 6th lane work by Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MVRC); (c) whether beautification of being carried out by the municipal authority at the west side of Bhayandar railway station has been cancelled; and (d) if so, the steps taken by the railway authorities to accomplish the said work and the time by when the works of 5th and 6th lane is likely to be started at Bhayandar Bay?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Railways proposes to identify, expand and construct additional platforms with covered shed at various stations in the country, State-wise including at Buniadpur in West Bengal; (b) if so, the details and the present status thereof; (c) whether the Railways proposes to raise the height of platform at different railway stations situated in West Bengal and If so, the details thereof; (d) the number of proposals received from West Bengal regarding extension and construction of platforms and the action taken thereon; (e) the norms for fixing number of platforms at railway stations in the country; (f) whether the Government has approved any scheme/project for the development of Balurghat Railway Station and if so, the details thereof and the budget provided for this project; and (g) the total budgetary allocation made and total funds utilized on providing various facilities at Balurghat Railway Station during the last three years?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: . (a) whether the Government is formulating standards for the services sector to offer high quality of services to the rest of the world; (b) if so, whether the service sector exports have been showing tremendous improvement for the last several years; (c) if so, the details thereof regarding the volume of exports achieved during the last three years; (d) whether it is also true that the Government is considering to bring in more branches in service sector exports such as legal, etc.; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the salient features and objectives of the Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana (KVPY); (b) the number of youths provided benefits under the KVPY in each of the last three years, State-wise including Gujarat; and (c) whether the Government has achieved the objectives for which the scheme was launched and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Railways has undertaken the completion of nine pending/incomplete railway lines in the state of Karnataka in partnership with the infrastructure department of Government of Karnataka and if so, the details of lines to be undertaken thereof; (b) the details of funding pattern shared between the Union and the State; and (c) the details of funds likely to be sanctioned for these railway lines?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to establish Mega Integrated Textile Region and Apparel (MITRA) Parks; (b) if so, the intended benefits of this initiative; (c) the total number of projects completed, expected completion date of remaining projects, and intended future projects under the Scheme for Integrated Textile Parks (SITP); 740 (d) whether Government intends to integrate textile producers into these schemes and if so, the details thereof; (e) the specific measures taken to promote the integration of MSMEs in the textile sector into these schemes; and (f) the details of technological innovations in textile production being undertaken in textile parks?

Will the Minister of SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has planned to set up Science and Technology Hubs across the country; (b) if so, the details thereof, including Assam; (c) the details of the funds likely to be sanctioned for this; (d) the details of the targets set; (e) the number of districts likely to be covered for this within Assam; and (f) the time by which it is likely to be commenced?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is taking steps to minimize loss of food grains in warehouses; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the quantity in terms of volume and value of food and food grains rotten in past two years; (d) whether the Government is exploring the possibility of using such grains in other products like manure etc; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether there is a proposal to extend the trains upto Kanpur after the completion of the electrification of Gwalior-Bhind-Etawa rail line; (b) if so, whether there is not a single train from Gwalior to Guwahati and a weekly train may be run from . Gwalior to Guwahati through diversion and Sabarmati Express running from Ahmadabad to Darbhanga may be diverted and run via Gwalior; (c) whether the intercity presently running from Ratlam (Indore) to Bhind may be extended upto Kanpur which is likely to benefit the passengers of Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government is likely to take any steps to provide enough facilities to the passengers?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the Rail Over Bridges (ROBs) that have been sanctioned by the Government of West Bengal in the years 2019-20 and 2020-21; (b) whether the Ministry has any plans to construct the ROB at Nalhati in district Birbhum, West Bengal; and (c) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MINES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry of Mines has received any information regarding diversion of funds accrued under the District Mineral Foundation set up under Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957; and (b) if so, the details thereof for the diverted funds, State-wise and district-wise?

from: ['Raut, Shri Vinayak Bhaurao', 'Gill, Shri Jasbir Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether an established Public Sector Undertaking Central Electronics Limited(CEL) was allowed to die by downgrading its existence and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether this was in contradiction to the MAKE IN INDIA policy of the Government and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether this downgrading and restriction was done within the power of the Research Desings and Standards Organisation (RDSO) on the basis of its prescribed guidelines and if so, the details thereof; 741 (d) the details of the number of companies that have been downgraded and delisted for the supply and installations of Multi-Section Digital Excel Counter(MSDAC)by awarding approval to foreign Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and downgrading other established players; and (e) whether this was not a step in allegedly creating monopoly and killing competition and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Raghavendra, Shri B. Y.', 'Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.', 'Surya, Shri L.S. Tejasvi']
contents: Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has approved the National Policy on Software Products and if so, the details of the aims and objectives of the said policy; (b) the details of the salient features of the National Policy on Software Products; (c) whether the Government has set any target to achieve the growth of Information Technology (IT) industry under the policy; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

contents: Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of Indian satellites that are present in the global space station; (b) the details of prime space expedition missions that ISRO prepares along with expenses in this regard; and (c) the details of major missions that ISRO operated with the support of other space research agencies along with the expenses thereof?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION

(c) the number of beneficiaries under the said schemes in Odisha including Kalahandi and Nuapada districts; (d) whether the Government of Odisha has utilised the allocated funds; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the number of railway printing presses that are now functional under Railways, location-wise; (b) whether the Railway Presses were planned to be closed in 2019 with the anticipation of digital and paperless function in Railways; (c) if so, the reasons for outsourcing the printing of several tickets, forms and books by the Railways; (d) whether the Ministry is likely to rethink on the said closure of presses; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) the district-wise details of Make in India programme in Gujarat that has been implemented; (b) the number of people benefited from Make in India programmme in West Bengal, district-wise; and 742 (c) the quantum of funds allocated/released/utilized under Make in India programme in West Bengal, district-wise?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of the fact that there has been unusual hike in price of essential commodities like rice, pulse, edible oils, food grains, potato, onion, tomato, etc. in the country which is creating problem for common people of the country; (b) if so, the steps taken/to be taken by the Government to find out the reason behind this and the measures adopted to control this situation; and (c) the details of prices of these items during the last five years?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken or proposes to take any steps to preserve and develop the tea shop located at the railway station at Vadnagar which is the birth place of our Prime Minister, where he used to sell tea during his childhood; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the latest status of the said action plan; and (d) the time by when the said action plan is likely to be completed?

contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is trying to introduce barcode and blockchain technology on procurement and storage of every sack of food grain by various agencies to bring about more transparency as well as prevention of pilferage; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor? .

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of the fact that corona had badly impacted the civil service aspirants in 2020 and 2021 and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is considering to give a compensatory chance to those who had their last chance in terms of attempt or age in these two years as many of them were either themselves affected or lost their kin and some were frontline workers during the pandemic and if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the amount of grant allocated to promote silk industry during the last three years as on date, State- wise; (b) whether Ahmadnagar district of Maharashtra has also been covered thereunder; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether unable to effectively control the menace of pesky callers and unsolicited messaging, the Government has decided to slap financial penalties on the offenders and also dismantle infrastructure of repeated trouble makers; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the earlier provision set by the Government to stop this menace and the extent to which new set of rules are able to stop this; (d) whether the Ministry has created two units- Digital Intelligence Unit (DIU) and Telecom Analytics for Fraud Management and Consumer Protection (TAFCOP) to tact crime committee through telecom network; and (e) if so, the details thereof and the financial penalty likely to be imposed under new arrangements? 743

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the frequent changes in Conditional Access (CA) policy, by allowing foreign experience to count and increasing the sufficient quantity for Multi Section Digital Axle Counter System (MSDAC) from 510DP to 5000DP on 12.04.2021, contradict the Make in India Policy 2017 and 2020 of the Government of India, as with such changes any foreign Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) can get direct registration in approved vendor easily thus awarding Indian companies slow death; (b) if so, whether such change from 510DP to 5000DP was properly authorized and followed, as per the RDSO guidelines; (c) the company that got upgradation to approved Research Designs and Standards Organisation (RDSO) and S&T vendor with the change in CA policy and the methodology used to check the authenticity of their foreign experience; (d) whether proper channel verification (certification from respective country consulate) was adopted before awarding tender approval to such company; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Kanhangad-Kaniyuru railway line has been demanded since many years by the people of Kasaragod; (b) if so, the reasons for not taking further action on the project even after conducting the preliminary survey; (c) whether the survey report is still under the consideration of the Government, if so, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Union Government has received the consent from the State Government regarding its share for this project; (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (f) the steps taken by the Government to expedite the completion of the said railway line?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) the present availability of iron ore in the country for local requirement; (b) whether it is a fact that iron ore is being exported to various countries; (c) whether there is any policy to stop export of iron ore to meet local demand; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the number of Road Over Bridges (ROBs), Rail Under Bridges (RUBs), Foot Over Bridges (FOBs), escalators and other infrastructural facilities like parking facilities to be constructed by the Railways in Tamil Nadu and the total amount of funds allocated and disbursed for the same; (b) whether the Government has identified the railway infrastructure needs of Tamil Nadu, (A, B, C grades) station/Railway Division-wise; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the total funds earmarked for the same?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to promote and boost handloom industry in a big way in the country to attract people; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the countries where Government is exporting and looking for markets of handloom products; and (d) the details of foreign exchange earned by the Government therefrom during the last three years, and the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MINES be pleased to state: 744 (a) whether work is being carried out under Pradhan Mantri Khanij Kshetra Kalyan Yojana (PMKKKY) in the country, particularly in Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof, particularly in Uttar Pradesh as on date including the updated status in this regard; and (c) the State-wise details of the Central fund allocated including the utilization of the said funds and the number of beneficiaries during each of the last three years?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) whether the National Centre for Earth Science Studies (NCESS) has completed the pilot study on cliff erosion in Varkala beach, Kerala and has submitted the report; (b) if so, the details and the findings thereof; to protect (c) whether the Government proposes to take urgent measures this unique sedimentary geo-morphological structure and provide fund for the same; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) the present status of the plan to upgrade the destination into a Geo Park approved by UNESCO?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the current status of railway projects in Punjab, district/project-wise including those where survey has been conducted, approval has been accorded but work has not been started as yet; (b) the details of the total budgetary allocations made by the Government for these projects; (c) the reasons, if any, for the delay in the completion of these railway projects in Punjab; (d) whether the Government is taking any measures to complete all the pending railway projects in Punjab within a fixed time schedule; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether some railway stations in the country have been privatized; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the reasons for privatization; (d) the benefits provided for common travellers; and (e) the steps taken to ensure that the daily life of common travellers are not affected?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) the State-wise details of deaths caused due to lightning strikes in the last five years, especially in the State of Tamil Nadu; (b) the reasons for not notifying lightning strikes as a natural calamity despite the increase in deaths and damage caused by the same; (c) the details of the lightning arrestors/detectors installed in rural areas in the State of Tamil Nadu, at present; (d) the details of number of downloads of the Damini App and whether warnings are communicated in the regional language on the app; (e) whether the Government has taken any effective steps to ensure last mile dissemination of lightning related warnings and information to mitigate damage; and (f) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of applications received by the Government of india under the Production Linked Incentives (PLI), Scheme for Promotion of Manufacturing of Electronic Components and Semiconductors (SPECS) and Modified Electronic Manufacturing Clusters (EMC) 2.0 schemes respectively; (b) whether the Government has given any approval to any of aforementioned applications received and if so, the scheme-wise details thereof and the amount disbursed thereunder; and (c) the details of the amount of investment expected to be brought in and the employment expected to be generated because of these incentives in the electronics sector therein? 745

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken or proposes to take any steps to provide facilities of drinking water, toilets, waiting room, etc. at Neemsar and Misrikh railway stations by carrying out beautification works thereof in view of their religious importance and give halt of Abida Beghum Express train at the Neemsar railway station as well as give halt of Kalindi express No. 14723-14724 and Pawan Express No. 15037-15038 at Araul-Makanpur railway station; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the railways has identified a total of 58 Super Critical Projects covering a total length of 3750 kilometres, costing Rs 39,663 Crore and out of which 27 projects were to be completed by December 2021; and (b) if so, the current status of completion of these 27 projects, and the time by when these are likely to be completed?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) the names of products which have so far been included under Geographical Indications (GI) Registry in the country; (b) whether groundnut bar, natural palm jaggery, Kashmir saffron and other items were recently included in the list and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the manufacturers of various products have also applied for GI tag; (d) if so, the details along with the action taken by the Government thereon; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of STEEL . be pleased to state: (a) whether the steel production has registered sharpest decline in the last three years due to slow demand in the automobile and real estate sector and if so, the year-wise details of total steel production; and (b) whether the Government acknowledges that the decline in steel production is wholly or partially attributed to slow down in the economy thereof and if so, the steps taken to boost the demand in automobile and real estate sector thereto and if not, the reasons therein?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government is not interested in implementing a project like bullet train project in the southern States including Tamil Nadu which has huge industrial growth; (b) if so, the steps taken so far by the Government to bring the bullet train project to these States; and (c) whether the project is to be implemented like Chennai-Bangalore, and Chennai-Madurai especially on routes Chennai-Coimbatore, Chennai-Hyderabad; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the current status and the estimated cost of the Kotipalli-Narsapur railway line construction project; (b) whether the Government of Andhra Pradesh has released its share of funds required for the completion of the project; (c) if so, the total amount of funds released by the Union as well as Government of Andhra Pradesh for the said project till date separately; (d) the reasons for delay in the completion of the project; and (e) the follow up action taken by the Government thereon?

from: ['Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of TEXTILES 746 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has launched many schemes over the past few years for the promotion of the Textile Industry in India and improving the livelihood of the people associated with it; (b) if so, the details thereof particularly in respect of Odisha; (c) whether the Union Government has reviewed these schemes to assess its impact on the livelihood of the people associated with these schemes; (d) if so, the details thereof particularly in Odisha; (e) whether the Union Government has implemented project SURE (Sustainable Resolution) scheme for Integrated Textile Park (SITP); (f) if so, the objectives and salient features of project; and (g) the extent to which the objectives of the scheme have so far been achieved?

Will the Minister of SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to fill the post of Director, Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences & Technology (SCTIMST); (b) the details of the reasons for non implementation of Ayushman Bharath in SCTIMST; and (c) the details as to why the treatment is not free for Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) ration card holders in SCTIMST?

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Space and Satellite Companies Industry Association (ISpA) was digitally launched by the Prime Minister; (b) if so, the details thereof and the details of governing body members; (c) whether this private space and satellite company will have functions in separate locations with their staff/ scientists; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the PRIME MINISTER . be pleased to state: (a) whether the New Space India Ltd. (NSIL) was set up for the purpose of research and development work of Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Centres; (b) if so, the details thereof along with its salient features; (c) whether the emergence of NSIL has spurred the growth of Indian industries in the space sector and has enabled Indian industries to scale up manufacturing and production base and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the other steps taken by the NSIL to provide capacity building of local industry for space manufacturing?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that India is at an all-time high in exports of goods and services during this financial year; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the total number of goods and services that has been exported to other countries during this financial year and the total income earned through these exports, product and country-wise?

from: ['Chowdhury, Shri Adhir Ranjan', 'Rao, Shri Nama Nageswara']
contents: Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) whether coal is being imported in the country since the year 2014, if so, the country-wise details thereof along with the quantum of coal imported during the last five years and the current year; (b) the cost of imported coal as compared to that of the coal produced at domestic level; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to promote domestic coal production?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Railways proposes to restore the stoppage of Train No. 12311 Netaji Express and Train No. 18310 Muri Express at Hathras Junction for the 747 convenience of traders and passengers to resume the pre-COVID-19 situation; (b) if so, the time by when the stoppage of the said trains are likely to be started; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Railways proposes to resume the stoppage of Train No. 15484 Sikkim Mahananda Express at Hathras Junction railway station for the convenience of traders and pilgrims; (e) if so, the time by when stoppage is likely to be provided at the said station; and (f) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the current status on the extension of Nuapada- Gunupur rail line upto Therubali railway project; (b) the time by when the project would be made operational; (c) the steps taken by the Government to mitigate any delays; (d) the updates on setting up Rayagada Division; and (e) the steps taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Ministry to rejuvenate the dying jute industry in eastern part of India; (b) the steps taken by the Government to address the issue of intense competition and cheap Bangladeshi import; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to ensure that the jute balers receive timely payments from mills?

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set any target for generating nuclear power and whether the target is achieved as per the schedule and if so, details thereof; and (b) if not, the details of steps taken/being taken by the Government to boost the generation of nuclear power and to achieve the target?

Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) the names of States where people are suffering from regional imbalance in the development activities; (b) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to identify the areas in those States which are lagging behind development; and (c) the steps taken to remove the regional imbalance and to pay equal attention so that all people get the benefit of development?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has fixed the percentage of households to be classified as priority households as per section 9 of NFSA, 2013; (b) if so, the State-wise percentage and actual number of families included in the priority list for rural as well as urban areas; (c) whether a large number of applications for inclusion in the priority list are pending in several States including Kerala and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government proposes to increase the percentage of households that can be included in the priority list in all the States and if not, the reasons therefor?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government intends to increase the number of consultative committee members of the Food Corporation of India (FCI) for each State and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is proposing to have one consultative committee member for every district of the country and if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Ministry proposes to have one FCI consultative committee member for every district in the 748 larger interest of the consumers and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government had called tenders for from private firms to operate private trains in India; (b) if so, the number of private firms which participated in the Rs. 30 crore private train tender; (c) whether the tender was scrapped, if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor; (d) whether it is true that there has been a lack of interest by private firm in running private trains, which could ultimately lead to less competition and higher prices; and (e) if so, the details in this regard?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the services provided by Adarsh Railway Stations; (b) the manner in which the category of development of stations is determined by the Railways; (c) the details and the number of Adarsh Stations in Uttar Pradesh; and (d) the details of the works completed under the Scheme for Meerut City Station?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of coach and locomotive manufacturing factories working/under construction in the country, State-wise; (b) whether the Government plans to open new coach locomotive manufacturing units in the country; and (c) if so, the details thereof, State-wise?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government provides foodgrains under National Food Security Act (NFSA); (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is likely to cover maize under Price Deficit Payment Scheme (PDPS); and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the number and details of Road Over Bridges (ROBs) and Under-passes sanctioned in the country, particularly in Uttar Pradesh including Lucknow, Barabanki to Gorakhpur and Kanpur, Prayagraj, Varanasi and Jaunpur railway route during the last three years and the current year; (b) the total number of ROBs and Under-passes where works are in progress under the railway routes of the Northern Railway; and (c) the steps taken to expedite the work on this project?

from: ['Reddy, Shri Adala Prabhakara', 'Reddy, Shri Pocha Brahmananda', 'Madhavi, Smt. Goddeti', 'Nallakonda Gari, Shri Reddeppa']
to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) the details of funds sanctioned under Consumer Welfare Fund (CWF); (b) the details of expenditure incurred out of the funds allocated; (c) whether the Government has devised any new plan to increase consumer literacy apart from JagoGrahakJago awareness campaign; and (d) if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES 749 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government agrees with the view that along with better forecasts, there is a need for better monitoring and reporting of actual rainfall, water levels in rivers and incidents of landslides; (b) if so, the steps proposed to be taken by the Government in this direction; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether as per the Governments policy, the old existing Catering Vending Licensed holdings of static units held by individuals/proprietorship firms were granted periodical renewals up till now; (b) if so, whether the said policy instructions are still in existence for grant of renewal of licenses; (c) whether the names of family members have been allowed to be added in the contracts of certain individuals/proprietorship so as to convert individuals into partnership firms, companies, HUF, Societies, etc.; and (d) if so, the details of such policy instructions as well as names of individuals/proprietorship, name of stations which allowed such conversion into partnership, companies, HUF and Societies since 2010 up till now?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that senior citizens are not getting benefits of Government schemes due to non-availability fingerprint and non-updation of address or other information in their Aadhaar cards and if so, the steps being taken by the Government in this regard; and (b) whether the complaints received in this regard have been redressed and the manner in which it has been redressed and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Suman, Dr. Alok Kumar', 'Patel, Shri R.K. Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of rural households that have been covered under Pradhan Mantri Gramin Digital Saksharta Abhiyaan in the State of Bihar; (b) whether the above said scheme includes Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Castes et., and if so, the details thereof; (c) the details about total households that have been covered under Pradhan Mantri Gramin Digital Saksharta Abhiyaan in the State of Bihar, particularly in the district Gopalganj; and (d) the details of the measures taken by the Ministry to cover households under Pradhan Mantri Gramin Digital Saksharta Abhiyaan in the State of Bihar, particularly in the district Gopalganj?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is seriously considering to give soft loans to the textile sector; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) the other concrete and effective steps taken by the Government in this regard?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) the quantum of paddy stored by the Government of Chhattisgarh in the Food Corporation of India and Central Pool during the last three years including the current year; (b) whether the Government has fixed the last date for the storage of paddy; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government of Chhattisgarh has requested to extend the date for storage of paddy; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) the decision taken by the Government in this regard? 750

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any policy to develop private freight terminals to handle private freights of an organization; (b) if so, the details of the requests received from the private players to develop such private freight terminals during the last three years; (c) whether the Ministry plans to develop any new Government owned dedicated freight terminals/extend the capacity of existing freight terminals in Uttar Pradesh; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the State/UT-wise details of the total nunber of cases of child abuse on the internet reported in the country during each of the last three years; and (b) whether the Government has taken any steps to ensure internet safety for children and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether any steps have been taken to promote farming of maize and set up a grain-based distillery for production of ethanol; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any plan has been formulated for setting up of strained rice production plants in the country particularly in Madhya Pradesh; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS . be pleased to state: (a) the number of India Post Payment Banks (IPPBs) established so far all over the country; (b) the State-wise list of number of people benefited from these IPPBs; (c) the number of new IPPBs planned to be set up in the coming financial year; (d) whether the Government proposes to provide some other facilities also in the said IPPB facility by expanding it; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) the status of implementation of Phase I and Phase II of the BharatNet project, State/UT-wise along with the number of Gram Panchayats covered so far, State/UT-wise including Saran, Bihar; (b) whether the Government has fixed a timeline by which all the Gram Panchayats will be provided with Broadband connectivity and if so, the details in this regard, State/UT-wise including for Saran, Bihar; (c) whether the BharatNet project has been severely delayed in meeting the targets under both Phase I and Phase II of the project and if so, the reasons thereof; (d) whether it is a fact that Government is implementing the scheme in 16 States via PPP model and if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of scheme implementation in the remaining States not covered under PPP mode for BharatNet?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to install mobile towers in Rajasthan including Jalore-Sirohi to address the issue of telecommunication connectivity; and (b) if so, the State-wise and district-wise number of mobile towers installed?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS 751 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to introduce a new train from Bhavnagar to Haridwar and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has received any proposals or suggestions from public representatives regarding running a new train on this route; and (c) if so, the details of action taken in this regard?

Will the Minister of MINES be pleased to state: (a) whether the import of minerals in the country has increased; (b) if so, the State and mineral-wise production of minerals in the country including Rajasthan during the last five years; (c) whether minerals are being imported in the country despite the availability of indigenous production capacity; (d) if so, the mineral-wise details thereof; and (e) the steps taken by the Government to increase the mining of minerals?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any steps to check the incidents of goods having gone missing while loading in freight trains at railway station particularly Wadsa railway station in Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether Railway Recruitment Board, Ranchi issued an advertisement for recruitment of more than 2200 vacancies for technicians in the year 2018; . (b) if so, whether despite fulfilling all the formalities, the candidates of South Eastern Railway are still awaiting a response in this regard; (c) if so, whether Railways has taken cognizance thereof along with the time by when the Railways proposes to recruit them; (d) whether around 180 candidates have not joined till date; (e) if so, whether there is any provision regarding recruiting candidates appearing in the waitlist and if so, the reasons for not recruiting these waitlisted candidates; (f) whether the Railways proposes to take any action in this regard; and (g) if so, the details in this regard?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether all the villages in the country including tribal areas of various States have been linked with the telecommunication facilities, particularly mobile telephone facilities and if so, the details of the number of such villages and tribal areas thereof, State/UT-wise; and (b) the targets fixed and achieved by the Government and action plan, for extension of if any, the telecommunication services across all the villages during each of the last three years, State/UT- wise?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the time by when the Ministry had assigned the work for preparation of DPR for Hyderabad-Pune-Mumbai High Speed Rail Corridor (Bullet Train); (b) the present status of the DPR and the time by when it is likely to be presented to the Railway Board; and (c) the details of timeframe by when the project is likely to be completed after approving the DPR?

Will the Minister of PARLIAMENTARY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the States that have adopted National e-Vidhan Application (NeVA) so far; (b) the status of implementation of NeVA in these States; (c) whether the digitisation initiative under NeVA will provide easy access to documents while bridging language barriers and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the digitisation initiative under NeVA also includes creating digital archives of previous documents and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether over 100 posts for diploma and degree apprentices are lying vacant at Chittaranjan Locomotive Works (CLW), Chittaranjan; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether in regard to vacancies in CLW, the proposal of the Government to absorb the trained certified railway apprentices under the railway rule (RBE No 113/2012) is pending for a long time; and (d) if so, the details in this regard?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to manufacture clothes or other products from Sisal fiber under Atmanirbhar Bharat so that the rural people may also be benefited; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the manner in which Sisal fiber is being used in the country so far; (d) whether the Government proposes to formulate any new scheme in this regard; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY . be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of premier institutions that have been set up in North East Region (NER) under the Technology Incubation and Development of Entrepreneurs (TIDE 2.0) programme; and (b) whether the Ministry has undertaken any development of such an institution in the State of Meghalaya and if so, the details of funds allocated and spent and the status of the project?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to promote design education and training in the State of Karnataka; (b) the steps taken by the Government to provide design intervention for handloom, craft, rural technology, small, medium enterprises and programmes for capability building and sustainable livelihood, employment opportunities and economic growth; (c) whether the Government has taken any steps to promote Karnatakas rich ancient design culture and practices; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Parliamentary Standing Committee submitted a report recommending review of various pending railway projects at regular intervals to expedite the evacuation of coal and if so, the details thereof; (b) the recommendations in the said report regarding Barwadih-Chirmiri Rail Line Project and Chatra-Gaya New Rail Line; (c) whether a coordination mechanism has been developed by the Ministry of Railways, Ministry of Coal and Joint Stakeholders for the said railway line projects; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (e) whether the Railways had written any letter to Coal India Limited regarding the aforesaid rail line projects; (f) if so, the dates on which Coal India Limited received letters from the Railways in this regard; and (g) whether Coal India Limited has sent any reply in this regard and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor? 753

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is planning to add new nuclear reactors in the near future to augment its present 7 GW total installed nuclear energy capacity; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has any plans of phasing out nuclear reactors in view of reports of many countries phasing out their nuclear power stations and in light of Indias net zero commitment at COP 26 and if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, whether the Government is planning to continue adding new nuclear reactors in the future?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has launched the PM Gati Shakti - National Master Plan (NMP) for multi-modal connectivity in the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government proposes to develop a GIS based ERP system in collaboration with Bhaskaracharya National Institute for Space Applications and Geo-informatics; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether this will enable all stakeholders for better evidence-based decision-making, administration and effective monitoring of the Master Plan on a periodic and real time basis; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the tenure of the recognized Railway Mazdoor Unions is over since April, 2019; (b) the reasons for delay in the election process of the said unions along with the time by when elections are likely to be held; (c) the manner in which the loss suffered due to delayed elections to union is likely to be compensated; (d) whether the railway administration has done away with the process of secret voting; (e) whether recognized unions are still being provided facilities even after their tenure has been over; and (f) if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any data of people under below poverty line in the country and if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise including Rajasthan along with the criteria fixed by the Government and trend of the population living below poverty line for the last ten years, State-wise; (b) whether the last official estimate of population below the poverty line was done in 2011-2012 and if so, the reasons for not updating the figure based on latest available data; (c) whether the population of poor has increased in size/ number, based on the poverty line established by the Tendulkar Committee and if so, the details thereof and if not, the supporting evidence thereof; (d) the steps taken or being taken by the Government to address the issue of poverty and upliftment of poor people of the country during the last five years; and (e) whether the consumer expenditure survey scheduled to be conducted in the year 2021 is likely to be undertaken and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons for delay in this regard?

topic: Review of Rationalisation of Autonomous Bodies
contents: Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) whether any review has been undertaken by the Government on the rationalistation of Autonomous Bodies under various Ministries and Departments under the Central Government; (b) whether the Government is planning to rationalise/ merge Commodity Boards as one entity and shift their headquarters from the major areas of production to a centralised location like Delhi and if so, provide the rationale behind the decision; (c) whether the Government has assessed the deleterious effects of this move on the lakhs of farmers from Kerala who are dependent on cultivation of commodities promoted by various commodity boards like Coconut Development Board, Rubber Board and Spice Board; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether a large part of the rural population is deprived of broadband/internet facility, if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor along with the number of villages provided with internet connectivity under the BharatNet project so far, State/UT-wise; (b) whether the Government has not been successful in achieving the target fixed for providing internet/broadband connectivity to villages and if so, the details thereof; and 754 (c) whether the Government has reviewed the broadband project design for rural areas and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether the services of Bharat Sanchar Nigam Ltd. remain disturbed in Jharkhand and Jammu & Kashmir and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has received complaints from the State Governments; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the response of the Government thereto?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that the Supreme Court has expressed concern over the origin and spread of fake messages on social media platforms like WhatsApp and Facebook which involves the sovereignty of the State, privacy of an individual and prevention of illegal activities and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has any plan in this regard and if so, the details of the steps being taken by the Government to trace the originator of fake messages at the same time and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) whether Scientific Assistants of all other Departments, like ISRO etc., except those in the India Meteorological Department are placed in Level 7 of pay Matrix; (b) if so, whether there is any proposal under consideration to place the Scientific Assistants of IMD in Level 7 of the Pay Matrix; (c) whether it is a fact that promotional prospects of Scientific Assistants of IMD is very poor; (d) if so, whether there is any proposal on the lines of other Departments to promote Scientific Assistants of IMD in a time bound manner; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor? .

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether due to audit objection by Supreme Audit Institutions the grade pay of retired employees of Textile Committee was reduced from 7600 to 6600 and also the Government recovered excess payment from pensioners to the tune of Rs 1.37 crores and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is aware that Honble Supreme Court has given a verdict on 5/3/2020 against such reduction in grade pay and recovery on the case filed by the pensioners and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether DoPT has already agreed on increasing the grade pay and return of the excess payment to the pensioners; and (d) if so, the reasons for Ministry of Textiles not implementing the order of Honble Supreme Court?

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) the number of youths who have been provided Government jobs in various Government Departments by the Government during the last five years; (b) whether the number of educated unemployed is increasing continuously as regular recruitment for Government jobs is not being done; (c) whether lakhs of applications are being received for small number of vacancies or posts and the number of those with qualifications much higher than the standard qualifications is very huge and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether most of the appointments which go through the court process and get stuck in the courts for years and this also obstructs the appointments within stipulated time; and (e) the State-wise number of educated unemployed in the country?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a)whether it is true that frequently the contractors are being changed in MTNL and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the contractors are providing prompt services and if so, the details thereof; 755 (c) whether the services of MTNL is drastically deteriorating day by day and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether any fresh recruitment is carried out in MTNL in Mumbai and Delhi; and (e) if not, whether there are any such plans of recruitment in future?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the recruitments advertised by the Railway Recruitment Boards (RRBs) along with the category of recruitments and the personnel/officers who have been selected and appointed through the said recruitments during the last five years, year/number/ designation-wise; (b) whether various categories of posts created at present in the railways will be effected due to the privatization done/being done in different areas of operations since new recruitments are not likely to be done; (c) if so, the details of the posts so affected presently and likely to be affected in the coming years; and (d) the details of the pending recruitments of RRBs and the reasons for the pendency?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether increase in railway facilities, development and beautification of railway stations, etc. have taken place on a large scale across the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the developmental works carried out at Lohardaga railway station?

Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) the percentage increase in lightning strikes each year since 2018; (b) whether an inquiry has been conducted regarding a possible correlation between increase in lightning strikes and climate change; . (c) if so, the findings thereof; and (d) the action taken by the Government in this regard?
