Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether there has been any initiative to improve and develop handloom sector, where over 50,000 weavers have been affected due to Covid-19 lockdown in entire North Eastern Region (NER); (b) if so, whether the Government is working on any measures for providing financial help to these handloom workers; (c) whether the Government is providing any relaxation in GST on various materials used in the cottage industry; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken to make the Public Distribution System effective; (b) the interval at which the survey of eligible consumers under the said system is done; (c) the process of adding names to the eligibility list; and (d) whether priority to the eligible persons belonging to Scheduled Castes/Scheduled Tribes is accorded while giving ration under the said system and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the date on which the foundation was laid for the new railway project of Bihariganj-Kursela; (b) the length of the said railway line; (c) the amount released for the said ambitious railway project so far; and (d) the reasons for delay in its implementation? 756

from: ['Kaushik, Shri Ramesh Chander', 'Mahato, Shri Jyotirmay Singh']
contents: Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether the objective of the Government is to realize true potential of a district, fuel economic growth and generate employment and rural entrepreneurship under One District One Product (ODOP); (b) if so, the details of the districts identified in this regard in West Bengal, Haryana and other States; (c) the details of the criteria or guidelines to select districts under the said scheme; (d) the details of the special benefits being provided to the identified district by the Government; (e) whether Purulia district of West Bengal has been selected under the said scheme and if not, the reasons therefor; and (f) whether Purulia district can be selected under the said scheme in the future and if so, the details thereof as on date?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken adequate steps to implement 5G technology across the country; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the time by when it is likely to be done; and (c) whether the Government proposes to provide modern communication services in all parts of the country including rural and tribal areas of Santhal Pargana of Jharkhand and if so, the details thereof?

topic: SC/ST Employees in Central Government/ Departments
contents: Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that SCs/STs are underrepresented in the Central Government and its PSUs; (b) if so, the details thereof detailing the representation of SCs/STs from Group B to Secretary level in comparison to the general/unreserved category in the Central Government, post-wise and category- wise; . (c) the details of representation of SCs/STs in the PSUs under the Central Government; and (d) the reasons for underrepresentation of such Groups and the steps taken/being taken by the Government to bridge the gap?
Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state the number of incidents of burglary, theft, chain snatching, etc. of passengers that occurred since 2014, years-wise?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) the share of India in global food grains market as on date; (b) whether the Government is not prepared to deal with the competition in the global market due to declining export of foodgrains; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the steps being taken by the Government to make India competitive in the global market under open market policy of World Trade Organisation?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is considering to operate Rajdhani Express and Shatabdi Express from Bhagalpur (Bihar) railway station; (b) if so, the time by when is it likely to be run and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether it is being considered to operate some more train services from district Bhagalpur (Bihar) in the coming days in view of the population/business activities, etc.; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY 757 be pleased to state: (a) whether any trade facilitation programme or incentives are provided to importers/exporters with regard to customs and excise duty in the country; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the series of suicides in Telangana due to mounting debt created by online Rummy games and if so, the details of the action taken thereon; and (b) whether the Government is considering completely banning online gambling or partially regulating it and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether there exists a plethora of opportunities in the wood based industry in the country if so, the details thereof; (b) whether wood based industries have not been setup in commensurate with the production of wood in the country; and (c) if so, the response of the Government thereto?

topic: Vande Bharat Express to New Delhi
contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry has received any proposal to operate Vande Bharat Express from Gorakhpur to New Delhi; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the time by when operation of the said train is likely to commence?

Will the Minister of MINES be pleased to state: (a) the manner in which regional and detailed exploration projects for minerals are initiated under National Mineral Exploration Trust (NMET); . (b) the details of name/phase-wise list of projects, minerals and total estimated cost of these projects; (c) the manner in which the date of submission of project report, the names of concerned mineral blocks to be auctioned and the date of auction is intimated to/by the State Government; (d) the year-wise total number of major mineral blocks kept in auction for mining lease and prospecting licence-cum-mining along with the total number of successful auctions since the year 2015; and (e) the year-wise total number of major mineral blocks given for mining lease and prospecting licence before the auction system from the year 2010 to 2014 as per the records of Indian Bureau of Mines?

Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) whether the Coal India Limited (CIL) and its subsidiary companies are facing problems in land acquisition for new coal mine project and expansion project; (b) if so, the details of the obstacles being faced by CIL and its subsidiary companies in land acquisition; (c) whether there is a demand for a suitable amendment in the Coal Bearing Areas (Acquisition and Development) Act, 1957 with regard to land acquisition; (d) if so, whether the Government has taken a decision to carry out an amendment in the Coal Bearing Areas (Acquisition and Development) Act, 1957 to make it suitable and relevant; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to extend the long distance trains which run to darbhanga junction of Samastipur railway division upto Jaynagar junction in view of the rail facilities; (b) if so, the names of the long distance trains proposed to be included in it; and (c) the time by when it is likely to be implemented?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS 758 be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to introduce more Vande Bharat Trains in the country; and (b) if so, the details thereof along with the names of routes for running of Vande Bharat Trains?

Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that since 2017 after the 12th Five Year Plan, Niti Aayog has stopped framing of five year broad way plan for transparent and objective mechanism of development of the Government; and (b) if so, whether the Government has received the 12th Five Year Report (2012-2017) from the then Planning Commission and if so, the details thereof; along with the reasons to stop the framework and the outline plan for overall development of the country?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) the total number of Post Offices in the country at present which do not have their own buildings along with the State/UT-wise details thereof including Rajasthan; (b) whether the Central Government has taken any steps to construct buildings for the Post Offices set up across the country; and (c) if so, the details thereof?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether infrastructure needed for post-harvest storage is highly inadequate in various States of the Country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of financial loss incurred due to non- availability of post-harvest storage facilities for crops by the farmers in various parts of the country in the lost three years; (d) the additional measures taken by the Government to further develop the post-harvest infrastructure in order to minimize the loss incurred on an annual basis; . (e) whether the Minister would consider a Private Public Partnership (PPP) venture in order to develop the post-harvest infrastructure to take care of the loss in its absence; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Shrangare, Shri Sudhakar Tukaram', 'Naik Nimbalkar, Shri Ranjeetsingh']
contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the present status of the construction of coach factory in Latur, Maharashtra; (b) the targeted date for the completion of the construction work and beginning of production in the said factory along with the reasons for the delay in this regard; (c) whether the Government has received requests for setting up of a coach factory in Madha Parliamentary Constituency; (d) if so, the steps taken by the Government in this regard; and (e) the steps taken by the Government to ensure production of coaches from Latur coach factory at the earliest?

topic: Volatility in Cotton and Yarn Prices
contents: Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted an analysis of the situation of apparel manufacturers and/or held consultations with stakeholders about the impact of cotton and yarn price volatility and its impact on the prices of fabrics and garments, and if so, the details thereof; (b) the steps being taken to support MSME textile manufacturing units that are still recovering from the impact of the COVID 19 pandemic; (c) whether the Government is considering the removal of 11 per cent import duty levied on cotton and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government is considering the revamp of the commercial terms and conditions prescribed by the Cotton Corporation of India (CCI) for e-auction of cotton by reducing the minimum lot size to 500 bales which is sustainable for the MSMEs and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the Government will extend the 5% interest subvention to the spinning mills towards procurement of cotton during peak season and if so, the details thereof? 759

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government is providing assistance for setting up of handicraft complexes/ showrooms in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof indicating the places where these complexes/showrooms have been set up during each of the last three years including the current year, location-wise and State/UT-wise; including Lucknow and barabanki of Uttar Pardesh; (c) the details of the other places where new complexes/showrooms are proposed to be set up, State/ UT-wise including Uttar Pradesh; (d) whether a number of complexes/showrooms running on loans or assistance from Handicraft Board have since closed down and specially in Uttar Pradesh; and (e) if so,the details thereof and the remedial steps taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether any step has been taken by the Government to make people aware of the traders manipulating the rates and doing hoarding in order to get undue profit; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any permission for affecting the fixation of price for cotton bales has been accorded to; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether it is necessary for the betterment of businessmen as well as economy to streamline retail trade and maintain ease of doing business in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof and the reaction of the Government thereto; (c) whether the Government has formulated/proposes to formulate a National Retail Policy in this regard; and (d) if not, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether a new field survey has been taken up on the railway line between Dornakal and Miryalaguda, connecting Nelakondapalli, Kodad, Huzurnagar and Neraducharla; (b) if so, the details thereof and the status of the survey so far; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; (d) the timeline for completion of the survey and work on the railway line alignment; and (e) the details of the funds allocated, disbursed and utilized so far for this project?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether there is any proposal to set up Railway Ticket Reservation counters in such areas where rail reservation facilities are not available; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Ministry is considering any proposal to establish Railway Ticket Booking Counters in Jwalamukhi, one of the aspirational districts of Himachal Pradesh, the headquarters of Chamba and one of the famous 52 Shakti Peeths of the country; and (d) if so, the details and action taken in this regard?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of the salient features of Digital Gram Yojana; (b) the district-wise details of the funds sanctioned, allocated and utilized under the above said scheme so far in the State of Maharashtra, particularly in Osmanabad Parliamentary Constituency; (c) the details of the number of villages and districts covered under the above said scheme in the State of Maharashtra so far; (d) the details of the villages identified under the above said scheme in Osmanabad district of Maharashtra so far; (e) the details of the target fixed under the above said scheme and the achievements made so far; and (f) whether the Government proposes to cover more number of villages under the above said scheme and if so, the time by which the said villages are likely to be covered? 760

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any statistics regarding subsidy given to the rubber growers in the country; (b) if so, the details of subsidy provided to the rubber growers in the country during the last ten years, year/State-wise along with the number of beneficiaries; (c) whether the Government has stopped/ discontinued subsidy for rubber growers; (d) if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor; (e) whether the Government has any plans to restart the subsidy for rubber farmers; and (f) if so, the details thereof and the steps taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) the main features of Shakti scheme including the present status of its implementation in the country along with the eligibility under the said scheme at present; and (b) the details of names of the States which are eligible under the said scheme at present?

from: ['Borlakunta, Shri Venkatesh Netha', 'Reddy, Dr. Gaddam Ranjith', 'Pasunoori, Shri Dayakar', 'Maloth, Smt. Kavitha']
contents: Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) the details of formula adopted to calculate royalty to be paid to States on coal; (b) the time by when the above formula was adopted and details of its revision along with the details of last revision; (c) the details of royalty to be paid to Telangana during the last ten years, year-wise; (d) whether any royalty is pending for payment to Telangana and if so, the details thereof; and (e) the time by which the pending dues are likely to be cleared? .
party: ['Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

contents: Will the Minister of EARTH SCIENCES be pleased to state: (a) the details of the amount of rare earth reserves India possesses and the installed mining, production and processing capacity; (b) whether the Government is aware of the global supply chain constraints leading to global shortages of rare earths and thereby to Microprocessor chips; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has assessed its impact on Indian markets and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government is aware of the fact that China is one of the leading producers of rare earths controlling 90% of the total global production; (f) whether despite possessing one of the largest rare earth reserves, India imports most of its rare earth requirements from China; (g) if so, the details of rare earth imports in the last five years, country-wise, element/compound-wise, including both weight and cost; and (h) the steps being taken by the Government to make India a leading rare earth producer?

Will the Minister of SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is implementing several schemes regarding innovation; (b) if so, whether by taking advantage of the said schemes, the school children of remote areas are being successful in finding innovative solutions to day-to-day problems; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the details of the solutions presented by the school children under the said Government schemes regarding innovation and the recognition given to these solutions in various States of the country, including Uttar Pradesh, during the last three years?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that the Railways share in freight transportation in India is a mere 18% and if so, the details thereof; 761 (b) whether the Railways has taken steps towards increasing axle loads and train length enabling trains to move faster to increase its share in freight transport and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Railways has plans for developing specialised heavy-haul corridors; (d) if so, the current status of the construction of the six proposed dedicated freight corridors; (e) whether the Railways plans to upgrade its corridors to incorporate intermodal (rail and road) transport; (f) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (g) whether the contribution envisioned by the Railways to Indias net-zero targets?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether the National Startup Advisory Council has delivered or is delivering on its mandate, sufficiently enough or as intended; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of COMMUNICATIONS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has identified the reasons for the failure of BSNL and MTNL to increase their market share as compared to their private counterparts despite having large infrastructure, particularly in the urban areas and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government is considering the restructuring of BSNL and MTNL to make there competitive and profitable and if so, the plan prepared by the Government in this regard and the time line of its implementation; and (c) the details of losses of BSNL & MTNL during the last three years, along with outstanding debt and the State-wise book value of their physical infrastructure?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of new railway projects that were announced for Jharkhand during the last three years including Hazaribagh and Ramgarh, District-wise; (b) the number of projects, out of these, commissioned so far and the budgetary allocations made for the same; (c) the status of those projects which have not been commissioned and the time by when these would be commissioned; (d) the number of new trains announced and commissioned during the last three years which originate from Hazaribagh and Ramgarh district of Jharkhand along with the details thereof; (e) the number of new railway tracks laid or being laid in Jharkhand with special reference to Parasnath , Giridih, Bokaro and Dhanbad region during the said period along with the details of their progress; and (f) the percentage of railway lines that has been electrified in Jharkhand, especially in the Hazaribagh and Ramgarh districts?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds allocated for the development of Railways in the country during the financial year 2020-21; (b) the amount of funds released and expended till date, State/UT-wise; and (c) the future initiatives envisaged in this regard?

topic: Delay in filling up the Vacant Posts
contents: Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Railways has been following the recommendations made by the 5th Pay Commission wherein with a view to reduce delay in filling up of posts, vacancies resulting from resignation or death of an incumbent within one year of its appointment should be filled immediately from the reserve list; (b) if so, whether the same has been adopted by DoPT vide their OM No 41019/18/97-Estt (b) dated 13.06.2000; (c) if so the details of the appointments made during the last three years by the various zones of the Railways; (d) whether the Railways is aware that Zonal office of NER at Gorakhpur has not filled the vacant post against the advertisement No CEN01/2018 of Assistant Locopilot till date; and (e) if so, the reasons therefor? 762

topic: Cases of Cheating in Kendriya Bhandar
contents: Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether some vendors of Kendriya Bhandar have cheated and caused pecuniary loss to Kendriya Bhandar as stated by the OSD(vigilance) in the Office Order No.KB/5/2020-Vig (Mis-3) dated 6.3.2020; (b) if so, the details thereof and modus-operandi adopted by the said vendors of Kendriya Bhandar; (c) whether the said vendors who have cheated Kendriya Bhandar have been identified and if so, the details thereof and the action taken against them; (d) whether the vendor involved in cheating Kendriya Bhandar are still doing business with Kendriya Bhandar and they visit Kendriya Bhandars head office daily and are in constant touch with the management of Kendriya Bhandar; (e) whether the Secretary(Personnel) CWO and CVO Kendriya Bhandar have received complaints about the said fraud happened in Kendriya Bhandar from the Member(s) of Kendriya Bhandar and Member(s) of Parliament via e-mail and dak and if so, the details thereof and the action taken thereon; (f) whether the office of CWO asked CVO Kendriya Bhandar to take appropriate action in the matter vide letter No.13/1/2019-Welfare dated 28.6.2021 and if so, the details of action taken by CVO Kendriya Bhandar in this matter; and (g) whether the management of Kendriya Bhandar in collusion with the CVO Kendriya Bhandar and dishonest vendors have destroyed the forged and tempered store issue notes and if so, the details thereof?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) the percentage of food grain offtake out of total allocated under the Atmanirbhar Bharat Package (ANBP), State-wise, since inception till date; (b) the number of targeted beneficiaries for food grain distribution and the actual number of beneficiaries under ANBP, State-wise, since inception till date; (c) the percentage of food grain distributed out of total offtake under ANBP, State-wise, since inception till date; (d) the manner in which the Ministry is identifying beneficiaries and ensuring appropriate allocations; and (e) the details of the current buffer stock of major pulses as on date? .

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has the details of projects monitored under the Pragati Project; (b) if so, the State/UT-wise details thereof; (c) whether the Government has the details of projects being monitored in the State of Kerala under the above scheme; and (d) if so, the details and the status of the above projects?

Will the Minister of RAILWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Railways has decided to upgrade/ modernize Bareilly railway station of Uttar Pradesh and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the work of up-gradation of Bareilly railway station has since been partially completed, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the work of high-level platform, waiting room, lift, escalator, shading of platform, ramp, etc. have been completed at this station; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) whether any timeline has been set by the Government for the said up-gradation work and if so, the details thereof; and (f) the amount that has been spent so far for the above said work?

Will the Minister of PLANNING be pleased to state: (a) the details of the role entrusted to the public representatives in regard to laying the foundation, inauguration, inspection and other matters pertaining to the schemes being run by the Union Government; (b) whether the local administration/executive agencies in some States do not invite the local Member of Parliament for inspection of schemes, foundation laying and inauguration and other functions and if so, the reasons therefor; 763 (c) whether the Government has taken cognizance thereof and if so, the steps taken by the Government in this regard; and (d) the details of the steps taken by the Government to widen the role of public representatives in such schemes?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) the details of the total number of consumer courts in the country including courts in Bihar; (b) whether the Government has been appraised by the State Governments, regarding the total number of vacancies in consumer dispute panels and the total cases pending in consumer courts; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government plans to find alternate dispute resolution mechanisms for consumer courts; and (e) if so, the details thereof and the proposed time by which the Government aims to have such mechanisms in place?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government plans to undertake environmental assessment for production of surplus sugarcane for fuel-grade ethanol production and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the current rate of incentives of monthly release quota for sugarcane leads to over-consumption of supplies; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry is aware of the revelations made about practices adopted by facebook by Frances Haughen and Sophie Zhang and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether propose to take Ministry has take or based on the revelations and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons thereof; (c) whether any legal opinion has been sought on the revelations made and its impact on the Indian users, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) whether there are any active proposals to amend the Information Technology Act, 2000 in light of the revelations made and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) the details of the total amount due to the exporters claim under the erstwhile Merchandise Export from India Scheme, Service Exports from India Scheme as well as Rebate of State and Central Taxes and Levies(RoSCTL) Scheme for levies and duties; (b) the time by when the Government will release the amount due to exporters along with the amount to be released with break-up figures of sub-category; (c) the details of amount to be released to MSME sector; (d) whether the Government has conducted any study regarding the units that went on liquidation due to non-release of funds especially pertaining to MSME sector and the reasons for the delay and if so, the details thereof; (e) the reasons as to why the Government is unable to fix a mandatory period for releasing dues to the exporters in future to cog the working capital of small and medium scale industries; and (f) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

to: CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
contents: Will the Minister of CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken note of that online food delivery sites are reportedly supplying adulterated cooked food; (b) if so, the details of the steps taken by Government for the modernization of the food testing central laboratories; (c) whether the Government has been conducting awareness programmes on cooked food and adulteration of spices; and (d) if so, the details thereof? 764

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of semiconductor sales trend in India for the last four years; (b) whether there is shortage of semiconductor chip in India and if so, the reason therefor; (c) the details of the data depicting the estimates of export and import of semiconductors for the last four years and details of the present market size of semiconductor manufacturing and sales industry; and (d) the details of the steps taken by the Government to boost semiconductor manufacturing in India?

Will the Minister of ELECTRONICS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to work on any scheme for the completion of process of identification through smart phones of the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) users and if so, the other useful ways which could be done apart from the identification through smart phones of UIDAI users and the details thereof; and (b) the details of the timeline by which this action plan of identification through smart phones of the UIDAI users is likely to be implemented?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether Mauaima and Meza spinning mills of Prayagraj are closed since years and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government propose to revive the said mills; (c) if so, the time by which these are likely to be revived and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the said mills are likely to be included under the schemes being run for the welfare of weavers in Uttar Pradesh; and (e) if so, the time by which these are likely to be included and if not, the detailed reasons therefor? .

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) the details of the quantum of work, efforts and financial assistance that the Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) has spent on exporting perishable and processed exports from Sri Guru Ram Dass Jee International Airport, Amritsar; (b) whether APEDA has planned for any special schemes, incentives and pilot projects to facilitate export of produce of marginal farmers of Majha region of Punjab during the last years; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of TEXTILES be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken special measures to improve the condition of the textile industry in the economically backward region of Bundelkhand; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the employment opportunities being provided by the textile industry to the country including Bundelkhand?

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether concrete measures have been taken to improve the situation of ease of doing business in the country as a result of which improvement has been noticed in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government along with the States/ Union Territories has taken any concrete steps to resolve the commercial issues pending in courts; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government is preparing any concrete policy to reduce the requirement of licensing, regulatory sanctions and to streamline the process of renewal; and (f) if so, the details thereof? 765

Will the Minister of COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to introduce programmes to overcome the challenges in e-commerce in the country; (b) if so, the details of the action taken thereon along with the major challenges identified and the details of the plan formulated; (c) the initiatives of the Government for creating awareness among the people for knowledge and market research; (d) whether the Government has conducted any study on the impact of import of goods from China and its sale online and if so, its effect on Indian industry; (e) the action taken by the Government for ensuring the return and cancellation in e-commerce by protecting the right of consumers and seller; and (f) the action taken by the Government for promotion of e-commerce?

Will the PRIME MINISTER be pleased to state: (a) whether any officer of Senior Administrative Grade (SAG) has been appointed on ad-hoc basis/ appointed as OSD for the execution of duties under the post of Higher Administrative Grade (HAG) and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the said officer has to get prior permission from DOPT through the Ministry in order to continue performing the duties of HAG post in the form of OSD/ad-hoc basis after the completion of more than 12 months from the date of appointment; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the number of officers who have taken permission from DOPT through the Ministry so far? NEW DELHI; December 16, 2021 Agrahayana 25, 1943 (Saka) .

from: ['Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.', 'Karadi, Shri Sanganna Amarappa', 'Raghavendra, Shri B. Y.']
contents: Will the Minister of STATISTICS AND PROGRAMME IMPLEMENTATION be pleased to state: (a) the contribution of the primary sectors including agricultural sector towards Indias GDP during the last three years, sector/State/year-wise; (b) whether the Government has any plans to improve the growth of the primary sectors in the country; (c) if so, the steps taken by the Government in this regard; and (d) the details of the funds earmarked and spent during the last three years for the same, year-wise?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of COAL be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that reservation provided to OBC category in All India level direct recruitment on Group C and Group D posts in South Eastern Coal Field Ltd., Mahanadi Coal Field Ltd., Bharat Coking Coal Ltd. and Northern Coal Field Ltd. is 6%, 12%, 12% and 13 percent respectively instead of the prescribed 27 percent reservation; (b) whether there is any constitutional provision to make direct recruitment of Group C and Group D posts of Government of India on regional level instead of all India level and if so, the details thereof; and (c) total percentage of reservation reduced from the prescribed 27 percent reservation for OBCs in the direct recruitment of Group C and Group D posts in the CPSEs located in various States under the Ministry of Coal during the year 1993 to 2021? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to implement Swachh Technology Challenge under Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban (SBM-U) in the country and if so, the details thereof along with aims, objectives and various components of the said programme; (b) whether the Government is aware of issues concerning waste management in the country; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the funds allocated to manage and implement state of the art solutions for waste management and recycling?

from: ['Nallakonda Gari, Shri Reddeppa', 'Reddy, Shri Pocha Brahmananda']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that it is difficult for State Governments to bear the huge cost of development of basic infrastructure in greenfield colonies as envisaged in the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) Urban and Gramin; (b) whether the Government proposes to incorporate the creation of basic infrastructure in greenfield colonies as a part of assistance given to State Governments under PMAY; and (c) if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details and the number of toll booths being operated by private operators on National Highways in the country including Tamil Nadu indicating their contract period; (b) whether the Government is aware that some of these toll booths are being operated beyond their contract period; (c) if so, the details thereof along with the reasons therefor; and (d) the action taken/being taken by the Government against such toll booth operators?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether any proposals to upgrade some State Highways in Odisha have been pending with the Union Government for a long time; (b) if so, the details and the present status thereof; (c) the details of such proposals in respect of the State sanctioned during each of the last three years; and (d) the allocation of funds made for these projects?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is implementing Street Lighting National Programme (SLNP) and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has set any target to replace conventional street lights in the country under SLNP and if so, the steps taken by the Government to achieve the target; (c) the details of financial allocation made for this programme during the last three years; and (d) the other steps taken by the Government to replace conventional street lights with smart and energy efficient Light Emitting Diode (LED) lights in a time bound manner? 94

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set a target to increase the percentage of natural gas in the countrys total energy mix; (b) if so, the details thereof and the steps taken in pursuance of the same; and (c) the details regarding addition and upgradation of natural gas infrastructure since 2018?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the country has entered into any agreement on the Renewable Purchase Obligation with regard to consumers of power generated from clean energy sources; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to establish an international airport at Palakkad in Kerala and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has received any request in this regard and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether many districts of Kerala and Tamil Nadu will be benefitted by establishment of the said airport at Palakkad; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Surya, Shri L.S. Tejasvi', 'Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.']
contents: Will the Minister of MICRO,SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether street vendors are now a separate category under MSMEs and if so, since when and the benefits of such a categorisation; (b) the estimated number of street vendors in the country and specifically in the State of Karnataka; (c) the details of the survey/study or registration process done to arrive at the number of street vendors in the country; (d) the number of street vendors to be benefitted by their categorisation as MSMEs; and (e) whether there is any proposal to include more categories of street vendors under the MSME fold and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether MSMEs are facing problems of marketing and liquidity due to COVID pandemic; (b) the extent to which Rupees three lakh crore package under Atmanirbhar Bharat helped this sector; (c) the status of disbursement of above package, State-wise; (d) the manner in which the Government is facilitating marketing of MSME products; (e) whether the direction to clear all dues to MSMEs has not been implemented and still Rs.6,900 crores are due to MSME sector and if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor; (f) the details of the dues to be paid by private sector to MSMEs; and (g) the details of e-market linkages that the Government has for MSME sector?

topic: Control of Covid in Smart Cities
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether smart cities exhibited better performance than other cities in preventing spread of corona virus and managing available facilities during the Covid-19 pandemic lockdowns; (b) if so, the statistical information of a comparative study on all cities with area, population, number of daily cases, modes of transportation into city and daily footfall; (c) whether the citizens living in smart cities are getting daily updates on availability of medical facilities with pre-booking emergency medical support facility 95 (with medical reports) while recording highest number of cases and if so, the details thereof along with the facilities available to frontline workers; (d) whether there is any proposal to establish food, vegetables cultivation clusters in smart cities as a food supply chain as a part of preparedness for the completely cut off connectivity in future worst cases depending on the war rooms and other initiatives; and (e) if so, the cities where it is being implemented and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken to strengthen and increase the revenues of Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) in the country, State-wise including Maharashtra and results yielded so far during the last five years, year-wise; (b) the provisions the Government proposes to make to improve existing property tax collection system; (c) whether ULBs have become mainly dependent on property tax collection and if so, the schemes implemented by the Government to reduce this dependency; and (d) the measures taken/proposed to be taken to enhance the efficiency of ULBs to provide better quality of services, facilities and infrastructure to the citizens?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether National Highway (NH) No. 80 from Bhagalpur to Mirza Chowki is likely to be completed on time, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (b) the total estimated cost of the project and the extent to which the said cost is likely to increase due to delay, if any; (c) whether there are any hurdles since the start of tender process for the project; (d) if so, whether these hurdles have been removed; and (e) whether the Union Government has received some representations in this regard from the State Government or through public representatives and if so, the details thereof along with the action taken thereon?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the total number of inter-State connectivity projects amongst the States of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Delhi and other neighbouring States which are lying incomplete at present; (b) the time frame by which the said projects are likely to be completed; (c) whether the Union Government has provided financial assistance to the State Governments for the construction of inter-State bridges and roads which are important from economic perspectives during each of the last three years and the current year and if so, the details thereof, State-wise; and (d) the names of the States which are proposed to be provided financial assistance in this regard during the current year?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has approved the third round of privatisation of airports owned by the Airport Authority of India (AAI) and if so, the details thereof; (b) the present status of the privatisation of airports approved by the Union Government last year including Thiruvananthapuram airport; (c) Whether the Government has taken a decision for clubbing a profitable airport with a loss-making airport for the sale process; and (d) If so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the details and the number of cities in the country having Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) service, State/UT-wise; (b) whether the Government is considering to connect remaining cities of the country including cities in West Bengal and bordering States of the country with CNG service and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is taking steps for promotion of green gas such as CNG in the country; 96 (d) whether the Government is considering alternate/ other green fuels in the wake of inflating diesel prices and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the Government has any plan to set up a CNG pump in Bishnupur Lok Sabha constituency and if so, the details of the plan and policy?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government has received any proposal from the Government of Odisha for minor and major irrigation projects in Bargarh and Jharsuguda (Bargarh Parliamentary Constituency) which have huge potential for providing irrigation facility to the farmers; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) if not, whether any proposal to initiate small and medium irrigation projects which can be constructed without any displacement, is in pipeline for mitigating the drought situation in the aforesaid area of low rainfall and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Union Government has taken any initiative to construct embankments on rivers like Mahanadi, Jira, Ib, Bheden and other rivers in Bargarh and Jharsuguda districts to arrest flood situation during monsoon and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Survey of Waterlogged Areas in Rajasthan
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted any survey of waterlogged areas in Rajasthan and if so, the details thereof, district-wise including the number of such areas in Dausa district; (b) whether the Government has made any plan to solve the waterlogging problem in areas identified in Dausa district at the earliest and if so, the details thereof; (c) the funds sanctioned and utilised by the Government in this regard during the last three years and the current year; (d) whether the Government has set any target in this regard and if so, the details thereof; and NEW DELHI; December 17, 2021 Agrahayana 26, 1943 (Saka) . (e) the steps being taken by the Government to achieve the said target at the earliest?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has set any target to provide electricity to every household in the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) the details of the schemes being implemented in this regard, particularly in Parbhani Parliamentary Constituency of Maharashtra along with the implementation status thereof; (c) the funds spent for the said purpose during the last three years; (d) the number of households which have been provided electricity along with those not electrified in the country particularly in Yavatmal-Washim Parliamentary Constituency till date, State-wise; (e) the reasons for not completing the electrification work of the remaining households and the time by which the said work is likely to be completed; (f) the steps being taken by the Government for completion of the said work in a time bound manner; and (g) whether any time limit has been fixed in this regard and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Darbar, Shri Chhatar Singh', 'Vasava, Shri Mansukhbhai Dhanjibhai']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any details with regard to the ratio of population increase in urban and rural areas during the last three years; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise; and (c) the details of sanitation, clean drinking water and other basic facilities being provided to them? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the names of districts and towns included under Multi-sectoral Development Programme (MsDP) for the welfare of minorities across the country, especially in Maharashtra; (b) the areas included by the Government under MsDP in Mumbai; (c) whether the Government has taken or proposes to take effective steps to open educational institutes, ITIs and skill development centers for the upliftment of children in Muslim dominated areas in Mumbai; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Supply of Electricity through Renewable Energy at Major Ports
from: ['Kachhadiya, Shri Naranbhai Bhikhabhai', 'Patel, Shri Parbatbhai Savabhai']
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the supply of renewable energy has been enhanced to meet the demand for electricity at the major ports across the country; and (b) if so, the details of the major ports across the country in this regard, State-wise including Gujarat?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has entered into agreement with any country to ensure and promote . energy security particularly in the field of non-renewable energy sector; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has formulated any plan in recent times for cleaning of Yamuna river; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is boosting green hydrogen, if so, the details thereof including the steps being taken and results yielded till date; (b) whether hydrogen is the most promising solution to decarbonise sectors like cement, steel and refineries; and (c) if so, the details and present status thereof?

from: ['Sridhar, Shri Kotagiri', 'Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun', 'Satyanarayana, Shri M V V', 'Reddy, Shri Magunta Sreenivasulu', 'Gurumoorthy, Shri Maddila']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: 768 (a) the status of performance-based challenge fund allocated for incubation of new cities as recommended by 15th Finance Commission; (b) whether the grant of Rs 8,000 crore for eight new cities has been awarded to the proposed States; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the antibiotic pollution of the Sirsa river by pharmaceutical manfacturing units located in the town of Baddi in Himachal Pradesh which affects Punjab since Sirsa joins Sutluj; and (b) if so, whether the Government proposes to take any action in this regard?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the cities in Tamil Nadu apart form Chennai being considererd by the Union Government for implementation of the metro rail projects; (b) the current status of the project to set up a metro rail in Madurai; (c) whether the Government proposes for constuction of a metro rail line in Coimbatore and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has taken any steps to approve the light metro projects in Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode in Kerala and if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, whether the Government would consider doing the same in a time bound manner and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) the details including the capacity of all Power projects undertaken by the Union Government in West Bengal; . (b) the details of State-wise distribution of power generated by the projects situated in West Bengal; (c) the status of the proposed green power corridor in West Bengal; and (d) the status and implementation of the inter-State transmission scheme in West Bengal?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details of various schemes launched for the progress of Micro Small and Medium Enterprises in various States including West Bengal during the last five years; (b) whether any new scheme is proposed to be introduced in near future; and (c) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the name of Indian cities among the top ten most traffic congested cities of the world as per the latest report on global traffic congestion; (b) the details of remedial steps taken by the Government in this regard; (c) whether the Government is aware of heavy traffic congestion on National Highways in cities of West Bengal and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has any plan to decongest traffic on NHs passing through the cities in West Bengal; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) the details of the proposed schemes by the Government to explore the bio-energy potential in the country; 769 (b) the status of power generated from the said energy sources, State/UT-wise; (c) whether bio-energy plants are working/operating in rural areas of the country and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government proposes to increase the number of bio-gas plants in the country; (e) whether any scheme is being implemented to set up bio-gas plants in the house of each farmer of the country or at the village level; and (f) if so, the details thereof, State-wise?

from: ['Thirunavukkarasar, Shri Su.', 'Singh, Shri Ravneet', 'Vijayakumar (Alias) Vijay Vasanth , Shri', 'Suresh, Shri Doddaalahalli Kempegowda']
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that the Government has recently launched a River Cities Alliance (RCA), a platform for river cities in the country; (b) if so, the details and the objectives thereof along with the details of cities which are a part of this alliance; (c) whether the Government has fixed any criteria for selection of cities to be part of the RCA and proposes to add more cities in future in this platform, if so, the details thereof and the time by which it is likely to be implemented; (d) whether the Government is taking any other measures to ensure better coordination among States towards river water management and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the RCA would help in promotion of river management and its conservation and if so, the details thereof; and (f) the details of the pending inter-State water disputes in the country, State/UT-wise?
party: ['Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress', 'Indian National Congress']

topic: Proposal to Develop River Front on Yamuna River
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to develop river front on Yamuna river in near future; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise, especially in North East Delhi; (c) if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the details of such proposals for other rivers, State-wise? .

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the import percentage of the total crude oil requirement of our country during the last five years; (b) the data on the import dependence of crude oil during the last five years; (c) whether the Government has achieved the target level of 67 per cent import dependence of crude oil by the year 2022, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) the details of the measures taken to reduce dependence on imported crude oil and improve the energy security of the country; and (e) whether the policy of collective purchase by Indian refineries to improve the bargaining power has been implemented and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the number of students belonging to minority community who have been provided financial assistance for higher education under Maulana Azad National Fellowship scheme for minority students in Maharashtra during the last three years along with the amount of financial assistance provided therefor; and (b) the district and year-wise details thereof?

topic: Development of Ultra Mega Solar Power Projects
from: ['Chatterjee, Smt. Locket', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao']
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government had proposed to set up at least 25 Solar Parks and Ultra Mega Solar Power Projects targeting over 20,000 MW of solar power installed capacity within a span of five years starting from 2014-15; (b) if so, the details of the number of Solar Parks and Ultra Mega Solar Power Projects set up and ongoing 770 during the time schedule fixed along with their installed as well as actual capacity, State-wise; (c) whether the Government has enhanced the capacity of the scheme in 2017; (d) if so, the extent to which it has been enhanced and target achieved so far; (e) whether the Government is implementing schemes to support the States/UTs in setting up solar parks at various locations; and (f) if so, the funds provided under the said scheme so far including the current financial year, State/ UT-wise?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena', 'Biju Janata Dal', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

from: ['Tatkare, Shri Sunil Dattatray', 'Sharma, Shri Kuldeep Rai', 'Sule, Smt. Supriya Sadanand', 'Bhamre, Dr. Subhash Ramrao', 'Kolhe, Dr. Amol Ramsing']
contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the aims, objectives and modalities of implementation of workshed scheme for Khadi artisans in the country; (b) whether the Government provides financial assistance to artisans to construct workshed; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) the number of Khadi and other artisans benefited under the workshed scheme in Maharashtra, Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Tamil Nadu during each of the last five years and the current year; (e) the total number of Khadi artisans who were provided assistance for construction of worksheds in the said States under the workshed scheme for Khadi artisans during the last five years; (f) whether there is great boost to the sale Khadi products during each of the last three years and if so, the States which have contributed to the sale of Khadi products; and (g) the other steps taken by the Government to improve the income of Khadi artisans in the country?
party: ['Nationalist Congress Party', 'Indian National Congress', 'Nationalist Congress Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Nationalist Congress Party']

topic: Spice Jet Flight Service from Delhi to Bhavnagar
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to start Spice Jet flights services from Delhi to Bhavnagar via Surat; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor? .

from: ['Sharma, Shri Vishnu Datt', 'Sharma, Dr. Arvind Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether achievements have been made by the Green Rating for Integrated Habitat Assessment (GRIHA) Council to promote and administer green buildings in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Patil, Shri Unmesh Bhaiyyasaheb', 'Shinde, Dr. Shrikant Eknath', 'Vikhepatil, Dr. Sujay Radhakrishna', 'Gavit, Dr. Heena Vijaykumar', 'Mane, Shri Dhairyasheel S.']
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Governments plan for exploration of natural gas and petroleum reserve in the country; (b) the details of the Governments plan to increase the capacity strategic petroleum reserve in the country including the places identified for the expansion and the funds allocated for the same; (c) the details of the expenditure incurred by the Government for extending subsidies on various petroleum products during the last three years; (d) the details of the Governments plan to convert the existing infrastructure of petrol pumps and natural gas stores for promoting green alternatives like electric vehicles; and (e) the details of the expenditure incurred by the Government for various research and development projects?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Shiv Sena']

topic: Rashtriya Jal Jeevan Mission in Andhra Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether a team of Rashtriya Jal Jeevan Mission (RJJM) visited Andhra Pradesh during this year; (b) if so, the date including the details of the findings of the team in this regard including report thereof and if not, the time by which such a visit is likely to take place; 771 (c) the details of the budget allocated to Andhra Pradesh under RJJM and the amount of budget spent so far, year-wise; (d) the details of the number of houses in urban and rural areas of Andhra Pradesh where tap water is supplied including the targets fixed for supplying tap water in the rest of the houses; (e) whether the work of providing water through tap in each house under RJJM is moving at a slow pace in Andhra Pradesh as compared to the targets fixed; and (f) the efforts being made by the Government to achieve the said targets on time?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of schemes/initiatives undertaken by the Government in Assam; (b) the number of beneficiaries under the Naya Savera in Assam; (c) the details of Seekho aur Kamao (Learn & Earn) scheme; and (d) the number of beneficiaries from Assam under the Seekho aur Kamao (Learn & Earn) scheme?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether any proposal regarding upgradation of roads/highways in Budhni under Sehore district of Madhya Pradesh is lying pending with the Union Government for approval; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the time by which it is likely to be approved?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of rural households covered by the Nal se Jal scheme till date State and year-wise along with district-wise distribution in Rajasthan; (b) the details of rural households having sensor based drinking water supply under the Nal se Jal scheme . along with the steps taken by the Government to maintain accuracy of these sensors; (c) whether the Government conducts any water conservation training programmes at Panchayat level under the scheme and if so, the details of such initiatives conducted as of November 2021, State and year-wise along with district-wise initiative in Rajasthan; (d) the steps taken by the Government to encourage decentralised and community driven efforts to save water; (e) whether the Government is considering incentivising such community driven efforts; and (f) the established procedure and average time taken for the water to be restored in case of broken pipelines or connections?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to construct helicopter corridors to start helicopter services at all places across the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether any time limit has been fixed in this regard; (c) if so, the time by which it will be constructed; and (d) the details of districts and locations identified for the establishment of helicopter corridors in Uttar Pradesh?

from: ['Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar', 'Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath', 'Reddy, Shri Y. S. Avinash', 'Kanumuru, Shri Raghu Ramakrishna Raju']
contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details of MSMEs shut down/partially closed/ reported losses and those revived so far with the help of the Government and other bank loans during pre- pandemic during the last five years and the current year till date; (b) the losses suffered, State and MSME-wise including Andhra Pradesh and Telangana; and (c) the steps being taken by the Government to revive such MSMEs in the country? 772
party: ['Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

topic: Natural Gas Share in Countryâ€™s Fuel Basket
from: ['Rajenimbalkar, Shri Omprakash Bhupalsingh alias Pavan', 'Kumar, Shri Dhanush M', 'Kirtikar, Shri Gajanan Chandrakant', 'Annadurai, Shri C.N.']
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the details of present gas share in the countrys fuel basket vis--vis the world average; (b) whether the Government proposes to increase the present level of gas share in the countrys fuel basket and if so, the details thereof along with the steps taken/being taken by the Government to bring the gas share at par with the world average; (c) whether the Government has achieved the target of providing PNG connection to household in the country; (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (e) whether the Government has received proposals/ demands from various States for PNG coverage in their areas; (f) if so, the details thereof and the follow-up action taken by the Government thereon, State-wise; (g) the other steps taken by the Government to provide PNG connection to all the eligible household in a time bound manner?
party: ['Shiv Sena', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam', 'Shiv Sena', 'Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam']

contents: Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the outstanding dues of power distribution and transmission companies of DISCOMs have increased excessively in various parts of the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) the status in respect of Jharkhand in this regard; (c) the rate of increase in the outstanding dues of various DISCOMs during the last three years and the current year; and (d) the efforts being made by the Government to recover the said outstanding dues?

from: ['Tadas, Shri Ramdas Chandrabhanji', 'Patil, Shri Hemant Shriram']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS . be pleased to state: (a) the number of cities across the country which have been covered under Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Tansformation (AMRUT); (b) the criteria for selection of cities under the said mission; (c) the number of districts of Maharashtra which have been covered under the said mission; (d) whether Wardha and Amravati districts of Maharashtra have been included under the said mission; and (e) if so, the names of the cities which are availing benefits under the said mission?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) the current status of development of seaplane routes and water aerodromes across the country; and (b) the time by which commercial services of seaplanes for various destinations are likely to start functioning?

topic: Road Corridor between Hili and Mahendraganj
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has approved the development of road corridor between Hili in West Bengal and Mahendraganj in Meghalaya via Bangladesh; (b) if so, the details and the present status thereof; (c) whether the Union Government has recieved consent from the Bangladesh Government for the said project; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the steps being taken in this regard?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the main objectives of Deendayal Updhyay Yojana - National Urban Livelihood Mission (NULM) including the names of programmes covered thereunder; 773 (b) the number of persons benefitted through the said scheme so far; (c) whether there is a provision of any loan or grant for employment to the needy persons under the said scheme and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the financial contribution of the State Governments is also involved in the said scheme and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether Article 30 of the Constitution confers minorities religious or linguistic right to establish and administer educational institutions and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Honble Supreme Court has recently given judgement on appointment of teachers in Government aided minority educational institutions; (c) whether the Court also ruled that while monitoring appointments the interest of minority institutions will be given due weightage and care; (d) if so, whether his Ministry in consultation with HRD Ministry has no interference in privately run minority institutions; (e) if so, whether orders in this regard have been issued to States; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Integrated Command and Control Centres for Cities
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has begun to finalise its recommendations for providing Integrated Command and Control Centres (ICCCs) as a service to States and smaller cities; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the objectives of the creation of such centres; (c) whether there has been any delay in completion of many smart city projects and if so, the details thereof, State-wise including Punjab along with the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government is taking any measures to ensure the completion of the smart city projects within the stipulated time period; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plan to boost up the usage of CNG for long mobility in the country in order to reduce the carbon emission; (b) if so, whether it is also a fact that still many more cities are not ready with CNG infrastructure; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government proposes to cover all the districts in India for CNG stations; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reason therefor?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has data on homeless people in the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the number of homeless people in the country has increased since 1990 and if so, the details thereof during the last five years, year-wise; (c) the percentage of the homeless people benefited from the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Urban (PMAY-U) or any other such schemes; (d) the number of houses constructed by utilising PMAY-U funds alone in Tamil Nadu; and (e) the number of houses constructed under PMAY- U in collaboration with the State of Tamil Nadu?

from: ['Chaudhary, Shri P.P.', 'Joshi, Shri Chandra Prakash', 'Agrawal, Shri Rajendra', 'Gupta, Shri Sangamlal Kadedin']
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) the installed non-fossil fuel capacity in the country during the last three years and the current year, State-wise; (b) whether the Government proposes to expand this capacity in response to the growing concerns about climate change and if so, the details thereof; 774 (c) the percentage of electricity generated from renewables in 2019-2020; (d) whether the Government also proposes to increase the capacity of generation of electricity from renewable sources; and (e) if so, the details thereof?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details for the financial support extended by the Government under the Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI); (b) the details of the traditional clusters developed across the country including Odisha; (c) the details for the beneficiaries under the scheme in the country including Odisha; (d) the details for the new innovations, private- public partnerships and improved technologies to have developed under the scheme; and (e) the details for the non-government organizations, institutions of the Central and the State Governments, semi Government institutions, field functionaries of State and Central Government and Panchayati Raj institutions involved under the scheme?

from: ['Kumar, Shri Dhanush M', 'Kirtikar, Shri Gajanan Chandrakant', 'Annadurai, Shri C.N.']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has entrusted agencies with the responsibility of providing low cost houses in the cities, if so, the details of the names of the agencies and the number of such houses constructed by these agencies during each of the last three years and the current year; (b) whether the Government has set any target for these agencies to provide low cost houses in the cities; (c) if so, whether these agencies are unable to achieve the target; (d) if so, the reasons therefor along with the corrective steps taken by the Government in this regard; and (e) the other steps taken by the Government to provide low cost houses in cities in a time bound manner? .

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the increased number of road accidents near pedestrian crossings and if so, the the steps being taken to address the same; and (b) whether the Government is formulating policies to create a pedestrian friendly infrastructure and if so, the the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether there is any plan to reconstruct the National Highway (NH) No. 48 passing through Rajasthan; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Engagement of Social Institutions in NH Projects
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to involve social institutions for works like Horticulture, Sanitation in National Highway (NH) projects and facilities like eye and health check up camps for the vehicle drivers; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) the details of schemes in which such social institutions have been involved by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) so far?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the total funds spent on Chardam projects during the last three years and the current year and the time by which the said projects are likely to be completed; (b) the steps taken by the Government to protect the said project from natural disasters; 775 (c) whether the Government has set up any mechanism to ensure its quality and regular monitoring; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to enact any law to safeguard the interests of the dealers after closure of foreign vehicle companies in the country; (b) the steps taken by the Government for the people rendered jobless due to closure of such companies; (c) whether the Government proposes to direct such vehicle companies to provide compensation to the said people; (d)if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (e) the steps taken by the Government in the interest of the consumers in view of the problems faced by them for servicing of vehicles and other works related thereto after closure of such companies?

topic: Funds under Naya Savera Scheme for Maharashtra
contents: Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the funds transferred to the State of Maharashtra during the last three years under the Naya Savera scheme; (b)whether the Government proposes to increase the number of scholarships under this scheme in the State of Maharashtra; and (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has prepared any strategy to promote Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in the country; . (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has received complaints from public representatives regarding alleged harassment of those operating MSMEs set up in the country particularly Maharashtra; (d) if so, the details thereof during the last three years as on date; and (e) the action taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has prepared any action plan for the promotion of water conservation; for (b) the steps being taken by the Government to encourage the people and Non-Governmental the promotion of water Organisations conservation; (c) the steps taken by the Government for the promotion of water conservation so far; and (d) the funds spent by the Government for water conservation so far during the current financial year?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the number of applications received by the Government from meritorious students of minority communities for Post-matric, Pre-matric and Merit-cum- Means scholarship during last five years; (b) the details about the number of applicants separately, year and each scholarship for scheme-wise; (c) the number out of them who succeeded in getting scholarship during above said period along with the details of the beneficiaries, year and scheme-wise; and (d) the amount allocated and spent for these scholarship schemes, year and scheme-wise?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY 776 be pleased to state: (a) the details of largest floating solar power plant started recently by NTPC; (b) the details of advantages and disadvantages of floating solar power plants in the country; and (c) the details of incentives, assistance, etc., that the Government is giving for solar power generation particularly for floating solar power plants in the country, State-wise including Andhra Pradesh?
