from: ['Mahato, Shri Bidyut Baran', 'Gupta, Shri Sudheer', 'Jadhav, Shri Prataprao', 'Mandlik, Prof. Sanjay Sadashivrao', 'Pathak, Shri Subrat', 'Barne, Shri Shrirang Appa', 'Shukla, Shri Ravi Kishan', 'Kushawaha, Shri Ravindra']
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has formulated any new rules or guidelines for RT- PCR test report at various airports across the country for passengers flying in from at-risk countries and if so, the details thereof; (b) the names of the countries put in at-risk countries list by the Government; (c) the details of arrangements made and facilities provided by the Government for the passengers coming from at-risk countries at various airports across the country; (d) whether the Government has set up any designated Covid Care Centres for the passengers found positive at the airport and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government is aware that testing such a huge number of passengers at airport for new variant of corona would take quite a long time leading to suffering of passengers; and (f) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to ease out the problem faced by the passengers coming form these countries?

from: ['Siddeshwara, Shri Gowdar Mallikarjunappa', 'Mahajan, Smt. Poonam Pramod']
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes for development of renewable energy sources in the country and has set a target of 4.50 lakh Megawatts (MW) of production by 2022; . (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the steps taken/proposed to be taken by the Government to promote renewable energy sources in a big way across the country by adopting suitable methods, increasing the investments and protecting the Purchasing Power Agreements (PPAs); and (d) the extent to which these steps are successful?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details of the steps taken by the Government to encourage and promote MSMEs during the last three years; (b) whether the Government has promoted MSMEs in Rajasthan also during the said period; (c) if so, the details of the progress made, works carried out etc. in respect of Rajasthan, district-wise; and (d) the budget allocated for MSMEs in Rajasthan along with the details of the expense made, district/ head/scheme-wise during the last three years?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether a significant amount of electricity is wasted in domestic sector due to leakages, faulty appliances and usage of inefficient electric devices etc.; (b) if so, the details of energy wasted during the last three years, year and State-wise; (c) the power consumed in the domestic and industrial sector during the said period along with the schemes under implementation for Demand Side Management (DSM) including saving and conservation of electricity; (d) whether the Union Government has introduced some special schemes to provide cash incentives to States saving energy and minimizing leakage/theft; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY 777 be pleased to state: (a) the details of the pledges announced by the country at the UN Climate Change Conference in Glasgow (COP26); (b) the details of the current share of renewables in the countrys energy mix with the potential and installed capacity, source and State/UT-wise; (c) the details of the renewable energy capacity utilisation with the growth rate and capacity under- utilised, source and State/UT-wise; (d) the details of the dependence of electricity generation on coal and non-fossil fuel; (e) whether the country is in line to meet the updated COP26 pledges with respect to energy from renewable resources and non-fossil fuel based electricity capacity; and (f) if so, the details thereof with the timeline of implementation and landmarks till 2030 and mechanism of accountability and compliance?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether work is being done by the Government under any special scheme for flood management in the States of Assam, West Bengal and Bihar which are the most affected areas from flood and if so, the details thereof; (b) the problems being faced by the Government in implementing the above said schemes and the steps being taken to overcome them; and (c) the amount allocated and sanctioned by the Government for the purpose during the last three years?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the present status of constuction work on National Highways (NHs) Nos. 63, 361 and 750K in Latur, Maharashtra including Tembhurni to Latur and Ashta to Udgir road; (b) whether it is fact that the conditions of the roads in Maharashtra have become very poor due to excessive rainfall and repairing work is being carried out at a very slow pace by the concerned contractors; (c) if so, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government proposes to complete all these projects within a stipulated time limit and if so, the details thereof; . (e) the total length of stretch under these projects on which construction work is going on in Latur district along with the funds likely to be spent thereon; and (f) the total cost of the said project and the funds allocated and spent thereon so far?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to create favorable conditions to propel and boost Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) sector under Ease of Doing Business; (b) the success achieved so far in this regard during the last two years; (c) whether the Government has formulated any model law to regulate the functioning of MSMEs in the country and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether all the States across the country including Telangana have adopted/are implementing the said law and if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the steps taken/being taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the generation of power is in accordance with the demand in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of the target fixed for electricity generation during the last five years and the current year; and (d) the actual quantum of electricity generated during the said period?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has conducted any study to ascertain the extent of losses suffered by the MSMEs which had to shut down due to Covid induced lockdown and various reasons during the last three 778 financial years in view of the latest NCRB report which states that there is a 29 per cent increase in suicides committed by businesspersons in 2020 as compared to 2019. ; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (c) whether the Government has any database for the MSMEs that have been forced to shut down due to various reasons during the last two financial years, if so, the details thereof, State-wise and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to establish projects for supplying or proposes to supply Piped Natural Gas (PNG) in all cities of the country; (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise; (c) whether any such project is running or established in Gujarat; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao', 'Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the number of proposals received from the State Governments for declaration of State Highways as National Highways (NHs) during the last three years and current year so far; (b) the criteria fixed by the Union Government for declaring SHs as NHs; (c) the details of the proposals found eligible as per the criteria for declaring SHs as NHs, State-wise, particularly belonging to Maharashtra; and (d) the time by which these proposals are likely to be approved?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: . (a) whether the Government proposes to cover Koshi region especially Supaul in Bihar under the Helicopter Policy in the country; and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Singh, Shri Bhola', 'Sonkar, Shri Vinod Kumar', 'Naik, Shri Raja Amareshwara']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the National Capital Region Planning Board (NCRPB) has prepared the Regional Plan, 2021 to provide broad inter-related policy framework for harmonious and balanced development of the region; (b) if so, the details thereof including the funds spent on the projects related with Regional Plan, 2021; (c) whether the NCRPB has completed Regional Plan, 2021 and if so, the details thereof; (d) the major transport projects undertaken by the NCRPB in Uttar Pradesh during the last five years and proposed to be taken in Uttar Pradesh in near future; (e) whether the NCRPB has received any road development proposal from the Government of Uttar Pradesh; and (f) if so, the details thereof including funding to the projects in Uttar Pradesh during the last three years?

contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to expand four lane National Highway (NH)-149 from Pitiri to Pallahara in Angul and Dhenkanal districts of Odisha; and (b) if so, the details and the present status thereof?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has been able to track the progress in achieving the targets set for production of electricity from renewable energy sources; 779 (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to tap the potential of ocean waves for the production of electricity and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the status of electricity generation from different renewable energy sources as on 31st December, 2020?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has the data of villages which dont have drinking water facilities; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the schemes being implemented by the Government currently to facilitate drinking water facilities; (d) the details thereof along with the fund allocation; and (e) whether the Government has the data of people who died due to the lack of drinking water in the country?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) and two other public sector oil firms are planning to install Electric Vehicle (EV) outlets in the next three to five years to reduce carbon intensity and hit net zero emissions by 2070 in different parts of the country; (b) the details and the number of such outlets proposed in the next three to five years; and (c) whether North East Region will also be covered under this, if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor?

topic: New Technology / Extension Centers in Porbandar
contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the time by which new technology centres/ extension centres are likely to be set up by the Government in Porbandar district; and (b) the plan prepared by the Government to set up technology centre for Sea Food Industry and Fisheries Industry located at the coastal areas of Porbandar? .

from: ['Reddy, Shri Y. S. Avinash', 'Kanumuru, Shri Raghu Ramakrishna Raju']

topic: Inter-linking of Godavari and Cauvery Rivers
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any action plan to inter-link the river Cauvery with the Godavari and transfer the surplus water to Tamil Nadu through a series of canals; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the National Highway (NH) on Jowai- Badarpur section is in dilapidated condition; (b) if so, whether any maintenance work is being carried out on the said NH; (c) if so, the present status thereof; and (d) if not, the time by which the maintenance work is likely to be undertaken?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) the number of villages which have adopted solar energy in the country; 780 (b) whether the Government provides subsidy to install solar panels in villages and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether any subsidy is provided to adopt solar energy for commercial purposes; (d) if so, the amount along with the scheme under which the said subsidy is provided; and (e) the number of villages which are being provided electricity 24X7 along with the number of villages which are still deprived of the said facility?

from: ['Bordoloi, Shri Pradyut', 'Gandhi, Shri Feroze Varun', 'Gogoi, Shri Gaurav']
contents: Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Ministry is taking any steps to increase awareness about its schemes in the North East and Uttar Pradesh, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government provides any weightage to North East and Uttar Pradesh while considering proposals for minority related schemes, if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is taking measures to safeguard interest of religious minorities in view of NCB data according to which communal riots registered an increase of 96 per cent in 2020 over the previous year; (d) whether the Government has any data on economic loss suffered by religious minorities on account of said violence and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the Government has any data on displacement of religious minorities on account of violence and if so, the details thereof; and (f) whether the Government is taking any steps to safeguard interests of ministries and promote communal harmony in the said States and if so, the details thereof?

contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Lift Irrigation Projects (LIP) being taken up by the Government during the last five years, State-wise; (b) the funds sanctioned to each States in this regard, State/UT-wise; (c) the steps being taken to complete all the lift irrigation projects in a timebound manner?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) the salient features of the National Smart Grid Mission; (b) the number of smart meters installed in the country, under Phase 1 and 2 of the Mission, State-wise; and (c) whether the Government has undertaken any study to analyse the benefits of smart-meters over conventional meters; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any steps to revive Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises that were worst affected due to two lockdown periods during of COVID-19 pandemic; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has any further proposals to push the revival of the MSMEs sector, including spinning mills and hosiery sector, which contribute significantly to the GDP of the country; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Shewale, Shri Rahul Ramesh', 'Bapat, Shri Girish Bhalchandra', 'Sahu, Shri Chandra Sekhar', 'Munde, Dr. Pritam Gopinath Rao']
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the names of the States which contribute eighty five percent of the total road fatalities in the country; (b) whether the Government has rolled out /proposes to roll out a State Support Programme amounting to Rs. 7270 crore for strengthening the road safety to help realise the vision of zero road fatalities on Indian roads and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to implement centrally-sponsored six-year programme to incentivise the State Governments to curb road accidents and achieve a reduction in such fatalities; 781 (d) if so, the funds allocated /proposed to be allocated to States for strengthening road safety, State- wise; (e) whether the Government proposes to make road safety audit mandatory on State Highways and urban roads; (f) if so, the details thereof along with the existing machenism working presently; and (g) the steps taken/proposed to be taken by the Government in this regard?
party: ['Shiv Sena', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Biju Janata Dal', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Development of Solar Energy in Rural Areas
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes any scheme to develop solar energy in rural areas and to use it as a resource; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes any plan to train youth and build plants in the respective areas and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government has prepared any outline in this regard; (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (f) whether the Government is likely to consider it in near future and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Drinking Water Testing and Monitoring Programme
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the number of cases where drinking water supplied by the establishments which supply public drinking water have been tested across the country under the Drinking Water Testing and Monitoring Program during the last three years; (b) the reasons for the failure of drinking water samples in large number; and (c) the permanent mechanism set up by the Government to ensure the supply of clean drinking water of good quality to the citizens by public drinking water supply institutions?

from: ['Raghavendra, Shri B. Y.', 'Simha, Shri Prathap', 'Jolle, Shri Annasaheb Shankar', 'Jadhav, Dr. Umesh G.']
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of new water resource projects sanctioned to the State of Karnataka during the last three years and the current year; (b) the details of the funds allocated and spent for these projects during the said period, project and year- wise; (c) the present status of each of these projects along with the steps taken to expedite completion of each of these projects; (d) the funds allocated by the Central Water Commission (CWC) for lift irrigation projects in Karnataka during the last three years and the current year, project/ year-wise; and (e) the progress achieved in the implementation of lift irrigation projects in Karnataka?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal to declare Upper Bhadra Lift Irrigation Project as national project, if so, the details therof along with the funds likely to be shared by the Center and the State for the said project; (b) the time by which the project is likely to be completed; (c) whether the Government has received any objections from other riparian States for undertaking the said project, if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor; (d) whether it is true that project envisages irrigating 2.25 lakh hectares in Chitradurga, Chikmagalur, Tumkur , Davanagere districts of Karnataka and if so, the details thereof; (e) the details of number of tanks and dams likely to be filled in with the said lift irrigation project; (f) whether the project will solve the problems of underground water in these area; and (g) whether the Government has received any request from the State of Karnataka in this regard and if so, the details thereof?

topic: Employment Related Schemes in Tribal Areas
contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , 782 be pleased to state: (a) the details of the schemes being implemented for employment relating to micro and small enterprises in the tribal areas; (b) the details of the schemes being implemented in the tribal areas of Madhya Pradesh; (c) whether any new scheme has been proposed in this regard in the tribal areas; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Amendments to Electricity (Rights of Consumers) Rules,  2020
contents: Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government would consider amending Electricity (Rights of Consumers) Rules, 2020 to provide for compensation to consumers by the State Electricity Regulatory Commissions (SERCs) on case-to- case basis after giving reasonable opportunity of being heard to the Licensee; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the concept of automatic compensation under Rule 13 of the Electricity (Rights of Consumers) Rules, 2020 is in contradiction to Section 57(2) of the Electricity Act, 2003; (d) if so, the details thereof including the reasons therefor; (e) whether the Government would consider to specify the Electricity (Rights of Consumers) Rules, 2020 as guidelines for State Commissions to incorporate in their respective supply codes and achieve within a period of two-three years; and (f) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: DPR of Flood Management of Manas  and Beki Rivers
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has resubmitted Detailed Project Report (DPR) of the scheme Integrated Flood and Erosion Management of Manas and Beki rivers in districts of Baksa and Barpeta in Brahmaputra Valley to the Central Water Commission (CWC), if so, the details thereof along with the reasons for delay in implementing erosion control measures; and (b) whether the CWC is convinced with the revised DPR or the revised budget and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Singh, Shri Sunil Kumar', 'Mohan, Shri P. C.']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of funds released to various Urban Local Bodies for improvement of city infrastructure in Jharkhand and Karnataka States during the last five years especially in Latehar, Chatra and Palamu districts; (b) whether the Government has received reports regarding inferior quality of infrastructure created utilizing central funds and if so, the details thereof; and (c) the corrective steps taken by the Government in this regard?

topic: Young Professionals in National Water Mission
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has engaged the young professionals in National Water Mission (NWM); (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the outcome of the work done by the young professionals?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken cognizance of power/electricity theft and its impact on distribution companies in various States across the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) the details of the illegal methods involved in the theft of power by consumers, State-wise; (c) whether the Government has booked any cases on those who are involved in the power theft and if so, the details of the cases registered, pending and convicted during the last five years and the current year, State- wise; (d) if not, the reasons therefor; (e) the details of the power theft by commercial and domestic consumers separately during the said period, State-wise; and (f) the details of the number of watts of power theft and losses suffered by the distribution companies annually during the said period, State-wise?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details of new provisions of the Government for Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI); (b) the manner in which it is beneficial for rural industries; (c) whether the Government proposes to include more commodities under it by expanding its base and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the number of rural people estimated to be benefited by it including the details of funds provisions made in this regard?

contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the various developmental schemes being implemented by the Ministry at present in the State of Chhattisgarh; (b) the details of heads/items for which the funds have been allocated to Chhattisgarh during the last three years and the current year; and (c) the current status of the schemes?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any data regarding the total number of Functional Household Tap . Connections granted district-wise under Jal Jeevan Mission; (b) if so, the details regarding the same for the Financial Year 2019-20 and 2020-21 for the district of Kozhikode; (c) whether the Government has any report regarding the water scarcity being faced by Kozhikode district in summers and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the Government has any data regarding performance of various rural and urban bodies of Kozhikode under Swachh Bharat Mission and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that about seventy five kilometers stretch of road from Jalore district centre to Sirohi district centre is in a dilapidated condition and if so, the reaction of the Government thereto; (b) whether the traffic at Akoli in Jalore and Jawal river in Sirohi gets halted during heavy rains and the citizens have to face a lot of problems and if so, the remedial measures taken by the Government in this regard; (c) whether the Government proposes to construct a road to connect both the district centres from Swaroopganj to Krishnaganj and Kalandril Balut Mandali to Jalore district cetnre under PM Gati Shakti NMP; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: . (a) whether the Union Government in consultation with the State Governments is formulating any scheme to improve the quality of living in low ranked cities in Ease of Living Index-2020; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the major sectors in which these cities have scored less?

topic: Ground Water Level in Urban  Areas
from: ['Gupta, Shri Sudheer', 'Jadhav, Shri Prataprao', 'Barne, Shri Shrirang Appa', 'Mandlik, Prof. Sanjay Sadashivrao', 'Pathak, Shri Subrat', 'Shukla, Shri Ravi Kishan', 'Mahato, Shri Bidyut Baran']

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of funds provided by the Government to various cities under the Smart Cities Mission (SCM) during the last two years; (b) the impact of Covid on projects under SCM; (c) the steps taken by the Government to ensure completion of projects under SCM; (d) the details of work done by cities in Uttar Pradesh under SCM; (e) whether there are instances of non-disbursement of funds by States and UTs and if so, the details thereof; (f) whether development work in cities identified under SCM is being carried out on a large scale in the country; (g) if so, the details thereof, State-wise and if not, the reasons therefor?

topic: Reserve and Demand of Oil and Natural Gas
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the reserves and demands of oil and natural gas in the country at present; (b) the expenditure made in the import of oil from the year 2010 till date, year-wise; (c) the amount spent so far on the exploration of natural gas reserves from the year 2010 till date, year- wise; and (d) the details of the efforts made by the Government to promote the use of natural gas and to reduce the dependence on oil?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government in collaboration with the Central Water Commission (CWC) undertakes efficient river canalisation in the State of Punjab in order to stop damage by surface run-off and floods, if so, the details thereof; (b) the details of centrally sponsored schemes to prevent erosion in critical areas as a flood management measure; (c) whether any survey or study has been conducted during the last five years, to identify causes for surface run-off other than lack of proper irrigation practices and if so, the details thereof; and . (d) the details of funds sanctioned and allocated for technical guidance for flood management during each of the last three years?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to grant the status of National Highways (NHs) to Bhawanipatna - Muniguda - Bissamcuttack - Rayagada - Parvatipuram - Vizianagaram stretches; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government also proposes to grant NH status to Gunupur - Baliguda (Phulbani) via Padmapur - Gudari - Chandrapur stretches; and (d) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Rawat, Shri Ashok Kumar', 'Sagar, Shri Arun Kumar']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether work is being carried out under Smart Cities Mission and Swachh Bharat Mission-Urban in the country particularly in Misrikh and Shahjahanpur Parliamentary Constituencies of Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof in Uttar Pradesh particularly in Misrikh and Shahjahanpur Parliamentary Constituencies including their updated status as on date; and (c) the details of the Central funds allocated including the utilisation of the said funds during each of the last three years and as on date, State-wise?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether many National Highway (NH) projects in the country have been identified for completion by the year 2024; (b) if so, the total number of pending projects in all the States including in Gopalganj district of Bihar; (c) the name of all States where problem of land acquistion is the cause of non-completion of such projects; 788 (d) whether the Government is continuously monitoring/ pursuing with the concerned States for better and quicker implementation of these projects; and (e) if so, the number of meetings held for the purpose in the recent past?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the eligibility criteria to apply for the scholarships provided by his Ministry; (b) whether there is a cap on the scholarships provided each year; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) the data on the total funds allocated for the scholarships under his Ministry; and (e) the State-wise data on the number of scholarships awarded till date?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to introduce any new system for issuance of renewable energy certificates and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government also proposes to take any steps in this regard; (c) if so, the details thereof along with the time by which the steps are likely to be taken; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor? .

topic: Power Crisis due to Shortage of Coal
contents: Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to tackle the coal shortage and consequent power crisis; (b) whether the Government had received representations from States/UTs regarding power shortage and crisis and if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of steps taken by the Government to alleviate the problems being faced by States/UTs with regard to power crisis issues; (d) the details of the States where new projects or expansion have been undertaken to alleviate power crisis issues along with budgetary allocation and expenditure incurred thereon; and (e) the expected time by which the said projects are likely to be completed?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the road transportation system of the country requires immediate modernization and latest technology and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has appointed a set of agencies/commissions for maintenance and construction of roads but there is lack of coordination between the agencies and the Government which is adversely affecting work output and if so, the details thereof; (c) the funds sanctioned for implementation of the schemes for strengthening public transport system; (d) whether the Government is aware of the fact that the length of National Highways (NHs) and State Highways (SHs) has increased tremendously vis-a-vis stagnant growth of public transport in the country; and (e) if so, the details thereof and the action taken to augment the public transport system in proportion to increase in NHs and SHs?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has given clearance to Tungabhadra Board for undertaking of Upper Bhadra project in the State of Karnataka and if so, the details thereof; 789 (b) whether the opinion of lower riparian States of Andhra Pradesh and Telengana has been taken in this regard, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government proposes to direct the Government of Karnataka to stop undertaking of Upper Bhadra Project and if so, the details thereof; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government had invited pre- qualification bids from certain construction firms including the private construction firms for each Office under Central Vista Project; (b) if so, the details thereof including project cost of this executive enclave project and details of Offices that would have to be accomodated; and (c) the time line fixed for completion of the project?

topic: Oil and Gas Projects for NER
