Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any initiative to produce biodiesel in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of existing biodiesel production in the country, State-wise; (d) whether the research institutes in the country have been asked to concentrate in the matter; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether any steps have been taken or are proposed to be taken by the Government to open Technical Training Centers for the training of beauty parlor, tailoring, electrician, vehicle mechanic for the employment of the youths in minority dominated areas falling under Shahjahanpur Parliamentary Constituency of Uttar Pradesh; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the details of the progress made in this regard so far? 790

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether there has been an increase in the price of domestic Liquefied Petroleum Gases (LPG); (b) whether the Government has noticed that this serious issue is affecting the common man; (c) if so, the details of LPG price hikes from 2019 onwards and the reasons therefor; (d) whether the Government has taken or plans to take measures to stabilise the price of domestic LPG through the means of reducing tax or increasing and restoring subsidy and if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (e) the details of the policy of the Government for subsidy on LPG for domestic use?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is of the opinion that Kochi One Card being used in Kochi Metro Rail, turned a headache to customers, if so, the details thereof including the reasons for the cancellation of cards of many customers; (b) whether Kochi Metro Rail Ltd. (KMRL) explained that the present drawback was as a result of financial institutions failure to behave and if so, the details including the e-filing facility provided at metro stations; (c) whether in the beginning, Kochi Metro was very dear to the people and somewhere in the growth trajectory, there occurred some kind of public disconnect and if so, the details including the attempts to reconnect this with commuters; and (d) whether the Kochi One Card pass can be converted into a Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) card and one can do away with KYC formalities and if so, the details including the realization of using RFID cards thereof?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that issues of driver fatigue, drowsiness and lack of sleep often lead to fatal road crashes in the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has any proposal to frame a policy for fixing the driving hours for commercial drivers on the lines of pilots; (c) if so, the details thereof and the extent to which the new policy is expected to reduce the road accidents; and (d) the time by which the new policy is likely to be implemented?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that business expenses have been paid to CVOs of HPCL vide Document Nos.20043774/20059136/20066160/20072422/ 21011860/21026211/21026211/21034135/21045417 and 21061317 during 2020 and 2021; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Government has initiated or proposes to intiate inquiry in this matter, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the number of youths benefitted under Seekho aur Kamao a skill development initiative for minorities, year and State/UT-wise; (b) the funds allocated and utilised under the scheme during the current financial year; (c) the steps taken by the Government for wide publicity of the scheme so that more youths are benefitted under the initiative; and (d) the other measures taken/proposed to be taken by the Government for skill development and providing employment opportunities to unemployed minority youths in the country?

topic: Setting up of Multipurpose Convention Centre at Rajkot
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received a proposal for setting up a multipurpose convention centre at Rajkot; (b) if so, the details thereof along with funds allocated so far and the total estimated cost of the project including the details of land acquisition and pre- construction activities; (c) the details of clearances and NoCs obtained for the purpose; and (d) the time by which the proposed multipurpose convention centre would be operationalised?

topic: Bypass at Chilakaluripet in Andhra Pradesh
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details and the present status of Chilakaluripet Standalone bypass in the State of Andhra Pradesh; (b) whether it is true that the project has been approved and Rs. 800 crores have been provided for the purpose; and (c) if so, the details thereof and the time by which the project is likely to be completed?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to expand airports in cities like Aligarh and Kurukshetra; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government proposes to develop the airports and airstrips in Aligarh and if so, the details thereof; and (d) the plan of the Government to promote learning and training in aviation sector for the poor students who want to make their career in the said sector?

topic: Sanitisation and Water for All Scheme
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI . be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that United Nations (UN) is implementing a scheme called Sanitisation and Water for All (SWA); (b) if so, the details including the salient features thereof; (c) whether India is a member of SWA; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) whether the UN is providing financial or any other assistance to its members for implementing the scheme; and (f) if so, the details of such assistance received by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of the role and functions of the proposed North East Water Management Authority (NEWMA); (b) whether the body plays a role in managing inter- State water disputes in North-Eastern Region; (c) the details of composition of the Governing Council and the Executive; and (d) whether the Authority would have adequate representation of civil society, ecologists, environmental activists etc.?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any policy to preserve and research the Khussa (Punjabi Jutti) handicraft to promote its export and marketing; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that according to the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) report dated 01 November , 2021, only 53078 out of the sanctioned 91,926 houses have been built in the State of Tripura and if so, the details thereof; 792 (b) whether this project has been implemented since 2014 and if so, the hindrances that are causing delay in completing the project; and (c) the projected completion date of rest of the houses?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken by the Government to deal with the problem of shortage of drinking water due to drying up of natural sources in the Himalayan region during the last few years; (b) the steps taken/being taken by the Government for conservation and recharging of natural sources of water; (c) whether any monitoring system has been put in place to monitor the status of natural sources of water and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether the new technologies are being adopted for conservation and upgradation of conventional water sources and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is paying due attention to the repair and maintenance of National Highways (NHs); (b) if so, the details thereof and the funds allocated/ spent for maintenence and repair of NHs during the last three years and current year; and (c) the role of States in repair and maintenance of NHs?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to ban regular international flights and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the new variants of Omicron causes great concern among all the countries and if so, the details thereof; and (c) whether the Government has received any suggestions to not permit for international flights to fly in India and if so, the steps being proposed by the Government to ensure safety of the people of the country from the possible threat of Omicron?

topic: Proposals for Declaring SHs as NHs
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government has received any proposals from the State Governments particularly from Odisha for declaration of State Highways (SHs) as National Highways (NHs) during the last three years and the current year; (b) if so, the steps taken by the Union Government thereon; (c) the criteria fixed by the Union Government for declaring SHs as NHs; (d) the details of the proposals which fulfil all the prescribed conditions and found eligible for declaring as NHs, State-wise particularly from Odisha; and (e) the time by which these proposals are likely to be approved?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of present status of implementation of Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT), State-wise; and (b) the details of total State Annual Action Plan approved, completed and is in progress under AMRUT, State- wise?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details of particulate matter released in the atmosphere by MSMEs in India; 793 (b) the details carbon dioxide emissions of MSMEs in India, State and sector-wise; (c) the incentives that have been offered to MSMEs to switch to renewable sources of energy; (d) the details of Air Pollution Control Devices (APCDs) that are installed in MSMEs in India, district- wise; and (e) the details and the number of MSMEs in the country that are powered by renewable energy, district- wise?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether cases of technical snags on runway involving Air India and others were reported during the last few months, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether incidents of emergency landing immediately after the take off were also reported recently; (c) if so, the details thereof; and (d) the steps proposed by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) to prevent such incidents in the future?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the National Highway (NH) projects which are under execution and those which are pending during the last three years and the current year in the country particularly in Rajasthan; and (b) the details of the funds allocated and spent thereon?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the number of LPG cylinders given free of cost under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package (PMGKP) of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana to provide relief from Covid-19 crisis in the country, State-wise including Bijnor Parliamentary Constituency; and (b) the details of per barrel price the Government has to pay on crude oil purchase from Russia, Angola, . Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and United Arab Emirates etc. along with the details of taxes and import duty imposed, country-wise?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether it is true that there is a lack of coordinated approach while formulating policies for rejuvenation of water bodies and to check encroachement, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government plans to bring one scheme with Inter-Ministerial and Inter-Departmental coordination instead of several schemes; (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (d) whether the maintenance of water bodies including the water bodies being used for various agricultural purposes, slums and commercial activities is very poor and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the Union Government intends to push the State Governments to include the water bodies in the land records so as to allow them to take immediate action against the encroachers and keep such water bodies encroachement free and if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Reddy, Shri Adala Prabhakara', 'Madhav, Shri Kuruva Gorantla']
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to construct new parking bays in Tirupati, Vijayawada and Rajahmundry airports; and (b) if so, the details thereof including the current status of progress made so far?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

topic: Inter-linking of Rivers in West Bengal
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of inter-linking of rivers projects completed/being implemented in West Bengal during the last five years including physical and financial achievement till date; and (b) whether any other inter-linking of river projects will also be taken up in a phased manner and if so, the details thereof? 794

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether Airports Authority of India (AAI) has accused the Adani Group for violating the contract rules in the management of airports and the logo affixing of names; (b) if so, the details thereof including the complaint received against Adani Group in this regard; (c) whether any action is being taken or proposed to be taken against Adani Group; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Increase in Price of Petroleum Products
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the prices of petroleum products has increased in the country; (b) if so, the main reasons therefor along with the steps taken by the Government to check it; (c) the percentage increase in the revenue received due to the increase in the prices of petroleum products along with the profit from Government taxes during each of the last three years and the current year; and (d) the details of various taxes responsible for the said increase in prices, State-wise?

topic: Disruption of Prayer Sites of Minorities
contents: Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken cognizance of the disruption of prayer sites of minorities in Haryana, Karnataka and other parts of the country; (b) if so, the steps taken to protect the religious rights of these minorities; (c) the interim relief measures offered to the minorities facing violence; (d) whether any cases have been registered against those inciting violence at minority prayer sites in Haryana, Karnataka and other parts of the country; and (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details and the present status of construction of four lane road to Krishnapatnam port from Naidupeta and from Gangavaram port to Visakhapatnam port in Andhra Pradesh; and (b) the funds allocated and utilised thereon till date, project-wise?

topic: Use of Dynamite in Road Construction in Hilly Areas
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether excessive use of dynamite in road construction in hilly areas has adversely affected the area; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the corrective measures being taken by the Government in this regard?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the rapidly increasing pollution level in the country; (b) if so, whether vehicular pollution is the leading cause for such increasing level of pollution; (c) if so, the details thereof along with the reaction of the Government thereto; (d) whether the Government is considering to promote eco-friendly means of transportation to control and reduce the level of vehicular pollution and if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether the Government is aware of the environmental benefits of carpooling as an efficient and eco-freindly means for transportation and if so, the reaction of the Government in this regard?

from: ['Singh, Shri Mahabali', 'Bidhuri, Shri Ramesh', 'Chellakumar, Dr. A.', 'Oja, Smt. Queen']
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI 795 be pleased to state: (a) the status of work done under Swachh Bharat Mission(SBM) in States/UTs during the last three years including Bihar, Assam and Tamil Nadu; (b) the total number of toilets constructed under Swachh Bharat Mission in States/UTs during the last three years; (c) the funds sanctioned/released/utilised for construction of the said toilets during the last three years, district and year-wise; and (d) the number of toilets proposed to be constructed in the districts of the aforesaid States under SBM in the coming years?
party: ['Janata Dal (United)', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Indian National Congress', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Houses to Urban Poor under PMAY-U
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any data regarding the houses given to urban poor people under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) during the last five years; (b) if so, the details of houses sanctioned, State- wise particularly in Ajmer and Jaipur districts of Rajasthan; and (c) the number of application pending with the Government regarding the allocation of houses to the poor under PMAY-U and the action taken by the Government to approve the applications quickly, State-wise?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether sewer line project work under Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) of the Union Government is given to a company of Hyderabad which was to complete the work in 24 months but has not completed the same even in four years and if so, the action taken by the Government for delay in work; (b) whether company took more than 48 months for 153 Km long sewer line work which was to be completed in 24 months whereas the agreement was for upto March, 2021 only but work is still being continued and till date 6530 households have been connected to sewer line and more than 15000 households are yet to be connected and if so, the reasons therefor; (c) whether sub-standard quality of digging work is being done by the company and the digging work is causing asthma/respiratory diseases to a number of people and even patchwork is not being done and if so, the reasons therefor; . (d) whether the Government proposes to stop payment to the company immediately and to blacklist the company and if so, the reaction of the Government thereto; and (e) whether a certificate of completion has been given to the company by the department in this regard, if so, the details thereof and the details of investigation being conducted in the matter?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that regular supply of water to the people is still a challenge in Aurangabad of Maharashtra even after being included in the list of smart city; (b) if so, the details thereof and the steps taken by the Government in this regard; (c) the present status thereof; and (d) the time by which the said work is targetted?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of cities in Odisha which are covered under Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT); (b)the funds allocated and released under AMRUT for cities in Odisha during the last three years and the current year; and (c)the details of the projects sanctioned in Odisha under AMRUT till date along with the progress and completion status thereof?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the number of projects being run by GAIL (India) Limited in Ranchi Lok Sabha Constituency along with their cost; 796 (b) the number of households in Ranchi where gas has been supplied through pipelines along with the plan for expansion of the said work in future; and (c) the details of works being carried out by GAIL (India) Limited under CSR in Ranchi?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the work of feeder line has been carried out in Jhabua and Alirajpur districts under Ratlam Lok Sabha Constituency; (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the time by which the said work is likely to be completed; (d) whether various Majras/Tolas of Jhabua and Alirajpur districts have not been electrified so far and if so, the details thereof; (e) whether there is any plan to complete the said work; and (f) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any plans to lay a LPG gas pipeline in Jaunpur district and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government proposes to open CNG/ PNG centres in the district and if so, the details thereof along with the time by which it is likely to be opened; and (c) the details of the steps taken by the Government to promote/introduce CNG/PNG in the said district?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal for widening of National Highways (NHs) into four/six/eight lanes; . (b) if so, the details thereof, State-wise including Madhya Pradesh; (c) the funds allocated and utilised for the purpose, NH-wise, during the last three years and the current year; (d) whether the Government proposes to construct bridges at required locations on all NHs to prevent accidents and ensure smooth travel; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

from: ['Dilip, Shri Saikia', 'Kaushik, Shri Ramesh Chander', 'Prakash, Adv. Adoor']
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the current status of Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM); (b) whether the Government has reviewed the implementation of JJM and has noted delay in implementation of the scheme in any State, (c) if so, the details thereof and the measures taken by the Government to achieve the target; (d) whether the Government has fixed any accountability in this regard, if so, the details thereof; and (e) the details of funds released and utilized during the last three years and the current year, State-wise?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Indian National Congress']

contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of several widening/four-laning of National Highway (NH) projects which are held up or work thereon is going on at a very slow pace in the country including Maharashtra and if so, the reaction of the Government thereto; (b) whether the Government proposes to impose heavy penalty on the contractors responsible for such delayed projects which are causing road accidents and blockages and causing damages to vehicles and wastage of time; (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the remedial measures being taken by the Government in this regard; (d) whether the contractors on several NHs have started charging toll tax without completing the NH projects; (e) if so, the details thereof along with the reasons therefor and the steps being taken by the Government in this regard? 797

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware that the airlines are charging exorbitant rate during the peak season and if so, the details thereof along with the steps taken to check it; (b) whether the Government proposes to fix a maximum charge in ticket to each destination and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government is also aware that the companies cancel the tickets booked early without the request of the person and sell the tickets at higher rate during peak season; (d) if so, the action taken by the Government to prohibit such illegal cancellation; and (e) whether it is a fact that the companies are not providing accommodation and food to the passengers during the cancellation and inordinate delay of the flights and if so, the action taken by the Government to provide sufficient service?

topic: Mega Solar Power Plant in Ladakh
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether Changthang Landscape have been identified as the main and the only site of proposed Mega Solar Power Plant in UT of Ladakh; (b) if so, the details thereof including the name of the site of the plant; (c) whether the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) and the Social Impact Assessment (SIA) have been carried out with regard to the proposed Mega Solar Power Plant in UT of Ladakh; and (d) if so, the details of the agency thereof and if not, the reaction of the Government thereto?

topic: Facilities for Differently Abled Persons in Buildings under Central Vista Project
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether provisions for accessibility for differently abled persons have been made in the proposals for the . proposed Parliament building and other buildings under the Central Vista Project and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the project follows the guidelines reflected in the Handbook for Barrier Free and Accessibility published by the CPWD; (c) if so, the range of disabilities taken into account and the details regarding the accessible ramps, elevators, platform lifts, railings, handrails, entrances, doors, corridors and rest rooms to be made available in the said buildings; and (d) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the advantage of FASTag system for toll collection in the country; (b) whether the Government has any plan to use GPS based toll collection in near future and if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of amenities likely to be extended to the public after the additional amount of toll collection as a result thereof; and (d) whether the Government has any plan to improve the condition of highways with the collection of huge amount of toll from the public and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the foundation stone of Jewar airport in Uttar Pradesh has been laid; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the details of airports, helipads and aerodromes constructed in the country during the last seven years; (d) whether the number of airports, heliports and water aerodromes in the country is likely to be increased to 220 by the year 2024-25 to further increase the regional connectivity; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is imposing any new taxes on per litre production and cost of diesel and petrol which can lead to rise in their prices; (b) the amount of the tax imposed by the Government on petrol and diesel at present; (c) whether the Government is considering to reduce the tax with an aim to bring down the prices of petrol and diesel and if so, the details thereof; (d) the amount of tax imposed by the State Government of Rajasthan; and (e) the reasons for higher prices of petrol and diesel in Rajasthan as compared to Haryana?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government proposes to repair 75 to 100 years old ponds and canals; (b) if so, the details including the funds sanctioned thereof, State-wise; (c) the details of irrigation capacity of these ponds and canals, State-wise; (d) the details of number of 75 to 100 year old ponds for the repair of which proposals have been sent by the Government of Madhya Pradesh along with the number of proposals out of the said proposals sanctioned; (e) the details of number of such ponds and canals in Seoni and Balaghat Parliamentary Constituency; and (f) whether funds have been or likely to be provided by the Union Government for the repair of the said ponds and canals in Madhya Pradesh including Seoni and Balaghat if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the objective of Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) is to provide tap water in each rural house by the year 2024; (b) if so, whether the entire Uttar Pradesh is covered under the mission; (c) if so, the names of districts where this mission is being implemented in an effective manner; . (d) whether Badaun, Bilsi, Bisauli, Sahaswan, Dataganj, Shekhupur, Gunnaur, Padrauna, Unchahar, Pratapgarh districts of Uttar Pradesh have also been included under this mission; (e) if so, the names of blocks identified in this regard; and (f) the number of houses in Uttar Pradesh in which tap water is going to be provided under this mission?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has assessed the impact of Corona on Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps being taken by the Government for promoting employment in the said sector, giving loan relief to these enterprises and carrying out skill development of the personnel in the changing times in the country including Bundelkhand?

from: ['Reddy, Shri P.V. Midhun', 'Patil, Shri Sanjay(Kaka) Ramchandra']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government for disaster prevention and mitigation in cities for building urban resilience; (b) whether the Government has taken steps to promote development of technical and technological innovations for building disaster-resilient cities and if so, the details thereof; and (c) the manner in which the Government is ensuring that standard data models and methodologies be in place for data collection and processing for resilience building among cities?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the details of the Members including posts of the Committee constituted by the Department in Coir 799 Board for compassionate appointement of the dependents of deceased; (b) the reasons for not taking decision regarding the appointments of dependents of deceased by the said committee so far along with the details thereof; (c) the details of the applicants, date of birth, date of application, educational qualification and the relation with the deceased to seek compassionate appointment in Coir Board; (d) whether the right to seek compassionate appointment by the dependent of deceased in the department gets lapsed after the completion of more than seven years; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) the maximum time limit for compassionate appointment sought by the dependent of deceased along with the details thereof?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the list of approved and unapproved projects as per the notification issued by the Ministry on 15th June 2021; (b) whether the directions of the Ministry with respect to the approved and unapproved projects are being followed by the respective States; (c) whether the Krishna River Management Board (KRMB) and the Godavari River Management Board (GRMB) have commenced functioning as envisaged by the Ministry; (d) the number of times the apex council concerning the Krishna and Godavari river water issues between the States of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh has met so far and the major decisions taken by the council; and (e) the progress of the implementation of the decisions taken in the apex council meetings?

topic: Price Hike of Petrol and Diesel
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has increased price of petrol and diesel for more than 70 times during 2021; (b) if so, the details thereof, date-wise; (c) the details of increase in price of crude oil in international market during 2021, date-wise; and . (d) whether the Government has the data of petrol and diesel in terms of Indian rupee in Nepal, Bangladesh, Pakistan and Bhutan on respective dates of increase in India during 2021 and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the present status of work on Indore-Ichhapur National Highways (NH)-347 BG; (b) whether tender process for NH-347 BG and NH-753 L from Indore to Ichhapur has been completed; (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) the time limit fixed by the Government for completion of the said project?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received any proposal from Uttar Pradesh regarding the construction of some roads and rail over bridges in different parts of the State particularly between Lucknow and Gonda; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the action taken by the Government thereon?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether any funds have been sanctioned for development of industrial areas in Ujjain; (b) if so, the amount of funds sanctioned along with the progress made in this regard so far; (c) whether any scheme is being formulated for development of clusters in Ujjain; (d) if so, the details thereof; and (e) whether any funds have been sanctioned in this regard? 800

topic: JJM in Rural Districts of Assam
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of the rural districts of Assam benefitted under the Jal Jeevan Mission; (b) the total number of villages benefitted in Guwahati Rural District of Assam; (c) whether any norms have been set up by the Government for the cleanliness of drinking water available under the said scheme; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

topic: Inclusion of Dalit Muslims and Christians in SC category
contents: Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to estimate the number of Dalit Muslims and Dalit Christians living in the country post the 2008 National Minorities Commission Report; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government recognises that non- recognition of such persons in the Scheduled Castes category hamper them from availing the protections and benefits extended by the Constitution and other laws and schemes; (d) whether the Ministry has raised demands for the inclusion of Dalit Muslims and Christians in the Scheduled Castes (SC) Category through an amendment to the Constitution (Scheduled Castes) Order, 1950; and (e) if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether any action plan has been prepared by the Government to inter-link the Daman Ganga, Vaitarna and Pinjal rivers located in Konkan with the Godavari river; (b) if so, the time by which the said work is likely to be started along with the estimated funds provided for this purpose; and (c) if not, the reasons therefor? .

topic: Scheme for Transportation of Agricultural Products
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has launched any scheme for providing assistance to farmers in transporting agricultural products on national and international routes; and (b) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether a large number of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) remain outside the purview of the organized sector and do not get benefits under State and Central schemes and if so, the reasons therefor; (b) the total number of MSMEs registrations under the Udyog Aadhaar Memorandum since the platforms inception and the details thereof; and (c) the total number of unregistered MSMEs in the country and the details thereof?

topic: Piped Drinking Water Supply under DDA Housing Scheme
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the provisions made by Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to ensure piped drinking water supply to residents of 1214 flats owners of Sector E1, Vasant Kunj Society of DDA under Housing Scheme, 2019; (b) the alternative plans DDA has adopted to provide safe and pure drinking water to residents of above flats; (c) whether it is a fact that most of the flats are facing seepage issue; and (d) if so, the action being taken by the DDA in this regard?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS 801 be pleased to state: (a) the steps taken by the Government to address the housing requirement of the people belonging to the Economically Weaker Section (EWS), Lower Income Group (LIG) and Medium Income Group (MIG) category in urban areas; (b) the details of under construction/constructed houses sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) during each of the last three years, State-wise; and (c) the total number of houses targeted to be constructed in urban areas during 2020-24 under the said scheme?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the total number of proposals regarding minority welfare received by the Union Government from the Government of West Bengal for sanction during the last three years; (b) the total number of proposals out of these which have been sanctioned along with the number of proposals lying pending; and (c) the time by which the pending proposals are likely to be sanctioned?

from: ['Singh, Shri Rajiv Ranjan Alias Lalan Singh', 'Kumar, Shri Kaushalendra']
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of schemes being run by the Government under the Namami Gange Programme in Bihar to make the river Ganga and all its tributaries clean; (b) the present status of all the above said schemes; (c) whether any action plan has been started in Bihar to deal with the problem of sewerage and to remove the sand silt deposits from Ganga river; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has undertaken any study to find out the shortage of housing especially for lower and medium income categories keeping in view the present demand and availability of houses in the country; (b) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise particularly in Uttar Pradesh; (c) whether the Government has formulated any plan in this regard; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has taken any step for the safe landing and resuming the operations of wide- bodied aircraft in Calicut International Airport after the crash last year; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has constituted any committee for submitting the report on the above context; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to produce 175 GW of renewable energy which would consist of 100 GW from solar energy, 10 GW from bio-power, 60 GW from wind power, and 5 GW from small hydropower plants by the year 2022; (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the present status of the target achieved therefrom along with the achievements in the field of green energy so far?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) the number of airports selected/proposed under UDAN scheme for domestic travel in Karnataka; 802 (b) the details of airports developed/to be developed for operation under the UDAN scheme in Karnataka; and (c) whether there has been demands for connecting more airports from Karnataka under the said scheme and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that there had been cases where inordinate delay has occurred in the process of sanctioning of loans at different stages under Prime Ministers Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP); and (b) if so, the details of the remedial steps taken by the Government in this direction?

Will the Minister of MINORITY AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the details of the funds sanctioned for Nai Roshni Scheme during the last three years in the State of Tamil Nadu, district-wise; (b) the details of expenditure made out of the funds allocated therein; (c) whether the Government has undertaken the steps to ensure that beneficiaries have attained socio- economic empowerment post training in the State; and (d) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) the funds provided by the Government under various schemes of the Ministry during the last five years; (b) whether the works under the schemes have been completed within the stipulated time period; (c) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (d) whether the Government has fixed any accountability in this regard and if so, the details thereof? .

Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the number of retail outlets, both petrol and diesel, whose licences have been terminated for selling adulterated fuel during the last three years, company- wise as well region-wise in Uttar Pradesh; (b) the details of the terminated licences which have been revoked or given to a new vendor, oil company and region-wise; and (c) whether it is true that operating a retail outlet on Company Owned Company operated (COCO) basis is loss making venture even then large number of outlets are being operated on COCO basis and if so, the rationale behind this COCO scheme?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Union Government and the Government of Nepal have signed an agreement to build dams on the rivers originating from Nepal; (b) if so, the progress made in this regard and the time by which it is likely to be completed; and (c) if not, whether the Union Government is considering any such agreement with the Government of Nepal so as to protect North Bihar from the ravages of floods every year and to ensure availability of water for hydroelectric power projects?

Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) the details and the present status of construction work on National Highway (NH)-55 in the districts of Cuttack and Jagathsinghpur; (b) whether any bottlenecks are being faced for early construction of the said project; and (c) if so, the details thereof along with the remedial measures being taken by the Government in this regard?

topic: SFURTI in Haryana and Madhya Pradesh
from: ['Sharma, Dr. Arvind Kumar', 'Sharma, Shri Vishnu Datt']
contents: Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) whether any efforts have been made under the Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI) in the States of Haryana and Madhya Pradesh especially in Rohtak, Jhajjar, Panna, Chhatarpur and Katni districts respectively; (b) if so, the details and the outcomes thereof; and (c) if not, the reasons thereof?

topic: Basic Price of Petrol and Diesel
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) the Basic price of Petrol and Diesel per litre as on 01.06.2014 and on 05.11.2021; and (b) the total amount of taxes, surcharge and cess levied by the Union Government per litre as on 01.06.2014 and on 05.11.2021?

Will the Minister of MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES , be pleased to state: (a) the salient features of the Prime Minister Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) which is managed by Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC) as the Nodal Agency; (b) the details of women and individuals from scheduled tribes/tribal background which have been supported through the PMEGP; and (c) the details of the beneficiaries of the PMEGP from Gujarat and the number of enterprises from the State started as a result of support provided through the PMEGP?

topic: NHs Connecting Jharkhand with Other States
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the work on several National Highways (NHs) is going on to connect the State of Jharkhand with other States in the country; and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor? .

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) the details of number of water bodies like lakes, ponds, puddles, wells and stepwells in the country along with the present status thereof; (b) the details of efforts made by the Government for rejuvenation of the said water bodies for ground water management during the last five years, State-wise; (c) the methods being adopted for ground water recharge; (d) whether the Government is aware that the ground water resources across the country have been illegally occupied by anti-social elements; (e) if so, the details thereof and the action taken by the Government in this regard, State-wise; and (f) the measures taken by the Government so far to make the said resources free from illegal occupation and for its rejuvenation in order to secure ground water for future?

topic: Audit of Expenditure of Private Companies by CAG
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has proposed to conduct an audit by Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) of the expenditure of private companies in Public- Private Partnership (PPP) projects; (b) if so, the details thereof along with the present status of such proposals and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) the present norms for auditing such expenditures; (d) whether the Government has any mechanism to check the genuineness of the cost escalation reported by companies under PPP projects; (e) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; and (f) the corrective measures taken or proposed by the Government in this regard?

topic: Transfer of Projects to KRMB and GRMB
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the Government has transferred all the major and medium irrigation projects in Telangana to Krishna River Management Board (KRMB) and the Godavari River Management Board (GRMB); and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor? 804

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that according to Ground Water Resources Assessment 2017, the ground water in almost 80 per cent of the blocks are over-exploited, if so, the details thereof; (b) whether it is a fact that arsenic is a toxic substance hazardous to human health and in at least 13 blocks of the State of Punjab, its presence is more than the safe limit, if so, the details thereof and the reasons therefor including Ropar Block; and (c) the details of the steps being taken by the Government to prevent the contamination of ground water?

Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has any proposal for discounted fare for travel in Air India by the Ministers, Members of Parliament, Members of State Legislative body, the Government officials etc. after its take-over by Tata group; and (b) if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether it is a fact that the second phase of Nagpur Metro Rail project is still under consideration of the Government despite the fact that it has been announced in the General Budget of the year, 2021; (b) if so, the reasons therefor along with the details for not sanctioning the said project, not finalizing the funding agency and not issuing the tenders in this regard; (c) the effective steps taken by the Government to start the said project at the earliest; (d) the extent to which the construction work in respect of the first phase of the said project has been completed and the time by which the remaining works are likely to be completed; (e) the time limit fixed by the Government in this regard; and . (f) whether the construction work of double-decker bridge/flyover in Kamthi road is hindered due to non- completion of construction work under first phase of the said project and if so, the steps taken to compete the said work at the earliest?

Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has launched the first international network of global inter-connected solar power grid called the Green Grids Initiative - One Sun One World One Grid; (b) if so, the details thereof including the countries which are a part of this initiative; (c) whether the Government is aware that maintaining grid stability would be a challenge under this initiative in view of the evolving nature of geopolitics in the new world order and changing relationship amongst different countries and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether such initiative would lead to cost saving given the fact that supply of energy through the grid would require electricity to be transmitted thousands of kilometers and if so, the details thereof; and (e) the time by which the said Green Grids Initiative is likely to be implemented?

Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has undertaken any projects for enhancing basic amenities in Santhal Pargana of Jharkhand and if so, the details thereof; (b) the funds earmarked for this purpose during the last three years and the current year; and (c) the time line by which the projects would be completed?

topic: Promotion and Use of New and Renewable Energy
contents: Will the Minister of NEW AND RENEWABLE ENERGY be pleased to state: (a) whether the National Solar Mission has been useful in augmenting the renewable energy; 805 (b) if so, the details thereof and the present share of renewable energy in total requirement of energy; (c) whether the cost of different renewable energy per unit is lower than the conventional energy; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to bring down the cost of renewable energy, type-wise; and (f) the incentives given to individuals and institutions to promote generation and use of new and renewable energy?

topic: Funds for Shri Guru Ram Das Ji International Airport
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) the details of fund allocated to Shri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport under Krishi UDAN scheme Launched in year 2020 for exporting agricultural produce to assist farmers in transporting agricultural products on international and national routes; (b) whether the Government proposes for a convergence model or pilot project for catchment of the said airport, if so, the details thereof and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government announced Amritsar- Dubai route under Krishi UDAN scheme to enable transportation of baby corn on this sector and if so, the details thereof; and (d) whether other products, vegetables, fruits from Majha region and neighbouring States of Himachal Pradesh and Jammu and Kashmir catchment are also being transported from Amritsar airport and if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government provides any financial assistance for construction of individual Rain Water Harvesting Structure(RWHS); (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to boost construction of RWHS at large scale across the country?

topic: Incentive for Early Completion of Road Projects
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS . be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to provide bonus of ten percent of the total cost of the road project to the firms completing the work one year before the stipulated time in order to incentivise early completion of the project; (b) if so, the number of projects at present which are likely to be completed on time or before the stipulated time; (c) the number of firms which have been provided the said bonus by the Government so far; (d) the number of road projects which are pending for ten years along with the steps taken by the Government to complete the said projects; (e) whether ten thousand kilometre stretch of road is targeted to be constructed during the current financial year; and (f) if so, whether the said target is likely to be achieved?

from: ['Singh Deo, Smt. Sangeeta Kumari', 'Roy, Dr. Jayanta Kumar', 'Majumdar, Dr. Sukanta', 'Singh, Shri Bhola', 'Sonkar, Shri Vinod Kumar', 'Naik, Shri Raja Amareshwara']
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to implement the Air Sewa Portal and mobile app for addressing the grievances of air passengers in the country and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Air Sewa 2.0 has also been launched and if so, the details thereof; (c) whether the Government has engaged any agency to resolve complaints of air passengers and if so, the details thereof; (d) the number of various complaints registered by the air passengers during the last three years and the current year; and (e) the number of complaints resolved during the said period and the steps being taken by the Government to provide hassle free and comfortable journey to air passengers?
party: ['Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party', 'Bharatiya Janata Party']

topic: Encroachment on Footpaths in Group Housing Societies
from: ['Gao, Shri Tapir', 'Bhavana Gawali (Patil), Ms.', 'Jadhav, Shri Sanjay Haribhau']
contents: Will the Minister of HOUSING AND URBAN AFFAIRS 806 be pleased to state: (a) whether encroachment on footpaths is increasing due to commercial activities (opening of milk booth/ departmental store) started/being run by the Government in Group Housing Societies and particularly in East Delhi (IP extension) Group Housing Societies and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has taken notice of rising encroachment on footpaths due to opening of shops and departmental stores in East Delhi (I.P. Extension) Group Housing Societies; (c) if so, the immediate action taken by the Government to check the same particularly to check the encroachment on both sides of the road adjoing the footpath of Narvana Apartment of Gurudwara road in Madhu Vihar; (d) whether the Government has formulated any action plan to tackle the problem of traffic jam on the roads in these Group Housing Societies in future; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) whether any steps are being taken by the Government to address the problem of encroachment likely to happen in future due to such commercial activities and make the footpaths/roads encroachment- free by removing the encroachment?

from: ['Vanga, Smt. Geetha Viswanath', 'Reddy, Shri Kotha Prabhakar']
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is giving special push for ethanol as a fuel and Rs.30000 crore would be saved on import; and (b) if so, the details and present status in this regard?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

topic: Bringing of Petrol and Diesel under GST
from: ['Singh, Shri Uday Pratap', 'Katheria, Prof. (Dr.) Ram Shankar']
contents: Will the Minister of PETROLEUM AND NATURAL GAS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government proposes to bring diesel and petrol under GST; (b) if so, the time frame fixed for the same and if not, the reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government is formulating any scheme to bring uniformity in the prices of diesel and petrol across the country; (d) if so, the details thereof; . (e) whether the Government proposes to formulate any policy to bring uniformity of tax collected from the States to keep oil product prices under control and to curb black marketing across borders; and (f) if so, the time frame fixed for the same and if not, the reasons therefor?

from: ['Pasunoori, Shri Dayakar', 'Borlakunta, Shri Venkatesh Netha', 'Maloth, Smt. Kavitha', 'Reddy, Dr. Gaddam Ranjith']
contents: Will the Minister of CIVIL AVIATION be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has identified 13 additional airports for privatization; (b) if so, the details thereof; (c) the status of earlier privatized airports, airport- wise; and (d) the details of airports that are under private management in the country so far, State-wise?
party: ['Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi', 'Telangana Rashtra Samithi']

from: ['Madhav, Shri Kuruva Gorantla', 'Beesetti , Dr. Venkata Satyavathi', 'Chinta Anuradha, Smt.']
contents: Will the Minister of ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government has received a proposal for six-laning of Anakapalli-Annavaram-Diwancheruvu sections of National Highway (NH)-16 in Andhra Pradesh; and (b) if so, the details and the present status thereof?
party: ['Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party', 'Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party']

from: ['Rana, Smt Navneet Ravi', 'Manne, Shri Srinivas Reddy']
contents: Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government provides financial assistance and other help for setting up of water treatment/purification plants in the country under National Rural Drinking Water Programme (NRDWP); and (b) if so, the details thereof, State/UT-wise including Amravati in Maharashtra during each of the last three years along with the funds sanctioned/allocated/utilised for each year in respect of each State including the number of beneficiaries covered under this scheme? 807

Will the Minister of JAL SHAKTI be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is aware of the repeated landslides and floods occuring in the State of Kerala and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the Government proposes to send a team of experts to study about the recent floods and landslides; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) whether the Government is also considering a detailed study on the recurring floods in Kerala that is rapidly changing the topography of the region; and (e) if so, the details thereof?

Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) the steps being taken by the Government to empower NHPC; (b) the list of new projects being undertaken by NHPC; NEW DELHI; December 17, 2021 Agrahayana 26, 1943 (Saka) (c) whether there has been a delay in giving final vigilance clearance to the incumbent CMD of NHPC who was appointed CMD a little over a year and a half back; (d) if so, the reasons leading to delay in granting of this vigilance clearance; and (e) if the vigilance clearance has not been granted yet, should the incumbent CMD be continuing?

topic: Electricity Demand due to Revival of Business/ Industry
contents: Will the Minister of POWER be pleased to state: (a) whether the Government is facing electricity demand due to revival of business/industry after post Covid-19 second wave and if so, the details thereof; (b) whether the power generation is affected due to refusal of Coal India Ltd. (CIL) to supply coal to the power generating companies; (c) if so, the details thereof; (d) the details of CILs net receivables as on date and the steps taken to recover the amount; (e) whether the Government is having any proposal to import coal; and (f) if so, the details thereof? UTPAL KUMAR SINGH Secretary General
